Low Normal High

Ecclesiastes

SummaryFear God and keep His commandments, because this applies to every person.” (12:13).
    Outline
  2. 1. Introduction  ( 1:1⁠–⁠11 )
  3. a. Introduction to The Teacher  ( 1:1 )
  4. b. Everything is Futile  ( 1:2⁠–⁠11 )
  5. 2. The Teacher’s Investigation  ( 1:12⁠–⁠6:12 )
  6. a. With Wisdom Comes Sorrow  ( 1:12⁠–⁠18 )
  7. b. The Futility of Pleasure  ( 2:1⁠–⁠11 )
  8. c. The Wise and the Foolish  ( 2:12⁠–⁠17 )
  9. d. The Futility of Labor and Reward  ( 2:18⁠–⁠6:12 )
  10. i.   The Futility of Work  ( 2:18⁠–⁠26 )
  11. ii.  To Everything There Is a Season  ( 3:1⁠–⁠8 )
  12. iii. God’s Works Remain Forever  ( 3:9⁠–⁠15 )
  13. iv. From Dust to Dust  ( 3:16⁠–⁠22 )
  14. v.  The Evil of Oppression  ( 4:1⁠–⁠12 )
  15. vi. The Futility of Power  ( 4:13⁠–⁠16 )
  16. vii. Approaching God with Awe  ( 5:1⁠–⁠7 )
  17. viii. The Futility of Wealth  ( 5:8⁠–⁠20 )
  18. ix. The Futility of Life  ( 6:1⁠–⁠12 )
  19. 3. The Teacher’s Conclusions  ( 7:1⁠–⁠12:14 )
  20. a. The Value of Wisdom  ( 7:1⁠–⁠14 )
  21. b. The Limits of Human Wisdom  ( 7:15⁠–⁠29 )
  22. c. The Wise Man and the King  ( 8:1⁠–⁠17 )
  23. i.   Obey the King  ( 8:1⁠–⁠9 )
  24. ii.  Fear God  ( 8:10⁠–⁠13 )
  25. iii. God’s Ways Are Mysterious  ( 8:14⁠–⁠17 )
  26. d. Life Is Fleeting  ( 9:1⁠–⁠11:10 )
  27. i.   Death Comes to Good and Bad  ( 9:1⁠–⁠6 )
  28. ii.  Enjoy Your Portion in This Life  ( 9:7⁠–⁠12 )
  29. iii. Wisdom Is Better than Strength  ( 9:13⁠–⁠18 )
  30. iv. Wisdom and Folly  ( 10:1⁠–⁠20 )
  31. v.  Cast Your Bread upon the Waters  ( 11:1⁠–⁠6 )
  32. vi. Enjoy Your years  ( 11:7⁠–⁠10 )
  33. e. Final Conclusions  ( 12:1⁠–⁠14 )
  34. i.   Remember Your Creator  ( 12:1⁠–⁠8 )
  35. ii.  The Whole Duty of Man  ( 12:9⁠–⁠14 )

1
Introduction

דִּבְרֵי֙ קֹהֶ֣לֶת בֶּן־דָּוִ֔ד מֶ֖לֶךְ בִּירוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

H1697דִּבְרֵי֙diḇ-rê   (N-mpc)
H1697 דָּבָר dâbâr daw-baw from דָבַר; a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause; act, advice, affair, answer, idiom any such (thing), because of, book, business, care, case, cause, certain rate, phrase chronicles, commandment, idiom commune(-ication), phrase concern(-ing), phrase confer, counsel, phrase dearth, decree, deed, idiom disease, due, duty, effect, phrase eloquent, errand, (evil favoured-) ness, phrase glory, phrase harm, hurt, phrase iniquity, phrase judgment, language, phrase lying, manner, matter, message, (no) thing, oracle, idiom ought, idiom parts, phrase pertaining, phrase please, portion, phrase power, promise, provision, purpose, question, rate, reason, report, request, idiom (as hast) said, sake, saying, sentence, phrase sign, phrase so, some (uncleanness), somewhat to say, phrase song, speech, idiom spoken, talk, task, phrase that, idiom there done, thing (concerning), thought, phrase thus, tidings, what(-soever), phrase wherewith, which, word, work. 		דִּבְרֵי֙diḇ-rê The words N-mpc

H1121 בֵּן bên bane from בָּנָה; a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.); phrase afflicted, age, (Ahoh-) (Ammon-) (Hachmon-) (Lev-) ite, (anoint-) ed one, appointed to, (phrase) arrow, (Assyr-) (Babylon-) (Egypt-) (Grec-) ian, one born, bough, branch, breed, phrase (young) bullock, phrase (young) calf, idiom came up in, child, colt, idiom common, idiom corn, daughter, idiom of first, phrase firstborn, foal, phrase very fruitful, phrase postage, idiom in, phrase kid, phrase lamb, (phrase) man, meet, phrase mighty, phrase nephew, old, (phrase) people, phrase rebel, phrase robber, idiom servant born, idiom soldier, son, phrase spark, phrase steward, phrase stranger, idiom surely, them of, phrase tumultuous one, phrase valiant(-est), whelp, worthy, young (one), youth. 		בֶּן־ben- the son N-msc

H3389 יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם Yᵉrûwshâlaim yer-oo-shaw-lah-im rarely יְרוּשָׁלַיִם; a dual (in allusion to its two main hills (the true pointing, at least of the former reading, seems to be that of יְרוּשָׁלֵם)); probably from (the passive participle of) יָרָה and שָׁלַם; founded peaceful; Jerushalaim or Jerushalem, the capital city of Palestine; Jerusalem., 		בִּירוּשָׁלִָֽם׃bî-rū-šā-lim. in Jerusalem Prep-b | N-proper-fs
1 The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.Ecclesiastes 1:1
Stats
Counts: 63 characters, 10 words, 49 letters, 18 vowels, 31 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דִּבְרֵי֙ קֹהֶ֣לֶת בֶּן־דָּוִ֔ד מֶ֖לֶךְ בִּירוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

Lit: The words of the Teacher the son of David king in Jerusalem

KJV: The words of the Preacher, the son of David, king in Jerusalem.
References

"the Preacher"
Ec 1:12: I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
Ec 7:27: Look: this have I found: says the preacher: counting one by one: to find out the account:
Ec 12:8-10: Vanity of vanities: says the preacher; all is vanity.
Ne 6:7: you have also appointed prophets to preach of you at Jerusalem: saying: There is a king in Judah: and now will it be reported to the king according to these words. Come now therefore: and let us take counsel together.
Ps 40:9: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: indeed: I not have refrained my lips: O LORD: you knowest.
Isa 61:1: The Spirit of the Lord GOD is upon me; because the LORD has anointed me to preach good tidings to the meek; He has sent me to bind up the brokenhearted: to proclaim liberty to the captives: and the opening of the prison to them that are bound;
Jon 3:2: Arise: go to Nineveh: that great city: and preach to it the preaching that I bid you.
2Pe 2:5: not spared the old world: but saved Noah the eighth person: a preacher of righteousness: bringing in the flood upon the world of the ungodly;

"king"
Ec 1:12: I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
1Ki 11:42: 43: The time that Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel was 40 years.
2Ch 9:30: Solomon reigned in Jerusalem over all Israel 40 years.
2Ch 10:17-19: But as for the children of Israel that dwelt in the cities of Judah: Rehoboam reigned over them.

Everything is Futile

הֲבֵ֤ל הֲבָלִים֙ אָמַ֣ר קֹהֶ֔לֶת הֲבֵ֥ל הֲבָלִ֖ים הַכֹּ֥ל הָֽבֶל׃

H1892 הֶבֶל hebel hehbel or (rarely in the abs.) הֲבֵל; from הָבַל; emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb; idiom altogether, vain, vanity. 		הֲבֵ֤לhă-ḇêl Vanity N-msc

H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		הַכֹּ֥לhak-kōl all Art | N-ms

2 Vanity of vanities, says the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity.Ecclesiastes 1:2
Stats
Rank: #2652 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 74 characters, 9 words, 59 letters, 24 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֲבֵ֤ל הֲבָלִים֙ אָמַ֣ר קֹהֶ֔לֶת הֲבֵ֥ל הֲבָלִ֖ים הַכֹּ֥ל הָֽבֶל׃

Lit: Vanity of vanities says the Teacher Vanity of vanities all is vanity

KJV: Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity.
References

"Vanity of vanities, saith the Preacher, vanity of vanities; all is vanity."
Ec 2:11: 15: 17: 19: 21: 23: 26: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought: and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and: look: all was vanity and vexation of spirit: and there was no profit under the sun.
Ec 3:19: For that which befalls'>befalls'>befalls the sons of men befalls'>befalls'>befalls beasts; even one thing befalls'>befalls'>befalls them: as the one dies'>dies: so dies'>dies the other; yes: they have all one breath; so that a man has no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.
Ec 4:4: 8: 16: Again: I considered all travail: and every right work: that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 5:10: He who loves'>loves silver will not be satisfied with silver; nor he who loves'>loves abundance with increase: this is also vanity.
Ec 6:11: Seeing there be many things that increase vanity: what is man the better?
Ec 11:8: 10: But if a man live many years: and rejoice in them all; yet let him remember the days of darkness; for they will be many. All that comes is vanity.
Ec 12:8: Vanity of vanities: says the preacher; all is vanity.
Ps 39:5: 6: Look: you have made my days as an handbreadth; and my age is not ashing before you: truly every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.
Ps 62:9: 10: Surely men of low degree are vanity: and men of high degree are a lie: to be laid in the balance: they are altogether lighter than vanity.
Ps 144:4: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passs away.
Ro 8:20: For the creature was made subject to vanity: not willingly: but by reason of him who has subjected the same in hope:

H4100מַה־mah-   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מַה־mah- What Interrog

H8121 שֶׁמֶשׁ shemesh sheh-mesh from an unused root meaning to be brilliant; the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement; phrase east side(-ward), sun (rising), phrase west(-ward), window. See also בֵּית שֶׁמֶשׁ. 		הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃haš-šā-meš. the sun Art | N-cs
3 What profit has a man of all his labour which he takes under the sun?Ecclesiastes 1:3
Stats
Rank: #1970 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 71 characters, 15 words, 56 letters, 20 vowels, 36 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מַה־יִּתְרֹ֖ון לָֽאָדָ֑ם בְּכָל־עֲמָלֹ֔ו שֶֽׁיַּעֲמֹ֖ל תַּ֥חַת הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃

Lit: What profit has a man from all his labor in which he toils under the sun

KJV: What profit hath a man of all his labour which he taketh under the sun?
References

"profit"
Ec 2:22: For what has man of all his labour: and of the vexation of his heart: wherein he has laboured under the sun?
Ec 3:9: What profit has he who works in that wherein he labours?
Ec 5:16: This also is a sore evil: that in all points as he came: so will he go: and what profit has he who has laboured for the wind?
Pr 23:4: 5: not Labour to be rich: cease from your own wisdom.
Isa 55:2: For what reason do you spend money for that which is not bread? and your labour for that which satisfies not? listen diligently to me: and eat you that which is good: and let your soul delight itself in fatness.
Hab 2:13: 18: Look: is it not of the LORD of hosts that the people will labour in the very fire: and the people will weary themselves for very vanity?
Mt 16:26: For what is a man profited: if he will gain the whole world: and lose his own soul? or what will a man give in exchange for his soul?
Mr 8:36: 37: For what will it profit a man: if he will gain the whole world: and lose his own soul?
Joh 6:27: not Labour for the meat which perishes: but for that meat which endures to everlasting life: which the Son of man will give to you: for Him has God the Father sealed.

"under"
Ec 2:11: 19: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought: and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and: look: all was vanity and vexation of spirit: and there was no profit under the sun.
Ec 4:3: 7: Yes: better is he than both they: which has not yet been: who has not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.
Ec 5:18: Look that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink: and to enjoy the good of all His labour that He takes under the sun all the days of His life: which God gives Him: for it is His portion.
Ec 6:12: For who knows what is good for man in this life: all the days of his vain life which he spends as a shadow? for who can tell a man what will be after him under the sun?
Ec 7:11: Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.
Ec 8:15-17: Then I commended mirth: because a man has no better thing under the sun: than to eat: and to drink: and to be merry: for that will abide with Him of His labour the days of His life: which God gives Him under the sun.
Ec 9:3: 6: 13: This is an evil among all things that are done under the sun: that there is one event to all: yes: also the heart of the sons of men is full of evil: and madness is in their heart while they live: and after that they go to the dead.

H935בָּ֔אbā,   (V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms)

H5769לְעוֹלָ֥םlə-‘ō-w-lām   (Prep-l | N-ms)
H5769 עוֹלָם ʻôwlâm o-lawm or עֹלָם; from עָלַם; properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always; alway(-s), ancient (time), any more, continuance, eternal, (for, (n-)) ever(-lasting, -more, of old), lasting, long (time), (of) old (time), perpetual, at any time, (beginning of the) world (phrase without end). Compare נֶצַח, עַד. 		לְעוֹלָ֥םlə-‘ō-w-lām forever Prep-l | N-ms
H5975עֹמָֽדֶת׃‘ō-mā-ḏeṯ.   (V-Qal-Prtcpl-fs)
H5975 עָמַד ʻâmad aw-mad a primitive root; to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive); abide (behind), appoint, arise, cease, confirm, continue, dwell, be employed, endure, establish, leave, make, ordain, be (over), place, (be) present (self), raise up, remain, repair, phrase serve, set (forth, over, -tle, up), (make to, make to be at a, with-) stand (by, fast, firm, still, up), (be at a) stay (up), tarry. 		עֹמָֽדֶת׃‘ō-mā-ḏeṯ. abides V-Qal-Prtcpl-fs
4 one generation passs away, and another generation comes: but the earth abides for ever.Ecclesiastes 1:4
Stats
Counts: 93 characters, 10 words, 75 letters, 32 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דֹּ֤ור הֹלֵךְ֙ וְדֹ֣ור בָּ֔א וְהָאָ֖רֶץ לְעֹולָ֥ם עֹמָֽדֶת׃

Lit: One generation passes away and another generation comes but the earth forever abides

KJV: One generation passeth away, and [another] generation cometh: but the earth abideth for ever.
References

"One generation"
Ec 6:12: For who knows what is good for man in this life: all the days of his vain life which he spends as a shadow? for who can tell a man what will be after him under the sun?
Ge 5:3-31: Adam lived 130 years: and begot a son in his own likeness: after his image; and called his name Seth:
Ge 11:20-32: Reu lived 32 years: and begot Serug:
Ge 36:9-19: These are the generations of Esau the father of the Edomites in mount Seir:
Ge 47:9: Jacob said to Pharaoh: The days of the years of my pilgrimage are 130 years: few and evil have the days of the years of my life been: and not have attained to the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.
Ex 1:6: 7: Joseph died: and all his brothers: and all that generation.
Ex 6:16-27: These are the names of the sons of Levi according to their generations; Gershon: and Kohath: and Merari: and the years of the life of Levi were 137 years.
Ps 89:47: 48: Remember how short my time is: for what reason have you made all men in vain?
Ps 90:9: 10: For all our days are passed away in your wrath: we spend our years as a tale that is told.
Zec 1:5: your fathers: where are they? and the prophets: do they live for ever?

"but"
Ps 102:24-28: I said: O my God: take not me away in the middle of my days: your years are throughout all generations.
Ps 104:5: Who laid the foundations of the earth: that it not should be removed for ever.
Ps 119:90: 91: Your faithfulness is to all generations: you have established the earth: and it abides.
Mt 24:35: Heaven and earth will pass away: but my words will not pass away.
2Pe 3:10-13: But the day of the Lord will come as a thief in the night; in the which the heavens will pass away with a great noise: and the elements will melt with fervent heat: the earth also and the works that are therein will be burned up.

5 The sun also arises, and the sun goes down, and hasts to his place where he arose.Ecclesiastes 1:5
Stats
Rank: #3148 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 86 characters, 15 words, 67 letters, 26 vowels, 41 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְזָרַ֥ח הַשֶּׁ֖מֶשׁ וּבָ֣א הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וְאֶ֨ל־מְקֹומֹ֔ו שֹׁואֵ֛ף זֹורֵ֥חַֽ ה֖וּא שָֽׁם׃

Lit: And rises the sun and goes down the sun and to the place hastens arose it where

KJV: The sun also ariseth, and the sun goeth down, and hasteth to his place where he arose.
References

"sun"
Ge 8:22: While the earth remains: seedtime and harvest: and cold and heat: and summer and winter: and day and night will not cease.
Ps 19:4-6: Their line is gone out through all the earth: and their words to the end of the world. In them has he set a tabernacle for the sun:
Ps 89:36: 37: His seed will endure for ever: and his throne as the sun before me.
Ps 104:19-23: He appointed the moon for seasons: the sun knows his going down.
Jer 33:20: Thus says the LORD; If you can break my covenant of the day: and my covenant of the night: and that there not should be day and night in their season;

"hasteth"
Jos 10:13: 14: The sun stood still: and the moon stayed: until the people had avenged themselves upon their enemies. Is not this written in the book of Jasher? So the sun stood still in the middle of heaven: and not hasted to go down about a whole day.
Ps 42:1: > As the hart pants'>pants after the water brooks: so pants'>pants my soul after you: O God.
Hab 3:11: The sun and moon stood still in their habitation: at the light of your arrows they went: and at the shining of your glittering spear.

H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		הָר֔וּחַhā-rū-aḥ, the wind Art | N-cs

H7725שָׁ֥בšāḇ   (V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms)

6 The wind goes toward the south, and turns about to the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returns again according to his circuits.Ecclesiastes 1:6
Stats
Rank: #3311 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 153 characters, 22 words, 125 letters, 46 vowels, 79 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֹולֵךְ֙ אֶל־דָּרֹ֔ום וְסֹובֵ֖ב אֶל־צָפֹ֑ון סֹובֵ֤ב ׀ סֹבֵב֙ הֹולֵ֣ךְ הָר֔וּחַ וְעַל־סְבִיבֹתָ֖יו שָׁ֥ב הָרֽוּחַ׃

Lit: Goes toward the south and turns around to the north continually continually whirls about the wind and on its circuit comes again the wind

KJV: The wind goeth toward the south, and turneth about unto the north; it whirleth about continually, and the wind returneth again according to his circuits.
References

"The wind"
Job 37:9: 17: Out of the south comes the whirlwind: and cold out of the north.
Ps 107:25: 29: For he commands: and raises the stormy wind: which lifts up the waves thereof.
Jon 1:4: But the LORD sent out a great wind into the sea: and there was a mighty tempest in the sea: so that the ship was like to be broken.
Mt 7:24: 27: Therefore whoever hears these sayings of my: and does them: I will liken him to a wise man: which built his house upon a rock:
Joh 3:8: The wind blows where it listeth: and you hear the sound thereof: but not canst tell where it comes: and whither it goes: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.
Ac 27:13-15: When the south wind blew softly: supposing that they had obtained their purpose: loosing there: they sailed close by Crete.

 כָּל־הַנְּחָלִים֙ הֹלְכִ֣ים אֶל־הַיָּ֔ם וְהַיָּ֖ם אֵינֶ֣נּוּ מָלֵ֑א אֶל־מְקֹ֗ום שֶׁ֤הַנְּחָלִים֙ הֹֽלְכִ֔ים שָׁ֛ם הֵ֥ם שָׁבִ֖ים לָלָֽכֶת׃

H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כָּל־kāl- All N-msc
H5158הַנְּחָלִים֙han-nə-ḥā-lîm   (Art | N-mp)
H5158 נַחַל nachal nakh-al or (feminine) נַחְלָה; (Psalm 124:4), or נַחֲלָה; (Ezekiel 47:19; Ezekiel 48:28), from נָחַל in its original sense; a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine); brook, flood, river, stream, valley. 		הַנְּחָלִים֙han-nə-ḥā-lîm the rivers Art | N-mp

7 All the rivers run into the sea; yet the sea is not full; to the place from where the rivers come, there they return again.Ecclesiastes 1:7
Stats
Rank: #3534 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 128 characters, 22 words, 100 letters, 38 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כָּל־הַנְּחָלִים֙ הֹלְכִ֣ים אֶל־הַיָּ֔ם וְהַיָּ֖ם אֵינֶ֣נּוּ מָלֵ֑א אֶל־מְקֹ֗ום שֶׁ֤הַנְּחָלִים֙ הֹֽלְכִ֔ים שָׁ֛ם הֵ֥ם שָׁבִ֖ים לָלָֽכֶת׃

Lit: All the rivers run into the sea and yet the sea is not full to the place from which the rivers come there they return again

KJV: All the rivers run into the sea; yet the sea is not full; unto the place from whence the rivers come, thither they return again.

8 All things are full of labour; man cannot utter it: the eye not is satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.Ecclesiastes 1:8
Stats
Rank: #3385 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 124 characters, 19 words, 96 letters, 38 vowels, 58 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כָּל־הַדְּבָרִ֣ים יְגֵעִ֔ים לֹא־יוּכַ֥ל אִ֖ישׁ לְדַבֵּ֑ר לֹא־תִשְׂבַּ֥ע עַ֙יִן֙ לִרְאֹ֔ות וְלֹא־תִמָּלֵ֥א אֹ֖זֶן מִשְּׁמֹֽעַ׃

Lit: All things are wearisome nor cannot Man express it not is satisfied the eye with seeing nor filled the ear with hearing

KJV: All things are full of labour; man cannot utter [it]: the eye is not satisfied with seeing, nor the ear filled with hearing.
References

"full"
Ec 2:11: 26: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought: and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and: look: all was vanity and vexation of spirit: and there was no profit under the sun.
Mt 11:28: Come to me: all you that labour and are heavy laden: and I will give you rest.
Ro 8:22: 23: For we know that the whole creation groans and travails in pain together until now.

"man"
Ec 4:1-4: So I returned: and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and look the tears of such as were oppressed: and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.
Ec 7:24-26: That which is far off: and exceeding deep: who can find it out?

"the eye"
Ec 4:8: There is one alone: and there is not a second; yes: he has neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither says he: For whom do I labour: and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity: yes: it is a sore travail.
Ec 5:10: 11: He who loves'>loves silver will not be satisfied with silver; nor he who loves'>loves abundance with increase: this is also vanity.
Ps 63:5: My soul will be satisfied as with marrow and fatness; and my mouth will praise you with joyful lips:
Pr 27:20: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.
Pr 30:15: 16: The horseleach has two daughters: crying: Give: give. There are 3 things that are never satisfied: yes: 4 things not say: It is enough:
Mt 5:6: Blessed are they which do hunger and thirst after righteousness: for they will be filled.
Re 7:16: 17: They will hunger no more: neither thirst any more; neither will the sun light on them: nor any heat.

 מַה־שֶּֽׁהָיָה֙ ה֣וּא שֶׁיִּהְיֶ֔ה וּמַה־שֶּׁנַּֽעֲשָׂ֔ה ה֖וּא שֶׁיֵּעָשֶׂ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין כָּל־חָדָ֖שׁ תַּ֥חַת הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃

H4100מַה־mah-   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מַה־mah- What Interrog

H1961 הָיָה hâyâh haw-yaw a primitive root (compare הָוָא); to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary); beacon, idiom altogether, be(-come), accomplished, committed, like), break, cause, come (to pass), do, faint, fall, phrase follow, happen, idiom have, last, pertain, quit (one-) self, require, idiom use. 		שֶּֽׁהָיָה֙še-hā-yāh has been Pro-r | V-Qal-Perf-3ms

H369וְאֵ֥יןwə-’ên   (Conj-w | Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. H3605כָּל־kāl-   (N-msc)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כָּל־kāl- all N-msc

H8121הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃haš-šā-meš.   (Art | N-cs)
H8121 שֶׁמֶשׁ shemesh sheh-mesh from an unused root meaning to be brilliant; the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement; phrase east side(-ward), sun (rising), phrase west(-ward), window. See also בֵּית שֶׁמֶשׁ. 		הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃haš-šā-meš. the sun Art | N-cs
9 The thing that has been, it is that which will be; and that which is done is that which will be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.Ecclesiastes 1:9
Stats
Rank: #3061 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 151 characters, 22 words, 111 letters, 36 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מַה־שֶּֽׁהָיָה֙ ה֣וּא שֶׁיִּהְיֶ֔ה וּמַה־שֶּׁנַּֽעֲשָׂ֔ה ה֖וּא שֶׁיֵּעָשֶׂ֑ה וְאֵ֥ין כָּל־חָדָ֖שׁ תַּ֥חַת הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃

Lit: What has been is what will be and what is done is what will be done And there is nothing all new under the sun

KJV: The thing that hath been, it is that which shall be; and that which is done [is] that which shall be done: and [there is] no new [thing] under the sun.
References

"that hath"
Ec 3:15: That which has been is now; and that which is to be has already been; and God requires that which is past.
Ec 7:10: not Say you: What is the cause that the former days were better than these? for you do not inquire wisely concerning this.
2Pe 2:1: But there were false prophets also among the people: even as there will be false teachers among you: who privily will bring in damnable heresies: even denying the Lord that bought them: and bring upon themselves swift destruction.

"and there"
Isa 43:19: Look: I will do a new thing; now it will spring forth; will you not know it? I will even make a way in the wilderness: and rivers in the desert.
Jer 31:22: How long will you go about: O you backsliding daughter? for the LORD has created a new thing in the earth: A woman will compass a man.
Re 21:1: 5: I saw a new heaven and a new earth: for the first heaven and the first earth were passed away; and there was no more sea.

10 Is there any thing whereof it may be said, See, this is new? it has been already of old time, which was before us.Ecclesiastes 1:10
Stats
Rank: #3633 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 117 characters, 18 words, 87 letters, 35 vowels, 52 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יֵ֥שׁ דָּבָ֛ר שֶׁיֹּאמַ֥ר רְאֵה־זֶ֖ה חָדָ֣שׁ ה֑וּא כְּבָר֙ הָיָ֣ה לְעֹֽלָמִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָיָ֖ה מִלְּפָנֵֽנוּ׃

Lit: Is there anything of which it may be said See this is new it already has been in ancient times that was before us

KJV: Is there any thing whereof it may be said, See, this [is] new? it hath been already of old time, which was before us.

"it hath"

1Th 2:14-16: For you: brothers: became followers of the churches of God which in Judaea are in Christ Jesus: for you also have suffered like things of your own countrymen: even as they have of the Jews:
2Ti 3:8: Now as Jannes and Jambres withstood Moses: so do these also resist the truth: men of corrupt minds: reprobate concerning the faith.

H1571 גַּם gam gam by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and; again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea. 		וְגַ֨םwə-ḡam and Conj-w | Conj

H314 אַחֲרוֹן ʼachărôwn akh-ar-one or (shortened) אַחֲרֹן; from אָחַר; hinder; generally, late or last; specifically (as facing the east) western; after (-ward), to come, following, hind(-er, -ermost, -most), last, latter, rereward, ut(ter) most. 		לָאַחֲרֹנִ֜יםlā-’a-ḥă-rō-nîm of the later Prep-l, Art | Adj-mp

11 There is no remembrance of former things; neither will there be any remembrance of things that are to come with those that will come after.Ecclesiastes 1:11
Stats
Rank: #895 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 149 characters, 17 words, 115 letters, 41 vowels, 74 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֵ֥ין זִכְרֹ֖ון לָרִאשֹׁנִ֑ים וְגַ֨ם לָאַחֲרֹנִ֜ים שֶׁיִּהְי֗וּ לֹֽא־יִהְיֶ֤ה לָהֶם֙ זִכָּרֹ֔ון עִ֥ם שֶׁיִּהְי֖וּ לָאַחֲרֹנָֽה׃ פ

Lit: There is no remembrance of former things and of the later That will there be nor are to come of things any remembrance by those who will come after

KJV: There is no remembrance of former [things]; neither shall there be [any] remembrance of [things] that are to come with [those] that shall come after.
References

"There is"
Ec 2:16: For there is no remembrance of the wise more than of the fool for ever; seeing that which now is in the days to come will all be forgotten. And how dies the wise man? as the fool.
Ps 9:6: O you enemy: destructions are come to a perpetual end: and you have destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.
Isa 41:22-26: Let them bring them forth: and show us what will happen: let them show the former things: what they be: that we may consider them: and know the latter end of them; or declare us things for to come.
Isa 42:9: Look: the former things are come to pass: and new things do I declare: before they spring forth I tell you of them.

The Teacher’s Investigation

אֲנִ֣י קֹהֶ֗לֶת הָיִ֥יתִי מֶ֛לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בִּירוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

H3389בִּירוּשָׁלִָֽם׃bî-rū-šā-lim.   (Prep-b | N-proper-fs)

12 I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.Ecclesiastes 1:12
Stats
Rank: #987 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 49 characters, 9 words, 40 letters, 17 vowels, 23 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֲנִ֣י קֹהֶ֗לֶת הָיִ֥יתִי מֶ֛לֶךְ עַל־יִשְׂרָאֵ֖ל בִּירוּשָׁלִָֽם׃

Lit: I the Teacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem

KJV: I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem.
References

"I the Preacher was king over Israel in Jerusalem."

1Ki 4:1-19: So king Solomon was king over all Israel.

H6031לַעֲנ֥וֹתla-‘ă-nō-wṯ   (Prep-l | V-Qal-Inf)
H6031 עָנָה ʻânâh aw-naw a primitive root (possibly rather identical with עָנָה through the idea of looking down or browbeating); to depress literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive (in various applications, as follows); abase self, afflict(-ion, self), answer (by mistake for עָנָה), chasten self, deal hardly with, defile, exercise, force, gentleness, humble (self), hurt, ravish, sing (by mistake for עָנָה), speak (by mistake for עָנָה), submit self, weaken, idiom in any wise. 		לַעֲנ֥וֹתla-‘ă-nō-wṯ they may be exercised Prep-l | V-Qal-Inf
Hבּֽוֹ׃bōw.   (Prep | 3ms)
 		בּֽוֹ׃bōw. by which Prep | 3ms
13 I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail has God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.Ecclesiastes 1:13
Stats
Rank: #3653 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 181 characters, 34 words, 145 letters, 55 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְנָתַ֣תִּי אֶת־לִבִּ֗י לִדְרֹ֤ושׁ וְלָתוּר֙ בַּֽחָכְמָ֔ה עַ֛ל כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר נַעֲשָׂ֖ה תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁמָ֑יִם ה֣וּא ׀ עִנְיַ֣ן רָ֗ע נָתַ֧ן אֱלֹהִ֛ים לִבְנֵ֥י הָאָדָ֖ם לַעֲנֹ֥ות בֹּֽו׃

Lit: And I set my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all that is done under heaven That task burdensome has given God to the sons of man they may be exercised by which

KJV: And I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail hath God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.
References

"I gave"
Ec 1:17: I gave my heart to know wisdom: and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.
Ec 7:25: I applied my heart to know: and to search: and to seek out wisdom: and the reason of things: and to know the wickedness of folly: even of foolishness and madness:
Ec 8:9: 16: 17: All this have I seen: and applied my heart to every work that is done under the sun: there is a time wherein one man rules over another to his own hurt.
Ps 111:2: The works of the LORD are great: sought out of all them that have pleasure therein.
Pr 2:2-4: So that you incline your ear to wisdom: and apply your heart to understanding;
Pr 4:7: Wisdom is the principal thing; therefore get wisdom: and with all your getting get understanding.
Pr 18:1: 15: Through desire a man: having separated himself: seeks and intermeddles with all wisdom.
Pr 23:26: My son: give me your heart: and let your eyes observe my ways.
1Ti 4:15: Meditate upon these things; give yourself wholly to them; that your profiting may appear to all.

"this sore"
Ec 3:10: I have seen the travail: which God has given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.
Ec 4:4: Again: I considered all travail: and every right work: that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 12:12: Further: by these: my son: be admonished: of making many books there is no end; and much study is a weariness of the flesh.
Ge 3:19: In the sweat of your face will you eat bread: till you return to the ground; for out of it were you taken: for dust you are: and to dust will you return.

14 I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, look, all is vanity and vexation of spirit.Ecclesiastes 1:14
Stats
Rank: #3752 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 105 characters, 18 words, 81 letters, 32 vowels, 49 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־כָּל־הַֽמַּעֲשִׂ֔ים שֶֽׁנַּעֲשׂ֖וּ תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וְהִנֵּ֥ה הַכֹּ֛ל הֶ֖בֶל וּרְע֥וּת רֽוּחַ׃

Lit: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun and indeed all is vanity and grasping for the wind

KJV: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and, behold, all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
References

"And"
Ec 1:17: 18: I gave my heart to know wisdom: and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.
Ec 2:11: 17: 26: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought: and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and: look: all was vanity and vexation of spirit: and there was no profit under the sun.
1Ki 4:30-32: Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east country: and all the wisdom of Egypt.
Ps 39:5: 6: Look: you have made my days as an handbreadth; and my age is not ashing before you: truly every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.

15 That which is crooked cannot be made straight: and that which is wanting cannot be numbered.Ecclesiastes 1:15

Translation

16 I communed with my own heart, saying, Indeed, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yes, my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.Ecclesiastes 1:16
Stats
Rank: #4270 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 211 characters, 33 words, 166 letters, 68 vowels, 98 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דִּבַּ֨רְתִּי אֲנִ֤י עִם־לִבִּי֙ לֵאמֹ֔ר אֲנִ֗י הִנֵּ֨ה הִגְדַּ֤לְתִּי וְהֹוסַ֙פְתִּי֙ חָכְמָ֔ה עַ֛ל כָּל־אֲשֶׁר־הָיָ֥ה לְפָנַ֖י עַל־יְרוּשָׁלִָ֑ם וְלִבִּ֛י רָאָ֥ה הַרְבֵּ֖ה חָכְמָ֥ה וָדָֽעַת׃

Lit: Communed I with my heart saying I Look have attained greatness and have gained more wisdom than all who were before me in Jerusalem and My heart has understood great wisdom and knowledge

KJV: I communed with mine own heart, saying, Lo, I am come to great estate, and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yea, my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.
References

"communed"
2Ki 5:20: But Gehazi: the servant of Elisha the man of God: said: Look: my master has spared Naaman this Syrian: not in receiving at His hands that which He brought: but: as the LORD lives: I will run after Him: and take somewhat of Him.
Ps 4:4: Stand in awe: and not sin: commune with your own heart upon your bed: and be still. Selah.
Ps 77:6: I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with my own heart: and my spirit made diligent search.
Isa 10:7-14: Howbeit he means not so: neither does his heart think so; but it is in his heart to destroy and cut off not nations a few.
Jer 22:14: That says: I will build me a wide house and large chambers: and cuts him out windows; and it is cieled with cedar: and painted with vermilion.
Eze 38:10: 11: Thus says the Lord GOD; It will also come to pass: that at the same time will things come into your mind: and you will think an evil thought:
Da 4:30: The king spoke: and said: not Is this great Babylon: that I have built for the house of the kingdom by the might of my power: and for the honour of my majesty?

"Lo"
Ec 2:9: So I was great: and increased more than all that were before me in Jerusalem: also my wisdom remained with me.
1Ki 3:12: 13: Look: I have done according to your words: indeed: I have given you a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like you before you: neither after you will any arise like to you.
1Ki 4:30: Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east country: and all the wisdom of Egypt.
1Ki 10:7: 23: 24: Howbeit I not believed the words: until I came: and my eyes had seen it: and: look: the half not was told me: your wisdom and prosperity exceeds the fame which I heard.
2Ch 1:10-12: Give me now wisdom and knowledge: that I may go out and come in before this people: for who can judge this your people: that is so great?
2Ch 2:12: Huram said moreover: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel: that made heaven and earth: who has given to David the king a wise son: endued with prudence and understanding: that might build an house for the LORD: and an house for His kingdom.
2Ch 9:22: 23: King Solomon passed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.

"great experience of"
Heb 5:14: But strong meat belongs to them that are of full age: even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.

H7307רֽוּחַ׃rū-aḥ.   (N-cs)
H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		רֽוּחַ׃rū-aḥ. the wind N-cs
17 I gave my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.Ecclesiastes 1:17
Stats
Rank: #4133 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 116 characters, 21 words, 91 letters, 34 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וָאֶתְּנָ֤ה לִבִּי֙ לָדַ֣עַת חָכְמָ֔ה וְדַ֥עַת הֹולֵלֹ֖ות וְשִׂכְל֑וּת יָדַ֕עְתִּי שֶׁגַּם־זֶ֥ה ה֖וּא רַעְיֹ֥ון רֽוּחַ׃

Lit: And I set my heart to know wisdom and to know madness and folly I perceived that also this is grasping for the wind

KJV: And I gave my heart to know wisdom, and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.
References

"I gave"
Ec 1:13: I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail has God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.
Ec 2:3: 12: I sought in my heart to give myself to wine: yet acquainting my heart with wisdom; and to lay hold on folly: till I might see what was that good for the sons of men: which they should do under the heaven all the days of their life.
Ec 7:23-25: All this have I proved by wisdom: I said: I will be wise; but it was far from me.
1Th 5:21: Prove all things; hold fast that which is good.

"I perceived"
Ec 2:10: 11: whatever my eyes desired I not kept from them: I not withheld my heart from any joy; for my heart rejoiced in all my labour: and this was my portion of all my labour.

 כִּ֛י בְּרֹ֥ב חָכְמָ֖ה רָב־כָּ֑עַס וְיֹוסִ֥יף דַּ֖עַת יֹוסִ֥יף מַכְאֹֽוב׃

H3588כִּ֛יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֛יkî For Conj

Translation

Lit: For in much wisdom is much grief and he who increases knowledge increases sorrow

KJV: For in much wisdom is much grief: and he that increaseth knowledge increaseth sorrow.

"For in"

2
The Futility of Pleasure

אָמַ֤רְתִּֽי אֲנִי֙ בְּלִבִּ֔י לְכָה־נָּ֛א אֲנַסְּכָ֛ה בְשִׂמְחָ֖ה וּרְאֵ֣ה בְטֹ֑וב וְהִנֵּ֥ה גַם־ה֖וּא הָֽבֶל׃

1 I said in my heart, Go to now, I will prove you with mirth, therefore enjoy pleasure: and, look, this also is vanity.Ecclesiastes 2:1

Rank: #8754 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)

Translation
Hebrew: אָמַ֤רְתִּֽי אֲנִי֙ בְּלִבִּ֔י לְכָה־נָּ֛א אֲנַסְּכָ֛ה בְשִׂמְחָ֖ה וּרְאֵ֣ה בְטֹ֑וב וְהִנֵּ֥ה גַם־ה֖וּא הָֽבֶל׃

Lit: Said I in my heart come now I will test you with mirth therefore enjoy pleasure but surely also that was vanity

KJV: I said in mine heart, Go to now, I will prove thee with mirth, therefore enjoy pleasure: and, behold, this also is vanity.
References

"said"
Ec 2:15: Then said I in my heart: As it happens'>happens to the fool: so it happens'>happens even to me; and why was I then more wise? Then I said in my heart: that this also is vanity.
Ec 1:16: 17: I communed with my own heart: saying: Indeed: I am come to great estate: and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yes: my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.
Ec 3:17: 18: I said in my heart: God will judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.
Ps 10:6: He has said in his heart: I will not be moved: for I will never be in adversity.
Ps 14:1: A Psalm of David.>> The fool has said in His heart: There is no God. They are corrupt: they have done abominable works: there is none that does good.
Ps 27:8: When you said: Seek you my face; my heart said to you: Your face: LORD: will I seek.
Ps 30:6: 7: In my prosperity I said: I will never be moved.
Lu 12:19: I will say to my soul: Soul: you have much goods laid up for many years; take your ease: eat: drink: and be merry.

"Go to"
Ge 11:3: 4: 7: They said one to another: Go to: let us make brick: and burn them throughly. And they had brick for stone: and slime had they for morter.
2Ki 5:5: The king of Syria said: Go to: go: and I will send a letter to the king of Israel. And he departed: and took with him 10 talents of silver: and 6000 pieces of gold: and 10 changes of clothing.
Isa 5:5: Now go to; I will tell you what I will do to my vineyard: I will take away the hedge thereof: and it will be eaten up; and break down the wall thereof: and it will be trodden down:
Jas 4:13: Go to now: you that say: Today or to morrow we will go into such a city: and continue there a year: and buy and sell: and get gain:
Jas 5:1: Go to now: you rich men: weep and howl for your miseries that will come upon you.

"I will"
Ec 8:15: Then I commended mirth: because a man has no better thing under the sun: than to eat: and to drink: and to be merry: for that will abide with Him of His labour the days of His life: which God gives Him under the sun.
Ec 11:9: Rejoice: O young man: in your youth; and let your heart cheer you in the days of your youth: and walk in the ways of your heart: and in the sight of your eyes: but know you: that for all these things God will bring you into judgment.

Lu 16:19: 23: There was a certain rich man: which was clothed in purple and fine linen: and fared sumptuously every day:
Jas 5:5: You have lived in pleasure on the earth: and been wanton; you have nourished your hearts: as in a day of slaughter.
Tit 3:3: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish: disobedient: deceived: serving divers lusts and pleasures: living in malice and envy: hateful: and hating one another.
Re 18:7: 8: How much she has glorified herself: and lived deliciously: so much torment and sorrow give her: for she says in her heart: I sit a queen: and am no widow: and will see no sorrow.

H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מַה־mah- what Interrog

3 I sought in my heart to give myself to wine, yet acquainting my heart with wisdom; and to lay hold on folly, till I might see what was that good for the sons of men, which they should do under the heaven all the days of their life.Ecclesiastes 2:3
Stats
Rank: #3592 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 237 characters, 44 words, 185 letters, 69 vowels, 116 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תַּ֣רְתִּי בְלִבִּ֔י לִמְשֹׁ֥וךְ בַּיַּ֖יִן אֶת־בְּשָׂרִ֑י וְלִבִּ֞י נֹהֵ֤ג בַּֽחָכְמָה֙ וְלֶאֱחֹ֣ז בְּסִכְל֔וּת עַ֣ד אֲשֶׁר־אֶרְאֶ֗ה אֵי־זֶ֨ה טֹ֜וב לִבְנֵ֤י הָאָדָם֙ אֲשֶׁ֤ר יַעֲשׂוּ֙ תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁמַ֔יִם מִסְפַּ֖ר יְמֵ֥י חַיֵּיהֶֽם׃

Lit: I searched in my heart how to gratify with wine my flesh and while my heart guiding with wisdom and how to lay hold on folly until till I might see where that was was good for the sons of men that to do under the heaven all days of their lives

KJV: I sought in mine heart to give myself unto wine, yet acquainting mine heart with wisdom; and to lay hold on folly, till I might see what was that good for the sons of men, which they should do under the heaven all the days of their life.
References

"sought"
Ec 1:17: I gave my heart to know wisdom: and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.
1Sa 25:36: Abigail came to Nabal; and: look: he held a feast in his house: like the feast of a king; and Nabal's heart was merry within him: for he was very drunken: for what reason she told not himhing: less or more: until the morning light.

"yet"
Pr 20:1: Wine is a mocker: strong drink is raging: and whoever is deceived thereby not is wise.
Pr 31:4: 5: It is not for kings: O Lemuel: it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:
Eph 5:18: not be drunk with wine: wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;

"and to lay"
Ec 7:18: It is good that you should take hold of this; yes: also from this not withdraw your hand: for He that'>He who fears God will come forth of them all.
Pr 20:1: Wine is a mocker: strong drink is raging: and whoever is deceived thereby not is wise.
Pr 23:29-35: Who has woe? who has sorrow? who has contentions? who has babbling? who has wounds without cause? who has redness of eyes?
Mt 6:24: No man can serve two masters: for either He will hate the one: and love the other; or else He will hold to the one: and despise the other. You cannot serve God and mammon.
2Co 6:15-17: What concord has Christ with Belial? or what part has He that'>He who believes with an infidel?

"till"
Ec 6:12: For who knows what is good for man in this life: all the days of his vain life which he spends as a shadow? for who can tell a man what will be after him under the sun?
Ec 12:13: Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God: and keep His commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.

"all"
Ge 47:9: Jacob said to Pharaoh: The days of the years of my pilgrimage are 130 years: few and evil have the days of the years of my life been: and not have attained to the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.
Job 14:14: If a man die: will he live again? all the days of my appointed time will I wait: till my change come.
Ps 90:9-12: For all our days are passed away in your wrath: we spend our years as a tale that is told.

4 I made me great works; I built me houses; I planted me vineyards:Ecclesiastes 2:4
Stats
Rank: #5733 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 67 characters, 11 words, 52 letters, 22 vowels, 30 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הִגְדַּ֖לְתִּי מַעֲשָׂ֑י בָּנִ֤יתִי לִי֙ בָּתִּ֔ים נָטַ֥עְתִּי לִ֖י כְּרָמִֽים׃

Lit: I made great my works I built myself houses and planted myself vineyards

KJV: I made me great works; I builded me houses; I planted me vineyards:
References

"made"
Ge 11:4: They said: Go to: let us build us a city and a tower: whose top may reach to heaven; and let us make us a name: lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
2Sa 18:18: Now Absalom in his lifetime had taken and reared up for himself a pillar: which is in the king's dale: for he said: I have no son to keep my name in remembrance: and he called the pillar after his own name: and it is called to this day: Absalom's place.
Da 4:30: The king spoke: and said: not Is this great Babylon: that I have built for the house of the kingdom by the might of my power: and for the honour of my majesty?

"I builded"
De 8:12-14: Lest when you have eaten and are full: and have built goodly houses: and dwelt therein;
1Ki 7:1: 2: 8-12: But Solomon was building his own house 13 years: and he finished all his house.
1Ki 9:1: It came to pass: when Solomon had finished the building of the house of the LORD: and the king's house: and all Solomon's desire which He was pleased to do:
1Ki 15:19: There is a league between me and you: and between my father and your father: look: I have sent to you a present of silver and gold; come and break your league with Baasha king of Israel: that he may depart from me.
1Ki 10:19: 20: The throne had 6 steps: and the top of the throne was round behind: and there were stays on either side on the place of the seat: and two lions stood beside the stays.
2Ch 8:1-6: 11: It came to pass at the end of 20 years: wherein Solomon had built the house of the LORD: and His own house:
Ps 49:11: Their inward thought is: that their houses will continue for ever: and their dwelling places to all generations; they call their lands after their own names.

"I planted"
1Ch 27:27: Over the vineyards was Shimei the Ramathite: over the increase of the vineyards for the wine cellars was Zabdi the Shiphmite:
2Ch 26:10: Also he built towers in the desert: and digged many wells: for he had much cattle: both in the low country: and in the plains: husbandmen also: and vine dressers in the mountains: and in Carmel: for he loved husbandry.
Song 1:14: My beloved is to me as a cluster of camphire in the vineyards of Engedi.
Song 7:12: Let us get up early to the vineyards; let us see if the vine flourish: whether the tender grape appear: and the pomegranates bud forth: there will I give you my loves.

"me"

"I planted"

"pools"

"to water"

Lit: I acquired male and maidservants and servants in house had born my Yes possessions of herds and flocks greater I had than all who were before me in Jerusalem

KJV: I got me servants and maidens, and had servants born in my house; also I had great possessions of great and small cattle above all that were in Jerusalem before me:

"and had"
Ge 17:12: 13: he who is 8 days old will be circumcised among you: every man child in your generations: he who is born in the house: or bought with money of any stranger: which is not of your seed.

"also"
Ge 13:2: Abram was very rich in cattle: in silver: and in gold.
2Ki 3:4: Mesha king of Moab was a sheepmaster: and rendered to the king of Israel 100000 lambs: and 100000 rams: with the wool.
1Ch 27:29-31: Over the herds that fed in Sharon was Shitrai the Sharonite: and over the herds that were in the valleys was Shaphat the son of Adlai:
2Ch 26:10: Also he built towers in the desert: and digged many wells: for he had much cattle: both in the low country: and in the plains: husbandmen also: and vine dressers in the mountains: and in Carmel: for he loved husbandry.
2Ch 32:27-29: Hezekiah had exceeding much riches and honour: and he made himself treasuries for silver: and for gold: and for precious stones: and for spices: and for shields: and for all manner of pleasant jewels;
Job 1:3: His substance also was 7000 sheep: and 3000 camels: and 500 yoke of oxen: and 500 she asses: and a very great household; so that this man was the great of all the men of the east.
Job 42:12: So the LORD blessed the latter end of Job more than His beginning: for He had 14000 sheep: and 6000 camels: and a000 yoke of oxen: and a000 she asses.

 כָּנַ֤סְתִּי לִי֙ גַּם־כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב וּסְגֻלַּ֥ת מְלָכִ֖ים וְהַמְּדִינֹ֑ות עָשִׂ֨יתִי לִ֜י שָׁרִ֣ים וְשָׁרֹ֗ות וְתַעֲנוּגֹ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י הָאָדָ֖ם שִׁדָּ֥ה וְשִׁדֹּֽות׃

8 I gathered me also silver and gold, and the peculiar treasure of kings and of the provinces: I gat me men singers and women singers, and the delights of the sons of men, as musical instruments, and that of all sorts.Ecclesiastes 2:8
Stats
Rank: #8984 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 216 characters, 36 words, 170 letters, 61 vowels, 109 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כָּנַ֤סְתִּי לִי֙ גַּם־כֶּ֣סֶף וְזָהָ֔ב וּסְגֻלַּ֥ת מְלָכִ֖ים וְהַמְּדִינֹ֑ות עָשִׂ֨יתִי לִ֜י שָׁרִ֣ים וְשָׁרֹ֗ות וְתַעֲנוּגֹ֛ת בְּנֵ֥י הָאָדָ֖ם שִׁדָּ֥ה וְשִׁדֹּֽות׃

Lit: I gathered for myself also silver and gold and the special treasures of kings and of the provinces Acquired I male and female singers and the delights of the sons of men many and and musical instruments of [all kinds]

KJV: I gathered me also silver and gold, and the peculiar treasure of kings and of the provinces: I gat me men singers and women singers, and the delights of the sons of men, as musical instruments, and that of all sorts.
References

"silver"
1Ki 9:14: 28: Hiram sent to the king sixscore talents of gold.
1Ki 10:10: She gave the king 120 talents of gold: and of spices very great store: and precious stones: there came no more such abundance of spices as these which the queen of Sheba gave to king Solomon.
1Ki 14:21: 22: 27: Rehoboam the son of Solomon reigned in Judah. Rehoboam was 41 years old when He began to reign: and He reigned 17 years in Jerusalem: the city which the LORD did choose out of all the tribes of Israel: to put His name there. And His mother's name was Naamah an Ammonitess.
2Ch 9:11: 15-21: The king made of the algum trees terraces to the house of the LORD: and to the king's palace: and harps and psalteries for singers: and there were none such seen before in the land of Judah.

"men singers"
2Sa 19:35: I am this day fourscore years old: and can I discern between good and evil? can your servant taste what I eat or what I drink? can I hear any more the voice of singing men and singing women? for what reason then should your servant be yet a burden to my lord the king?
Ezr 2:65: Beside their servants and their maids: of whom there were 7300 37: and there were among them 200 singing men and singing women.

"musical instruments, etc"
1Ch 25:1: 6: Moreover David and the captains of the host separated to the service of the sons of Asaph: and of Heman: and of Jeduthun: who should prophesy with harps: with psalteries: and with cymbals: and the number of the workmen according to their service was:
Job 21:11: 12: They send forth their little ones like a flock: and their children dance.
Ps 150:3-5: Praise him with the sound of the trumpet: praise him with the psaltery and harp.
Da 3:5: 7: 15: That at what time you hear the sound of the cornet: flute: harp: sackbut: psaltery: dulcimer: and all kinds of musick: you fall down and worship the golden image that Nebuchadnezzar the king has set up:
Am 6:5: That chant to the sound of the viol: and invent to themselves instruments of musick: like David;

9 So I was great, and increased more than all that were before me in Jerusalem: also my wisdom remained with me.Ecclesiastes 2:9
Stats
Rank: #9064 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 110 characters, 19 words, 87 letters, 36 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְגָדַ֣לְתִּי וְהֹוסַ֔פְתִּי מִכֹּ֛ל שֶׁהָיָ֥ה לְפָנַ֖י בִּירוּשָׁלִָ֑ם אַ֥ף חָכְמָתִ֖י עָ֥מְדָה לִּֽי׃

Lit: so I became great and excelled more than all who were before me in Jerusalem Also my wisdom remained with me

KJV: So I was great, and increased more than all that were before me in Jerusalem: also my wisdom remained with me.
References

"So I was great, and increased more than all that were before me in Jerusalem: also my wisdom remained with me."
Ec 1:16: I communed with my own heart: saying: Indeed: I am come to great estate: and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yes: my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.
1Ki 3:12: Look: I have done according to your words: indeed: I have given you a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like you before you: neither after you will any arise like to you.
1Ki 10:7: 23: Howbeit I not believed the words: until I came: and my eyes had seen it: and: look: the half not was told me: your wisdom and prosperity exceeds the fame which I heard.
1Ch 29:25: The LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel: and bestowed upon Him such royal majesty as not had been on any king before Him in Israel.
2Ch 1:1: Solomon the son of David was strengthened in His kingdom: and the LORD His God was with Him: and magnified Him exceedingly.
2Ch 9:22: 23: King Solomon passed all the kings of the earth in riches and wisdom.

10 whatever my eyes desired I not kept from them, I not withheld my heart from any joy; for my heart rejoiced in all my labour: and this was my portion of all my labour.Ecclesiastes 2:10
Stats
Rank: #7094 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 174 characters, 32 words, 136 letters, 49 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְכֹל֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר שָֽׁאֲל֣וּ עֵינַ֔י לֹ֥א אָצַ֖לְתִּי מֵהֶ֑ם לֹֽא־מָנַ֨עְתִּי אֶת־לִבִּ֜י מִכָּל־שִׂמְחָ֗ה כִּֽי־לִבִּ֤י שָׂמֵ֙חַ֙ מִכָּל־עֲמָלִ֔י וְזֶֽה־הָיָ֥ה חֶלְקִ֖י מִכָּל־עֲמָלִֽי׃

Lit: And whatever desired my eyes not I did keep from them not I did withhold my heart from any pleasure for my heart rejoiced in all my labor and this was my reward from all my labor

KJV: And whatsoever mine eyes desired I kept not from them, I withheld not my heart from any joy; for my heart rejoiced in all my labour: and this was my portion of all my labour.
References

"whatsoever"
Ec 3:22: For what reason I perceive that there is nothing better: than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who will bring him to see what will be after him?
Ec 6:9: Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of the desire: this is also vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 11:9: Rejoice: O young man: in your youth; and let your heart cheer you in the days of your youth: and walk in the ways of your heart: and in the sight of your eyes: but know you: that for all these things God will bring you into judgment.
Ge 3:6: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food: and that it was pleasant to the eyes: and a tree to be desired to make one wise: she took of the fruit thereof: and did eat: and gave also to her husband with her; and he did eat.
Ge 6:2: That the sons of God saw the daughters of men that they were fair; and they took them wives of all which they chose.
Jg 14:2: He came up: and told his father and his mother: and said: I have seen a woman in Timnath of the daughters of the Philistines: now therefore get her for me to wife.
Job 31:1: I made a covenant with my eyes; why then should I think upon a maid?
Ps 119:37: Turn away my eyes from beholding vanity; and quicken you me in your way.
Pr 23:5: Will you set your eyes upon that which not is? for riches certainly make themselves wings; they fly away as an eagle toward heaven.
1Jo 2:16: For all that is in the world: the lust of the flesh: and the lust of the eyes: and the pride of life: not is of the Father: but is of the world.

"my heart rejoiced"
Ec 2:22: For what has man of all his labour: and of the vexation of his heart: wherein he has laboured under the sun?
Ec 5:18: Look that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink: and to enjoy the good of all His labour that He takes under the sun all the days of His life: which God gives Him: for it is His portion.
Ec 9:9: Live joyfully with the wife whom you love all the days of the life of your vanity: which he has given you under the sun: all the days of your vanity: for that is your portion in this life: and in your labour which you take under the sun.
Ps 128:2: For you will eat the labour of your hands: happy will you be: and it will be well with you.

H8478 תַּחַת tachath takh-ath from the same as תּוֹחַ; the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.; as, beneath, idiom flat, in(-stead), (same) place (where...is), room, for...sake, stead of, under, idiom unto, idiom when...was mine, whereas, (where-) fore, with. 		תַּ֥חַתta-ḥaṯ under Prep
H8121הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃haš-šā-meš.   (Art | N-cs)
H8121 שֶׁמֶשׁ shemesh sheh-mesh from an unused root meaning to be brilliant; the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement; phrase east side(-ward), sun (rising), phrase west(-ward), window. See also בֵּית שֶׁמֶשׁ. 		הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃haš-šā-meš. the sun Art | N-cs
11 Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought, and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and, look, all was vanity and vexation of spirit, and there was no profit under the sun.Ecclesiastes 2:11
Stats
Rank: #9306 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 195 characters, 32 words, 149 letters, 55 vowels, 94 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּפָנִ֣יתִֽי אֲנִ֗י בְּכָל־מַעֲשַׂי֙ שֶֽׁעָשׂ֣וּ יָדַ֔י וּבֶֽעָמָ֖ל שֶׁעָמַ֣לְתִּי לַעֲשֹׂ֑ות וְהִנֵּ֨ה הַכֹּ֥ל הֶ֙בֶל֙ וּרְע֣וּת ר֔וּחַ וְאֵ֥ין יִתְרֹ֖ון תַּ֥חַת הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃

Lit: And looked I on all the works that had done my hands and on the labor in which I had toiled to do and indeed all was vanity and grasping for the wind and There was no profit under the sun

KJV: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought, and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and, behold, all was vanity and vexation of spirit, and [there was] no profit under the sun.
References

"I looked"
Ec 1:14: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and: look: all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ge 1:31: God saw every thing that He had made: and: look: it was very good. And the evening and the morning were the sixth day.
Ex 39:43: Moses did look upon all the work: and: look: they had done it as the LORD had commanded: even so had they done it: and Moses blessed them.
1Jo 2:16: 17: For all that is in the world: the lust of the flesh: and the lust of the eyes: and the pride of life: not is of the Father: but is of the world.

"behold"
Ec 2:17-23: Therefore I hated life; because the work that is wrought under the sun is grievous to me: for all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 1:3: 14: What profit has a man of all his labour which he takes under the sun?
Hab 2:13: Look: is it not of the LORD of hosts that the people will labour in the very fire: and the people will weary themselves for very vanity?
1Ti 6:6: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

The Wise and the Foolish

וּפָנִ֤יתִֽי אֲנִי֙ לִרְאֹ֣ות חָכְמָ֔ה וְהֹולֵלֹ֖ות וְסִכְל֑וּת כִּ֣י ׀ מֶ֣ה הָאָדָ֗ם שֶׁיָּבֹוא֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־כְּבָ֖ר עָשֽׂוּהוּ׃

12 I turned myself to look wisdom, and madness, and folly: for what can the man do that comes after the king? even that which has been already done.Ecclesiastes 2:12

Translation
Hebrew: וּפָנִ֤יתִֽי אֲנִי֙ לִרְאֹ֣ות חָכְמָ֔ה וְהֹולֵלֹ֖ות וְסִכְל֑וּת כִּ֣י ׀ מֶ֣ה הָאָדָ֗ם שֶׁיָּבֹוא֙ אַחֲרֵ֣י הַמֶּ֔לֶךְ אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־כְּבָ֖ר עָשֽׂוּהוּ׃

Lit: And turned I to consider wisdom and madness and folly for what can do the man who succeeds after the king Only what already he has done

KJV: And I turned myself to behold wisdom, and madness, and folly: for what can the man [do] that cometh after the king? [even] that which hath been already done.

13 Then I saw that wisdom excels'>excels folly, as far as light excels'>excels darkness.Ecclesiastes 2:13
Stats
Counts: 75 characters, 12 words, 61 letters, 19 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְרָאִ֣יתִי אָ֔נִי שֶׁיֵּ֥שׁ יִתְרֹ֛ון לַֽחָכְמָ֖ה מִן־הַסִּכְל֑וּת כִּֽיתְרֹ֥ון הָאֹ֖ור מִן־הַחֹֽשֶׁךְ׃

Lit: And saw I that excels wisdom from folly as excels light from darkness

KJV: Then I saw that wisdom excelleth folly, as far as light excelleth darkness.
References

"I saw"
Ec 7:11: 12: Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.
Ec 9:16: Then said I: Wisdom is better than strength: nevertheless the poor man's wisdom is despised: and his words not are heard.
Pr 4:5-7: Get wisdom: get understanding: forget it not; neither decline from the words of my mouth.
Pr 16:16: How much better is it to get wisdom than gold! and to get understanding rather to be chosen than silver!
Mal 3:18: Then will you return: and discern between the righteous and the wicked: between Him that serves'>serves God and Him that serves'>serves Him not">not Him.
Mal 4:1: 2: For: look: the day comes'>comes: that will burn as an oven; and all the proud: yes: and all that do wickedly: will be stubble: and the day that comes'>comes will burn them up: says the LORD of hosts: that it will leave them neither root nor branch.

"light"
Ec 11:7: Truly the light is sweet: and a pleasant thing it is for the eyes to look the sun:
Ps 119:105: 130: NUN. Your word is a lamp to my feet: and a light to my path.
Pr 4:18: 19: But the path of the just is as the shining light: that shines more and more to the perfect day.
Mt 6:23: But if your eye be evil: your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you be darkness: how great is that darkness!
Lu 11:34: 35: The light of the body is the eye: therefore when your eye is single: your whole body also is full of light; but when your eye is evil: your body also is full of darkness.
Eph 5:8: For you were sometimes darkness: but now are you light in the Lord: walk as children of light:

H1980הוֹלֵ֑ךְhō-w-lêḵ;   (V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms)
H1980 הָלַךְ hâlak haw-lak akin to יָלַךְ; a primitive root; to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively); (all) along, apace, behave (self), come, (on) continually, be conversant, depart, phrase be eased, enter, exercise (self), phrase follow, forth, forward, get, go (about, abroad, along, away, forward, on, out, up and down), phrase greater, grow, be wont to haunt, lead, march, idiom more and more, move (self), needs, on, pass (away), be at the point, quite, run (along), phrase send, speedily, spread, still, surely, phrase tale-bearer, phrase travel(-ler), walk (abroad, on, to and fro, up and down, to places), wander, wax, (way-) faring man, idiom be weak, whirl. 		הוֹלֵ֑ךְhō-w-lêḵ; Walks V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms
H3045וְיָדַ֣עְתִּיwə-yā-ḏa‘-tî   (Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjPerf-1cs)
H3045 יָדַע yâdaʻ yaw-dah a primitive root; to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.); acknowledge, acquaintance(-ted with), advise, answer, appoint, assuredly, be aware, (un-) awares, can(-not), certainly, comprehend, consider, idiom could they, cunning, declare, be diligent, (can, cause to) discern, discover, endued with, familiar friend, famous, feel, can have, be (ig-) norant, instruct, kinsfolk, kinsman, (cause to let, make) know, (come to give, have, take) knowledge, have (knowledge), (be, make, make to be, make self) known, phrase be learned, phrase lie by man, mark, perceive, privy to, idiom prognosticator, regard, have respect, skilful, shew, can (man of) skill, be sure, of a surety, teach, (can) tell, understand, have (understanding), idiom will be, wist, wit, wot. 		וְיָדַ֣עְתִּיwə-yā-ḏa‘-tî and yet perceived Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjPerf-1cs

H3605כֻּלָּֽם׃kul-lām.   (N-msc | 3mp)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כֻּלָּֽם׃kul-lām. them all N-msc | 3mp
14 The wise man's eyes are in his head; but the fool walks in darkness: and I myself perceived also that one event happens to them all.Ecclesiastes 2:14
Stats
Counts: 136 characters, 24 words, 107 letters, 41 vowels, 66 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הֶֽחָכָם֙ עֵינָ֣יו בְּרֹאשֹׁ֔ו וְהַכְּסִ֖יל בַּחֹ֣שֶׁךְ הֹולֵ֑ךְ וְיָדַ֣עְתִּי גַם־אָ֔נִי שֶׁמִּקְרֶ֥ה אֶחָ֖ד יִקְרֶ֥ה אֶת־כֻּלָּֽם׃

Lit: Of the wise man eyes are in his head but the fool in darkness Walks and yet perceived also I that the event one happens to them all

KJV: The wise man's eyes are in his head; but the fool walketh in darkness: and I myself perceived also that one event happeneth to them all.
References

"wise"
Ec 8:1: Who is as the wise man? and who knows the interpretation of a thing? a man's wisdom makes his face to shine: and the boldness of his face will be changed.
Ec 10:2: 3: A wise man's heart is at his right hand; but a fool's heart at his left.
Pr 14:8: The wisdom of the prudent is to understand his way: but the folly of fools is deceit.
Pr 17:24: Wisdom is before him that has understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
1Jo 2:11: But he who hates his brother is in darkness: and walks in darkness: and knows not whither he goes: because that darkness has blinded his eyes.

"one"
Ec 9:1-3: 11: 16: For all this I considered in my heart even to declare all this: that the righteous: and the wise: and their works: are in the hand of God: no man knows either love or hatred by all that is before them.
Ps 19:10: More to be desired are they than gold: yes: than much fine gold: sweeter also than honey and the honeycomb.
Ps 49:10: For he sees that wise men die: likewise the fool and the brutish person perish: and leave their wealth to others.

 וְאָמַ֨רְתִּֽי אֲנִ֜י בְּלִבִּ֗י כְּמִקְרֵ֤ה הַכְּסִיל֙ גַּם־אֲנִ֣י יִקְרֵ֔נִי וְלָ֧מָּה חָכַ֛מְתִּי אֲנִ֖י אָ֣ז יֹותֵ֑ר וְדִבַּ֣רְתִּי בְלִבִּ֔י שֶׁגַּם־זֶ֖ה הָֽבֶל׃

15 Then said I in my heart, As it happens'>happens to the fool, so it happens'>happens even to me; and why was I then more wise? Then I said in my heart, that this also is vanity.Ecclesiastes 2:15
Stats
Counts: 162 characters, 31 words, 121 letters, 47 vowels, 74 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאָמַ֨רְתִּֽי אֲנִ֜י בְּלִבִּ֗י כְּמִקְרֵ֤ה הַכְּסִיל֙ גַּם־אֲנִ֣י יִקְרֵ֔נִי וְלָ֧מָּה חָכַ֛מְתִּי אֲנִ֖י אָ֣ז יֹותֵ֑ר וְדִבַּ֣רְתִּי בְלִבִּ֔י שֶׁגַּם־זֶ֖ה הָֽבֶל׃

Lit: So said I in my heart as it happens to the fool also me it happens to and why was wise I then more and I said in my heart also this is vanity

KJV: Then said I in my heart, As it happeneth to the fool, so it happeneth even to me; and why was I then more wise? Then I said in my heart, that this also is vanity.
References

"and why"
Ec 1:16: 18: I communed with my own heart: saying: Indeed: I am come to great estate: and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yes: my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.
1Ki 3:12: Look: I have done according to your words: indeed: I have given you a wise and an understanding heart; so that there was none like you before you: neither after you will any arise like to you.

"Then I"
Ec 2:1: I said in my heart: Go to now: I will prove you with mirth: therefore enjoy pleasure: and: look: this also is vanity.
Ec 1:2: 14: Vanity of vanities: says the Preacher: vanity of vanities; all is vanity.

H3588כִּי֩kî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּי֩kî For Conj

H5769לְעוֹלָ֑םlə-‘ō-w-lām;   (Prep-l | N-ms)
H5769 עוֹלָם ʻôwlâm o-lawm or עֹלָם; from עָלַם; properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always; alway(-s), ancient (time), any more, continuance, eternal, (for, (n-)) ever(-lasting, -more, of old), lasting, long (time), (of) old (time), perpetual, at any time, (beginning of the) world (phrase without end). Compare נֶצַח, עַד. 		לְעוֹלָ֑םlə-‘ō-w-lām; forever Prep-l | N-ms
H3528בְּשֶׁכְּבָ֞רbə-šek-kə-ḇār   (Prep-b, Pro-r | Adv)

16 For there is no remembrance of the wise more than of the fool for ever; seeing that which now is in the days to come will all be forgotten. And how dies the wise man? as the fool.Ecclesiastes 2:16
Stats
Counts: 185 characters, 32 words, 140 letters, 54 vowels, 86 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּי֩ אֵ֨ין זִכְרֹ֧ון לֶחָכָ֛ם עִֽם־הַכְּסִ֖יל לְעֹולָ֑ם בְּשֶׁכְּבָ֞ר הַיָּמִ֤ים הַבָּאִים֙ הַכֹּ֣ל נִשְׁכָּ֔ח וְאֵ֛יךְ יָמ֥וּת הֶחָכָ֖ם עִֽם־הַכְּסִֽיל׃

Lit: For there is no remembrance of the wise more than of the fool forever Since that now is in the days to come all will be forgotten And how does die a wise man as the fool

KJV: For there is no remembrance of the wise more than of the fool for ever; seeing that which now [is] in the days to come shall all be forgotten. And how dieth the wise [man]? as the fool.
References

"there is"
Ec 1:11: There is no remembrance of former things; neither will there be any remembrance of things that are to come with those that will come after.
Ex 1:6: 8: Joseph died: and all his brothers: and all that generation.
Ps 88:12: Will your wonders be known in the dark? and your righteousness in the land of forgetfulness?
Ps 103:16: For the wind passs over it: and it is gone; and the place thereof will know it no more.
Mal 3:16: Then they that feared the LORD spoke often one to another: and the LORD listened: and heard it: and a book of remembrance was written before Him for them that feared the LORD: and that thought upon His name.

"how"
Ec 6:8: For what has the wise more than the fool? what has the poor: that knows to walk before the living?
2Sa 3:33: The king lamented over Abner: and said: Died Abner as a fool dieth?
Ps 49:10: For he sees that wise men die: likewise the fool and the brutish person perish: and leave their wealth to others.
Heb 9:27: As it is appointed to men once to die: but after this the judgment:

 וְשָׂנֵ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־הַ֣חַיִּ֔ים כִּ֣י רַ֤ע עָלַי֙ הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂ֖ה תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ כִּֽי־הַכֹּ֥ל הֶ֖בֶל וּרְע֥וּת רֽוּחַ׃

17 Therefore I hated life; because the work that is wrought under the sun is grievous to me: for all is vanity and vexation of spirit.Ecclesiastes 2:17
Stats
Rank: #6711 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 135 characters, 21 words, 106 letters, 44 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְשָׂנֵ֙אתִי֙ אֶת־הַ֣חַיִּ֔ים כִּ֣י רַ֤ע עָלַי֙ הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה שֶׁנַּעֲשָׂ֖ה תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ כִּֽי־הַכֹּ֥ל הֶ֖בֶל וּרְע֥וּת רֽוּחַ׃

Lit: Therefore I hated life because was distressing to me the work that was done under the sun for all is vanity and grasping for the wind

KJV: Therefore I hated life; because the work that is wrought under the sun is grievous unto me: for all [is] vanity and vexation of spirit.
References

"I hated"
Nu 11:15: If you deal thus with me: kill me: I pray you: out of hand: if I have found favour in your sight; and let not me see my wretchedness.
1Ki 19:4: But He Himself went a day's journey into the wilderness: and came and sat down under a juniper tree: and He requested for Himself that He might die; and said: It is enough; now: O LORD: take away my life; for I am not better than my fathers.
Job 3:20-22: For what reason is light given to him that is in misery: and life to the bitter in soul;
Job 7:15: 16: So that my soul chooses strangling: and death rather than my life.
Job 14:13: O that you would'>would'>would hide me in the grave: that you would'>would'>would keep me secret: until your wrath be past: that you would'>would'>would appoint me a set time: and remember me!
Jer 20:14-18: Cursed be the day wherein I was born: not let the day wherein my mother bare me be blessed.
Jon 4:3: 8: Therefore now: O LORD: take: I beseech you: my life from me; for it is better for me to die than to live.
Php 1:23-25: For I am in a strait betwixt two: having a desire to depart: and to be with Christ; which is far better:

"work"
Ec 1:14: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and: look: all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 3:16: Moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment: that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness: that iniquity was there.
Eze 3:14: So the spirit lifted me up: and took me away: and I went in bitterness: in the heat of my spirit; but the hand of the LORD was strong upon me.

"for"
Ec 2:11: 22: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought: and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and: look: all was vanity and vexation of spirit: and there was no profit under the sun.
Ec 6:9: Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of the desire: this is also vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ps 89:47: Remember how short my time is: for what reason have you made all men in vain?

The Futility of Labor and Reward

וְשָׂנֵ֤אתִֽי אֲנִי֙ אֶת־כָּל־עֲמָלִ֔י שֶׁאֲנִ֥י עָמֵ֖ל תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ שֶׁ֣אַנִּיחֶ֔נּוּ לָאָדָ֖ם שֶׁיִּהְיֶ֥ה אַחֲרָֽי׃
