H4639 מַעֲשֶׂה maʻăseh mah-as-eh from עָשָׂה; an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property; act, art, phrase bakemeat, business, deed, do(-ing), labor, thing made, ware of making, occupation, thing offered, operation, possession, idiom well, (handy-, needle-, net-) work(ing, -manship), wrought. 		הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֖הham-ma-‘ă-śeh work Art | N-ms
H8033שָֽׁם׃šām.   (Adv)
H8033 שָׁם shâm shawm a primitive particle (rather from the relative pronoun, אֲשֶׁר); there (transferring to time) then; often thither, or thence; in it, phrase thence, there (-in, phrase of, phrase out), phrase thither, phrase whither. 		שָֽׁם׃šām. there Adv
17 I said in my heart, God will judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.Ecclesiastes 3:17
Stats
Rank: #6610 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 131 characters, 24 words, 103 letters, 41 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אָמַ֤רְתִּֽי אֲנִי֙ בְּלִבִּ֔י אֶת־הַצַּדִּיק֙ וְאֶת־הָ֣רָשָׁ֔ע יִשְׁפֹּ֖ט הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּי־עֵ֣ת לְכָל־חֵ֔פֶץ וְעַ֥ל כָּל־הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֖ה שָֽׁם׃

Lit: Said I in my heart the righteous and the wicked shall judge God for there is a time for every purpose for every work there

KJV: I said in mine heart, God shall judge the righteous and the wicked: for there is a time there for every purpose and for every work.
References

"said"
Ec 1:16: I communed with my own heart: saying: Indeed: I am come to great estate: and have gotten more wisdom than all they that have been before me in Jerusalem: yes: my heart had great experience of wisdom and knowledge.
Ec 2:1: I said in my heart: Go to now: I will prove you with mirth: therefore enjoy pleasure: and: look: this also is vanity.

"God"
Ec 12:14: For God will bring every work into judgment: with every secret thing: whether it be good: or whether it be evil.
Ge 18:25: That be far from you to do after this manner: to kill the righteous with the wicked: and that the righteous should be as the wicked: that be far from you: Will not the Judge of all the earth do right?
Ps 98:9: Before the LORD; for He comes to judge the earth: with righteousness will He judge the world: and the people with equity.
Mt 16:27: For the Son of man will come in the glory of His Father with His angels; and then He will reward every man according to His works.
Mt 25:31-46: When the Son of man will come in His glory: and all the holy angels with Him: then will He sit upon the throne of His glory:
Joh 5:22: 26-29: For the Father judges no man: but has committed all judgment to the Son:
Ac 17:31: Because he has appointed a day: in the which he will judge the world in righteousness by that man whom he has ordained; whereof he has given assurance to all men: in that he has raised him from the dead.
Ro 2:5-9: But after your hardness and impenitent heart treasure up to yourself wrath against the day of wrath and revelation of the righteous judgment of God;
1Co 4:5: Therefore not judgehing before the time: until the Lord come: who both will bring to light the hidden things of darkness: and will make manifest the counsels of the hearts: and then will every man have praise of God.
2Co 5:10: For we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ; that every one may receive the things done in His body: according to that He has done: whether it be good or bad.
2Th 1:6-10: Seeing it is a righteous thing with God to recompense tribulation to them that trouble you;
Re 20:11-15: I saw a great white throne: and him that sat on it: from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away; and there was found no place for them.

"for"
Ec 3:1: To every thing there is a season: and a time to every purpose under the heaven:
Jer 29:10: 11: For thus says the LORD: That after 70 years be accomplished at Babylon I will visit you: and perform my good word toward you: in causing you to return to this place.
Da 11:40: At the time of the end will the king of the south push at him: and the king of the north will come against him like a whirlwind: with chariots: and with horsemen: and with many ships; and he will enter into the countries: and will overflow and pass over.
Da 12:4: 9: 11-13: But you: O Daniel: shut up the words: and seal the book: even to the time of the end: many will run to and fro: and knowledge will be increased.
Ac 1:7: He said to them: It not is for you to know the times or the seasons: which the Father has put in His own power.
1Th 5:1: But of the times and the seasons: brothers: you have no need that I write to you.
2Pe 3:7: 8: But the heavens and the earth: which are now: by the same word are kept in store: reserved to fire against the day of judgment and perdition of ungodly men.
Re 11:2: 3: 18: But the court which is without the temple leave out: and measure not it; for it is given to the Gentiles: and the holy city will they tread under foot 40 and two months.
Re 17:12-17: The 10 horns which you saw are 10 kings: which have received no kingdom as yet; but receive power as kings one hour with the beast.
Re 20:2: 7-9: He laid hold on the dragon: that old serpent: which is the Devil: and Satan: and bound him a000 years:

אָמַ֤רְתִּֽי אֲנִי֙ בְּלִבִּ֔י עַל־דִּבְרַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י הָאָדָ֔ם לְבָרָ֖ם הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְלִרְאֹ֕ות שְׁהֶם־בְּהֵמָ֥ה הֵ֖מָּה לָהֶֽם׃

18 I said in my heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.Ecclesiastes 3:18
Stats
Rank: #6654 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 149 characters, 26 words, 119 letters, 42 vowels, 77 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אָמַ֤רְתִּֽי אֲנִי֙ בְּלִבִּ֔י עַל־דִּבְרַת֙ בְּנֵ֣י הָאָדָ֔ם לְבָרָ֖ם הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים וְלִרְאֹ֕ות שְׁהֶם־בְּהֵמָ֥ה הֵ֖מָּה לָהֶֽם׃

Lit: Said I in my heart Concerning the condition of the sons of men tests them God that they may see that they are like animals they themselves

KJV: I said in mine heart concerning the estate of the sons of men, that God might manifest them, and that they might see that they themselves are beasts.
References

"concerning"
Ge 3:17-19: to Adam he said: Because you have listened to the voice of your wife: and have eaten of the tree: of which I commanded you: saying: You will not eat of it: cursed is the ground for your sake; in sorrow will you eat of it all the days of your life;
Job 14:1-4: Man that is born of a woman is of few days: and full of trouble.
Job 15:16: How much more abominable and filthy is man: which drinks iniquity like water?
Ps 49:14: 19: 20: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death will feed on them; and the upright will have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty will consume in the grave from their dwelling.
Ps 73:18: 19: Surely you did set them in slippery places: you castedst them down into destruction.
Ps 90:5-12: You carry them away as with a flood; they are as a sleep: in the morning they are like grass which grows up.
Heb 9:27: As it is appointed to men once to die: but after this the judgment:
1Pe 1:24: For all flesh is as grass: and all the glory of man as the flower of grass. The grass withers: and the flower thereof falls away:

"that God, etc"
Job 40:8: Will you also disannul my judgment? will you condemn me: that you may be righteous?
Ps 51:4: Against you: you only: have I sinned: and done this evil in your sight: that you might be justified when you speak: and be clear when you judge.
Ro 3:4: God forbid: yes: let God be true: but every man a liar; as it is written: That you might'>might be justified in your sayings: and might'>might overcome when you are judged.
Ro 9:23: That he might make known the riches of his glory on the vessels of mercy: which he had afore prepared to glory:

"and that"
Ps 73:22: So foolish was I: and ignorant: I was as a beast before you.
2Pe 2:12: But these: as natural brute beasts: made to be taken and destroyed: speak evil of the things that they not understand; and will utterly perish in their own corruption;

H7307וְר֥וּחַwə-rū-aḥ   (Conj-w | N-cs)
H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		וְר֥וּחַwə-rū-aḥ and breath Conj-w | N-cs

H369אָ֔יִן’ā-yin,   (Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. H3588כִּ֥יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֥יkî for Conj

H1892הָֽבֶל׃hā-ḇel.   (N-ms)
H1892 הֶבֶל hebel hehbel or (rarely in the abs.) הֲבֵל; from הָבַל; emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb; idiom altogether, vain, vanity. 		הָֽבֶל׃hā-ḇel. is vanity N-ms
19 For that which befalls'>befalls'>befalls the sons of men befalls'>befalls'>befalls beasts; even one thing befalls'>befalls'>befalls them: as the one dies'>dies, so dies'>dies the other; yes, they have all one breath; so that a man has no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.Ecclesiastes 3:19
Stats
Counts: 226 characters, 36 words, 176 letters, 68 vowels, 108 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּי֩ מִקְרֶ֨ה בְֽנֵי־הָאָדָ֜ם וּמִקְרֶ֣ה הַבְּהֵמָ֗ה וּמִקְרֶ֤ה אֶחָד֙ לָהֶ֔ם כְּמֹ֥ות זֶה֙ כֵּ֣ן מֹ֣ות זֶ֔ה וְר֥וּחַ אֶחָ֖ד לַכֹּ֑ל וּמֹותַ֨ר הָאָדָ֤ם מִן־הַבְּהֵמָה֙ אָ֔יִן כִּ֥י הַכֹּ֖ל הָֽבֶל׃

Lit: For what happens to the sons of men and happens to animals and befalls one thing them as dies this one so dies this one and breath one surely they all have and advantage man over animals has no for all is vanity

KJV: For that which befalleth the sons of men befalleth beasts; even one thing befalleth them: as the one dieth, so dieth the other; yea, they have all one breath; so that a man hath no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.
References

"that which"
Ec 2:16: For there is no remembrance of the wise more than of the fool for ever; seeing that which now is in the days to come will all be forgotten. And how dies the wise man? as the fool.
Ps 49:12: 20: Nevertheless man being in honour abides not: he is like the beasts that perish.
Ps 92:6: 7: A brutish man knows not; neither does a fool understand this.

"as the"
2Sa 14:14: For we must needs die: and are as water spilt on the ground: which cannot be gathered up again; neither does God respect any person: yet does He devise means: that His banished not be expelled from Him.
Job 14:10-12: But man dies: and wasts away: yes: man gives up the ghost: and where is he?
Ps 104:29: You hid your face: they are troubled: you take away their breath: they die: and return to their dust.

"for"
Ec 2:20-23: Therefore I went about to cause my heart to despair of all the labour which I took under the sun.
Ps 39:5: 6: Look: you have made my days as an handbreadth; and my age is not ashing before you: truly every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.
Ps 89:47: 48: Remember how short my time is: for what reason have you made all men in vain?

20 All go to one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.Ecclesiastes 3:20
Stats
Counts: 71 characters, 14 words, 53 letters, 22 vowels, 31 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הַכֹּ֥ל הֹולֵ֖ךְ אֶל־מָקֹ֣ום אֶחָ֑ד הַכֹּל֙ הָיָ֣ה מִן־הֶֽעָפָ֔ר וְהַכֹּ֖ל שָׁ֥ב אֶל־הֶעָפָֽר׃

Lit: All go to place one all are from the dust and all return to dust

KJV: All go unto one place; all are of the dust, and all turn to dust again.
References

"go"
Ec 3:21: Who knows the spirit of man that goes'>goes upward: and the spirit of the beast that goes'>goes downward to the earth?
Ec 6:6: Yes: though he live a000 years twice told: yet has he seen no good: not do all go to one place?
Ec 9:10: Whatever your hand finds to do: do it with your might; for there is no work: nor device: nor knowledge: nor wisdom: in the grave: whither you go.
Ge 25:8: 17: Then Abraham gave up the ghost: and died in a good old age: an old man: and full of years; and was gathered to his people.
Nu 27:13: When you have seen it: you also will be gathered to your people: as Aaron your brother was gathered.
Job 7:9: As the cloud is consumed and vanishes away: so he who goes down to the grave will come up no more.
Job 17:13: If I wait: the grave is my house: I have made my bed in the darkness.
Job 30:24: Howbeit he not will stretch out his hand to the grave: though they cry in his destruction.
Ps 49:14: Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death will feed on them; and the upright will have dominion over them in the morning; and their beauty will consume in the grave from their dwelling.

"all are"
Ge 3:19: In the sweat of your face will you eat bread: till you return to the ground; for out of it were you taken: for dust you are: and to dust will you return.

Job 34:15: All flesh will perish together: and man will turn again to dust.
Ps 104:29: You hid your face: they are troubled: you take away their breath: they die: and return to their dust.
Da 12:2: Many of them that sleep in the dust of the earth will awake: some to everlasting life: and some to shame and everlasting contempt.

21 Who knows the spirit of man that goes'>goes upward, and the spirit of the beast that goes'>goes downward to the earth?Ecclesiastes 3:21
Stats
Rank: #8268 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 110 characters, 20 words, 88 letters, 30 vowels, 58 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מִ֣י יֹודֵ֗עַ ר֚וּחַ בְּנֵ֣י הָאָדָ֔ם הָעֹלָ֥ה הִ֖יא לְמָ֑עְלָה וְר֙וּחַ֙ הַבְּהֵמָ֔ה הַיֹּרֶ֥דֶת הִ֖יא לְמַ֥טָּה לָאָֽרֶץ׃

Lit: Who knows the spirit of the sons of men which goes it upward and the spirit of the animal which goes it down to the earth

KJV: Who knoweth the spirit of man that goeth upward, and the spirit of the beast that goeth downward to the earth?
References

"knoweth"
Ec 12:7: Then will the dust return to the earth as it was: and the spirit will return to God who gave it.

Joh 14:3: If I go and prepare a place for you: I will come again: and receive you to myself; that where I am: there you may be also.
Ac 1:25: That he may take part of this ministry and apostleship: from which Judas by transgression fell: that he might go to his own place.
2Co 5:1: 8: For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved: we have a building of God: an not house made with hands: eternal in the heavens.
Php 1:23: For I am in a strait betwixt two: having a desire to depart: and to be with Christ; which is far better:

22 For what reason I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who will bring him to see what will be after him?Ecclesiastes 3:22
Stats
Counts: 182 characters, 30 words, 142 letters, 52 vowels, 90 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְרָאִ֗יתִי כִּ֣י אֵ֥ין טֹוב֙ מֵאֲשֶׁ֨ר יִשְׂמַ֤ח הָאָדָם֙ בְּֽמַעֲשָׂ֔יו כִּי־ה֖וּא חֶלְקֹ֑ו כִּ֣י מִ֤י יְבִיאֶ֙נּוּ֙ לִרְאֹ֔ות בְּמֶ֖ה שֶׁיִּהְיֶ֥ה אַחֲרָֽיו׃

Lit: so I perceived that nothing is better than that should rejoice a man in his own works for that is his heritage For who can bring him to see what will happen after him

KJV: Wherefore I perceive that there is nothing better, than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that [is] his portion: for who shall bring him to see what shall be after him?
References

"nothing"
Ec 3:11: 12: He has made every thing beautiful in His time: also He has set the world in their heart: so that no man can find out the work that God makes from the beginning to the end.
Ec 2:10: 11: 24: whatever my eyes desired I not kept from them: I not withheld my heart from any joy; for my heart rejoiced in all my labour: and this was my portion of all my labour.
Ec 5:18-20: Look that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink: and to enjoy the good of all His labour that He takes under the sun all the days of His life: which God gives Him: for it is His portion.
Ec 8:15: Then I commended mirth: because a man has no better thing under the sun: than to eat: and to drink: and to be merry: for that will abide with Him of His labour the days of His life: which God gives Him under the sun.
Ec 9:7-9: Go your way: eat your bread with joy: and drink your wine with a merry heart; for God now accepts your works.
Ec 11:9: Rejoice: O young man: in your youth; and let your heart cheer you in the days of your youth: and walk in the ways of your heart: and in the sight of your eyes: but know you: that for all these things God will bring you into judgment.
De 12:7: 18: There you will eat before the LORD your God: and you will rejoice in all that you put your hand to: you and your households: wherein the LORD your God has blessed you.
De 26:10: 11: Now: look: I have brought the firstfruits of the land: which you: O LORD: have given me. And you will set it before the LORD your God: and worship before the LORD your God:
De 28:47: Because you not servedst the LORD your God with joyfulness: and with gladness of heart: for the abundance of all things;
Ro 12:11: 12: Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;
Php 4:4: 5: Rejoice in the Lord alway: and again I say: Rejoice.

"who"
Ec 6:12: For who knows what is good for man in this life: all the days of his vain life which he spends as a shadow? for who can tell a man what will be after him under the sun?
Ec 8:7: For he knows not that which will be: for who can tell him when it will be?
Ec 9:12: For man also knows not his time: as the fishes that are taken in an evil net: and as the birds that are caught in the snare; so are the sons of men snared in an evil time: when it falls suddenly upon them.
Ec 10:14: A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what will be; and what will be after him: who can tell him?
Job 14:21: His sons come to honour: and he knows it not; and they are brought low: but he perceives it not of them.
Da 12:9: 10: 13: He said: Go your way: Daniel: for the words are closed up and sealed till the time of the end.
Mt 6:34: Take therefore no thought for the morrow: for the morrow will take thought for the things of itself. Sufficient to the day is the evil thereof.

4
The Evil of Oppression

וְשַׁ֣בְתִּֽי אֲנִ֗י וָאֶרְאֶה֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָ֣עֲשֻׁקִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר נַעֲשִׂ֖ים תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ דִּמְעַ֣ת הָעֲשֻׁקִ֗ים וְאֵ֤ין לָהֶם֙ מְנַחֵ֔ם וּמִיַּ֤ד עֹֽשְׁקֵיהֶם֙ כֹּ֔חַ וְאֵ֥ין לָהֶ֖ם מְנַחֵֽם׃

H7725וְשַׁ֣בְתִּֽיwə-šaḇ-tî   (Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjPerf-1cs)
H7725 שׁוּב shûwb shoob a primitive root; to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again; ((break, build, circumcise, dig, do anything, do evil, feed, lay down, lie down, lodge, make, rejoice, send, take, weep)) idiom again, (cause to) answer (phrase again), idiom in any case (wise), idiom at all, averse, bring (again, back, home again), call (to mind), carry again (back), cease, idiom certainly, come again (back), idiom consider, phrase continually, convert, deliver (again), phrase deny, draw back, fetch home again, idiom fro, get (oneself) (back) again, idiom give (again), go again (back, home), (go) out, hinder, let, (see) more, idiom needs, be past, idiom pay, pervert, pull in again, put (again, up again), recall, recompense, recover, refresh, relieve, render (again), requite, rescue, restore, retrieve, (cause to, make to) return, reverse, reward, phrase say nay, send back, set again, slide back, still, idiom surely, take back (off), (cause to, make to) turn (again, self again, away, back, back again, backward, from, off), withdraw. 		וְשַׁ֣בְתִּֽיwə-šaḇ-tî And returned Conj-w | V-Qal-ConjPerf-1cs
H589אֲנִ֗י’ă-nî,   (Pro-1cs)
H589 אֲנִי ʼănîy an-ee lemma אֲנַי second vowel, corrected to אֲנִי; contracted from אָנֹכִי; I; I, (as for) me, mine, myself, we, idiom which, idiom who., 		אֲנִ֗י’ă-nî, I Pro-1cs
H7200וָאֶרְאֶה֙wā-’er-’eh   (Conj-w | V-Qal-ConsecImperf-1cs)
H7200 רָאָה râʼâh raw-aw a primitive root; to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative); advise self, appear, approve, behold, idiom certainly, consider, discern, (make to) enjoy, have experience, gaze, take heed, idiom indeed, idiom joyfully, lo, look (on, one another, one on another, one upon another, out, up, upon), mark, meet, idiom be near, perceive, present, provide, regard, (have) respect, (fore-, cause to, let) see(-r, -m, one another), shew (self), idiom sight of others, (e-) spy, stare, idiom surely, idiom think, view, visions. 		וָאֶרְאֶה֙wā-’er-’eh and considered Conj-w | V-Qal-ConsecImperf-1cs
H3605כָּל־kāl-   (N-msc)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כָּל־kāl- all N-msc
H6217הָ֣עֲשֻׁקִ֔יםhā-‘ă-šu-qîm,   (Art | V-Qal-QalPassPrtcpl-mp)
H6217 עָשׁוּק ʻâshûwq aw-shook or עָשֻׁק; passive participle of עָשַׁק; used in plural masculine as abstractly, tyranny; oppressed(-ion). (Doubtful.) 		הָ֣עֲשֻׁקִ֔יםhā-‘ă-šu-qîm, the oppression Art | V-Qal-QalPassPrtcpl-mp
H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer that Pro-r
H6213נַעֲשִׂ֖יםna-‘ă-śîm   (V-Nifal-Prtcpl-mp)
H6213 עָשָׂה ʻâsâh aw-saw a primitive root; to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application; accomplish, advance, appoint, apt, be at, become, bear, bestow, bring forth, bruise, be busy, idiom certainly, have the charge of, commit, deal (with), deck, phrase displease, do, (ready) dress(-ed), (put in) execute(-ion), exercise, fashion, phrase feast, (fight-) ing man, phrase finish, fit, fly, follow, fulfill, furnish, gather, get, go about, govern, grant, great, phrase hinder, hold (a feast), idiom indeed, phrase be industrious, phrase journey, keep, labour, maintain, make, be meet, observe, be occupied, offer, phrase officer, pare, bring (come) to pass, perform, pracise, prepare, procure, provide, put, requite, idiom sacrifice, serve, set, shew, idiom sin, spend, idiom surely, take, idiom thoroughly, trim, idiom very, phrase vex, be (warr-) ior, work(-man), yield, use. 		נַעֲשִׂ֖יםna-‘ă-śîm is done V-Nifal-Prtcpl-mp

H8478 תַּחַת tachath takh-ath from the same as תּוֹחַ; the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.; as, beneath, idiom flat, in(-stead), (same) place (where...is), room, for...sake, stead of, under, idiom unto, idiom when...was mine, whereas, (where-) fore, with. 		תַּ֣חַתta-ḥaṯ under Prep
H8121הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁhaš-šā-meš;   (Art | N-cs)
H8121 שֶׁמֶשׁ shemesh sheh-mesh from an unused root meaning to be brilliant; the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement; phrase east side(-ward), sun (rising), phrase west(-ward), window. See also בֵּית שֶׁמֶשׁ. 		הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁhaš-šā-meš; the sun Art | N-cs

H369וְאֵ֤יןwə-’ên   (Conj-w | Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. Compare אַיִן. 		וְאֵ֤יןwə-’ên but no Conj-w | Adv

H5162מְנַחֵ֔םmə-na-ḥêm,   (V-Piel-Prtcpl-ms)
H5162 נָחַם nâcham naw-kham a primitive root; properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself); comfort (self), ease (ones self), repent(-er,-ing, self). 		מְנַחֵ֔םmə-na-ḥêm, comforter V-Piel-Prtcpl-ms
H3027וּמִיַּ֤דū-mî-yaḏ   (Conj-w, Prep-m | N-fsc)
H3027 יָד yâd yawd a primitive word; in distinction from כַּף, the closed one); used (as noun, adverb, etc.) in a great variety of applications, both literally and figuratively, both proximate and remote (as follows); a hand (the open one (indicating power, means, direction, etc.),; (phrase be) able, idiom about, phrase armholes, at, axletree, because of, beside, border, idiom bounty, phrase broad, (broken-) handed, idiom by, charge, coast, phrase consecrate, phrase creditor, custody, debt, dominion, idiom enough, phrase fellowship, force, idiom from, hand(-staves, -y work), idiom he, himself, idiom in, labour, phrase large, ledge, (left-) handed, means, idiom mine, ministry, near, idiom of, idiom order, ordinance, idiom our, parts, pain, power, idiom presumptuously, service, side, sore, state, stay, draw with strength, stroke, phrase swear, terror, idiom thee, idiom by them, idiom themselves, idiom thine own, idiom thou, through, idiom throwing, phrase thumb, times, idiom to, idiom under, idiom us, idiom wait on, (way-) side, where, phrase wide, idiom with (him, me, you), work, phrase yield, idiom yourselves. 		וּמִיַּ֤דū-mî-yaḏ and On the side Conj-w, Prep-m | N-fsc

H6231 עָשַׁק ʻâshaq aw-shak a primitive root (compare עָשַׂק); to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow; get deceitfully, deceive, defraud, drink up, (use) oppress(-ion), -or), do violence (wrong). 		עֹֽשְׁקֵיהֶם֙‘ō-šə-qê-hem of their oppressors V-Qal-Prtcpl-mpc | 3mp
H3581כֹּ֔חַkō-aḥ,   (N-ms)
H3581 כֹּחַ kôach ko-akh or (Daniel 11:6) כּוֹחַ; from an unused root meaning to be firm; vigor, literally (force, in a good or a bad sense) or figuratively (capacity, means, produce); also (from its hardiness) a large lizard; ability, able, chameleon, force, fruits, might, power(-ful), strength, substance, wealth. 		כֹּ֔חַkō-aḥ, there is power N-ms

Hלָהֶ֖םlā-hem   (Prep | 3mp)

H5162מְנַחֵֽם׃mə-na-ḥêm.   (V-Piel-Prtcpl-ms)
H5162 נָחַם nâcham naw-kham a primitive root; properly, to sigh, i.e. breathe strongly; by implication, to be sorry, i.e. (in a favorable sense) to pity, console or (reflexively) rue; or (unfavorably) to avenge (oneself); comfort (self), ease (ones self), repent(-er,-ing, self). 		מְנַחֵֽם׃mə-na-ḥêm. comforter V-Piel-Prtcpl-ms
1 So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and look the tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.Ecclesiastes 4:1
Stats
Rank: #6203 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 235 characters, 36 words, 185 letters, 69 vowels, 116 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְשַׁ֣בְתִּֽי אֲנִ֗י וָאֶרְאֶה֙ אֶת־כָּל־הָ֣עֲשֻׁקִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר נַעֲשִׂ֖ים תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וְהִנֵּ֣ה ׀ דִּמְעַ֣ת הָעֲשֻׁקִ֗ים וְאֵ֤ין לָהֶם֙ מְנַחֵ֔ם וּמִיַּ֤ד עֹֽשְׁקֵיהֶם֙ כֹּ֔חַ וְאֵ֥ין לָהֶ֖ם מְנַחֵֽם׃

Lit: And returned I and considered all the oppression that is done under the sun And look the tears of the oppressed but no they have comforter and On the side of their oppressors there is power but no they have comforter

KJV: So I returned, and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and behold the tears of such as were oppressed, and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors [there was] power; but they had no comforter.
References

"I returned"
Job 6:29: Return: I pray you: let not it be iniquity; yes: return again: my righteousness is in it.
Mal 3:18: Then will you return: and discern between the righteous and the wicked: between Him that serves'>serves God and Him that serves'>serves Him not">not Him.

"and considered"
Ec 3:16: Moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment: that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness: that iniquity was there.
Ec 5:8: If you see the oppression of the poor: and violent perverting of judgment and justice in a province: not marvel at the matter: for he who is higher than the high regards; and there be higher than they.
Ec 7:7: Surely oppression makes a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.
Ex 1:13: 14: 16: 22: The Egyptians made the children of Israel to serve with rigour:
Ex 2:23: 24: It came to pass in process of time: that the king of Egypt died: and the children of Israel sighed by reason of the bondage: and they cried: and their cry came up to God by reason of the bondage.
Ex 5:16-19: There is no straw given to your servants: and they say to us: Make brick: and: look: your servants are beaten; but the fault is in your own people.
De 28:33: 48: The fruit of your land: and all your labours: will a nation which you know not eat up; and you will be only oppressed and crushed alway:
Jg 4:3: The children of Israel cried to the LORD: for He had 900 chariots of iron; and 20 years He mightily oppressed the children of Israel.
Jg 10:7: 8: The anger of the LORD was hot against Israel: and He sold them into the hands of the Philistines: and into the hands of the children of Ammon.
Ne 5:1-5: There was a great cry of the people and of their wives against their brothers the Jews.
Job 24:7-12: They cause the naked to lodge without clothing: that they have no covering in the cold.
Ps 10:9: 10: He lies'>lies in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lies'>lies in wait to catch the poor: he does catch the poor: when he draws him into his net.
Pr 28:3: 15: 16: A poor man that oppresss the poor is like a sweeping rain which leaves no food.
Isa 5:7: For the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the house of Israel: and the men of Judah His pleasant plant: and He looked for judgment: but look oppression; for righteousness: but look a cry.
Isa 51:23: But I will put it into the hand of them that afflict you; which have said to your soul: Bow down: that we may go over: and you have laid your body as the ground: and as the street: to them that went over.
Isa 59:7: 13-15: Their feet run to evil: and they make haste to shed innocent blood: their thoughts are thoughts of iniquity; wasting and destruction are in their paths.
Mal 3:5: I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers: and against the adulterers: and against false swearers: and against those that oppress the hireling in His wages: the widow: and the fatherless: and that turn aside the stranger from His right: and not fear me: says the LORD of hosts.

"the tears"
Ps 42:3: 9: My tears have been my meat day and night: while they continually say to me: Where is your God?
Ps 80:5: You feed them with the bread of tears; and give them tears to drink in great measure.
Ps 102:8: 9: My enemies reproach me all the day; and they that are mad against me are sworn against me.
Mal 2:13: This have you done again: covering the altar of the LORD with tears: with weeping: and with crying out: insomuch that He regards not the offering any more: or receives it with good will at your hand.
Jas 5:4: Look: the hire of the labourers who have reaped down your fields: which is of you kept back by fraud: cries: and the cries of them which have reaped are entered into the ears of the Lord of sabaoth.

"they had"
Job 16:4: I also could speak as you do: if your soul were in my soul's stead: I could heap up words against you: and shake my head at you.
Job 19:21: 22: Have pity upon me: have pity upon me: O you my friends; for the hand of God has touched me.
Ps 69:20: Reproach has broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness: and I looked for some to take pity: but there was none; and for comforters: but I found none.
Ps 142:4: I looked on my right hand: and beheld: but there was no man that would know me: refuge failed me; no man cared for my soul.
Pr 19:7: All the brothers of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursues them with words: yet they are wanting to him.
La 1:2: 9: She weeps sore in the night: and her tears are on her cheeks: among all her lovers she has none to comfort her: all her friends have dealt treacherously with her: they are become her enemies.
Mt 26:56: But all this was done: that the scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples forsook him: and fled.
2Ti 4:16: 17: At my first answer no man stood with me: but all men forsook me: I pray God that it not may be laid to their charge.

2 For what reason I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.Ecclesiastes 4:2
Stats
Counts: 93 characters, 17 words, 76 letters, 32 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְשַׁבֵּ֧חַ אֲנִ֛י אֶת־הַמֵּתִ֖ים שֶׁכְּבָ֣ר מֵ֑תוּ מִן־הַ֣חַיִּ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֛ר הֵ֥מָּה חַיִּ֖ים עֲדֶֽנָה׃

Lit: Therefore praised I the dead who already were dead More than the living who are alive still

KJV: Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.
References

"Wherefore I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive."
Ec 2:17: Therefore I hated life; because the work that is wrought under the sun is grievous to me: for all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 9:4-6: For to him that is joined to all the living there is hope: for a living dog is better than a dead lion.
Job 3:17-21: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.

 וְטֹוב֙ מִשְּׁנֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־עֲדֶ֖ן לֹ֣א הָיָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־רָאָה֙ אֶת־הַמַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה הָרָ֔ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר נַעֲשָׂ֖ה תַּ֥חַת הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃

H2896וְטוֹב֙wə-ṭō-wḇ   (Conj-w | Adj-ms)
H2896 טוֹב ṭôwb tobe from טוֹב; good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well); beautiful, best, better, bountiful, cheerful, at ease, idiom fair (word), (be in) favour, fine, glad, good (deed, -lier, -liest, -ly, -ness, -s), graciously, joyful, kindly, kindness, liketh (best), loving, merry, idiom most, pleasant, phrase pleaseth, pleasure, precious, prosperity, ready, sweet, wealth, welfare, (be) well(-favoured)., 		וְטוֹב֙wə-ṭō-wḇ And yet better is he Conj-w | Adj-ms

H834אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer-   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer- who Pro-r

3 Yes, better is he than both they, which has not yet been, who has not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.Ecclesiastes 4:3
Stats
Counts: 118 characters, 22 words, 90 letters, 32 vowels, 58 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְטֹוב֙ מִשְּׁנֵיהֶ֔ם אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־עֲדֶ֖ן לֹ֣א הָיָ֑ה אֲשֶׁ֤ר לֹֽא־רָאָה֙ אֶת־הַמַּעֲשֶׂ֣ה הָרָ֔ע אֲשֶׁ֥ר נַעֲשָׂ֖ה תַּ֥חַת הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃

Lit: And yet better is he than the two of them who yet never has existed who not has seen the work evil that is done under the sun

KJV: Yea, better is he than both they, which hath not yet been, who hath not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.
References

"better"
Ec 6:3-5: If a man beget 100 children: and live many years: so that the days of his years be many: and his soul not be filled with good: and also that he have no burial; I say: that an untimely birth is better than he.
Job 3:10-16: Because it not shut up the doors of my mother's womb: nor hid sorrow from my eyes.
Job 10:18: 19: For what reason then have you brought me forth out of the womb? Oh that I had given up the ghost: and no eye had seen me!
Jer 20:17: 18: Because he killed not me from the womb; or that my mother might have been my grave: and her womb to be always great with me.
Mt 24:19: Woe to them that are with child: and to them that give suck in those days!
Lu 23:29: For: look: the days are coming: in the which they will say: Blessed are the barren: and the wombs that never bare: and the paps which never gave suck.

"who"
Ec 1:14: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and: look: all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 2:17: Therefore I hated life; because the work that is wrought under the sun is grievous to me: for all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ps 55:6-11: I said: Oh that I had wings like a dove! for then would I fly away: and be at rest.
Jer 9:2: 3: Oh that I had in the wilderness a lodging place of wayfaring men; that I might leave my people: and go from them! for they be all adulterers: an assembly of treacherous men.

H7307רֽוּחַ׃rū-aḥ.   (N-cs)
H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		רֽוּחַ׃rū-aḥ. the wind N-cs
4 Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.Ecclesiastes 4:4
Stats
Counts: 146 characters, 23 words, 115 letters, 46 vowels, 69 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְרָאִ֨יתִֽי אֲנִ֜י אֶת־כָּל־עָמָ֗ל וְאֵת֙ כָּל־כִּשְׁרֹ֣ון הַֽמַּעֲשֶׂ֔ה כִּ֛י הִ֥יא קִנְאַת־אִ֖ישׁ מֵרֵעֵ֑הוּ גַּם־זֶ֥ה הֶ֖בֶל וּרְע֥וּת רֽוּחַ׃

Lit: And Again saw I that for all toil and every skillful work for it is envied a man by his neighbor Also this is vanity and grasping for the wind

KJV: Again, I considered all travail, and every right work, that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.
References

"every, etc"
Ge 4:4-8: Abel: He also brought of the firstlings of His flock and of the fat thereof. And the LORD had respect to Abel and to His offering:
Ge 37:2-11: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph: being 17 years old: was feeding the flock with his brothers; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah: and with the sons of Zilpah: his father's wives: and Joseph brought to his father their evil report.
1Sa 18:8: 9: 14-16: 29: 30: Saul was very angry: and the saying displeased him; and he said: They have ascribed to David 10 thousands: and to me they have ascribed but thousands: and what can he have more but the kingdom?
Pr 27:4: Wrath is cruel: and anger is outrageous; but who is able to stand before envy?
Mt 27:18: For he knew that for envy they had delivered him.
Ac 7:9: The patriarchs: moved with envy: sold Joseph into Egypt: but God was with Him:
Jas 4:5: Do you think that the scripture says in vain: The spirit that dwells in us lusts to envy?
1Jo 3:12: Not as Cain: who was of that wicked one: and killed his brother. And for what reason killed he him? Because his own works were evil: and his brother's righteous.

"This is"
Ec 4:16: There is no end of all the people: even of all that have been before them: they also that come after will not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 1:14: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and: look: all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 2:21: 26: For there is a man whose labour is in wisdom: and in knowledge: and in equity; yet to a man that has not laboured therein will he leave it for his portion. This also is vanity and a great evil.
Ec 6:9: 11: Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of the desire: this is also vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ge 37:4: 11: When his brothers saw that their father loved him more than all his brothers: they hated him: and not could speak peaceably to him.

H1320 בָּשָׂר bâsâr baw-sawr from בָּשַׂר; flesh (from its freshness); by extension, body, person; also (by euphemistically) the pudenda of aman; body, (fat, lean) flesh(-ed), kin, (man-) kind, phrase nakedness, self, skin. 		בְּשָׂרֽוֹ׃bə-śā-rōw. his own flesh N-msc | 3ms

"fool"

"eateth"

Pr 11:17: The merciful man does good to his own soul: but he who is cruel troubles his own flesh.
Isa 9:20: He will snatch on the right hand: and be hungry; and he will eat on the left hand: and they will not be satisfied: they will eat every man the flesh of his own arm:

KJV: Better is an handful [with] quietness, than both the hands full [with] travail and vexation of spirit.
References

"Better is an handful with quietness, than both the hands full with travail and vexation of spirit."

H1931הֽוּא׃hū.   (Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		הֽוּא׃hū. is Pro-3ms
8 There is one alone, and there is not a second; yes, he has neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither says he, For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity, yes, it is a sore travail.Ecclesiastes 4:8
Stats
Rank: #5142 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 294 characters, 37 words, 216 letters, 92 vowels, 124 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ אֶחָד֩ וְאֵ֨ין שֵׁנִ֜י גַּ֣ם בֵּ֧ן וָאָ֣ח אֵֽין־לֹ֗ו וְאֵ֥ין קֵץ֙ לְכָל־עֲמָלֹ֔ו גַּם־ [עֵינָיו כ] (עֵינֹ֖ו ק) לֹא־תִשְׂבַּ֣ע עֹ֑שֶׁר וּלְמִ֣י ׀ אֲנִ֣י עָמֵ֗ל וּמְחַסֵּ֤ר אֶת־נַפְשִׁי֙ מִטֹּובָ֔ה גַּם־זֶ֥ה הֶ֛בֶל וְעִנְיַ֥ן רָ֖ע הֽוּא׃

Lit: There is one alone and there is no second also son and brother no He has and yet there is no end to all his labors also his eye nor is satisfied with riches and But he never asks for whom I do toil and deprive myself of good also this vanity and a misfortune grave is

KJV: There is one alone, and [there is] not a second; yea, he hath neither child nor brother: yet [is there] no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither [saith he], For whom do I labour, and bereave my soul of good? This [is] also vanity, yea, it [is] a sore travail.
References

"one"
Ec 4:9-12: two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.
Ge 2:18: The LORD God said: It is not good that the man should be alone; I will make Him an help meet for Him.
Isa 56:3-5: Neither let the son of the stranger: that has joined Himself to the LORD: speak: saying: The LORD has utterly separated me from His people: neither let the eunuch say: Look: I am a dry tree.

"he hath"
Ge 15:2: 3: Abram said: Lord GOD: what will you give me: seeing I go childless: and the steward of my house is this Eliezer of Damascus?

"no"
Isa 5:8: Woe to them that join house to house: that lay field to field: till there be no place: that they may be placed alone in the middle of the earth!

"is his"
Ec 1:8: All things are full of labour; man cannot utter it: the eye not is satisfied with seeing: nor the ear filled with hearing.
Ec 5:10: He who loves'>loves silver will not be satisfied with silver; nor he who loves'>loves abundance with increase: this is also vanity.
Pr 27:20: Hell and destruction are never full; so the eyes of man are never satisfied.
Hab 2:5-9: Yes also: because he transgresss by wine: he is a proud man: neither keeps at home: who enlarges his desire as hell: and is as death: and cannot be satisfied: but gathers to him all nations: and heaps to him all people:
1Jo 2:16: For all that is in the world: the lust of the flesh: and the lust of the eyes: and the pride of life: not is of the Father: but is of the world.

"For"
Ps 39:6: Surely every man walks in a vain show: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heaps up riches: and knows not who will gather them.
Isa 44:19: 20: None considers in his heart: neither is there knowledge nor understanding to say: I have burned part of it in the fire; yes: also I have baked bread upon the coals thereof; I have roasted flesh: and eaten it: and will I make the residue thereof an abomination? will I fall down to the stock of a tree?
Lu 12:20: But God said to Him: You fool: this night your soul will be required of you: then whose will those things be: which you have provided?

"it is"
Ec 1:13: I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail has God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.
Ec 2:23: For all his days are sorrows: and his travail grief; yes: his heart takes not rest in the night. This is also vanity.
Isa 55:2: For what reason do you spend money for that which is not bread? and your labour for that which satisfies not? listen diligently to me: and eat you that which is good: and let your soul delight itself in fatness.
Mt 11:28: Come to me: all you that labour and are heavy laden: and I will give you rest.

Translation

Lit: are better two than one because they have they have a reward good for their labor

KJV: Two are better than one; because they have a good reward for their labour.

H3588כִּ֣יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî For Conj

10 For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falls; for he has not another to help him up.Ecclesiastes 4:10

Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־יִפֹּ֔לוּ הָאֶחָ֖ד יָקִ֣ים אֶת־חֲבֵרֹ֑ו וְאִ֣ילֹ֗ו הָֽאֶחָד֙ שֶׁיִּפֹּ֔ול וְאֵ֥ין שֵׁנִ֖י לַהֲקִימֹֽו׃

Lit: For if they fall one will lift up his companion But woe to him who is but one when he falls for he has no second to help him up

KJV: For if they fall, the one will lift up his fellow: but woe to him that is alone when he falleth; for [he hath] not another to help him up.

12 If one prevail against him, two will withstand him; and a threefold cord not is quickly broken.Ecclesiastes 4:12
Stats

Translation
Hebrew: וְאִֽם־יִתְקְפֹו֙ הָאֶחָ֔ד הַשְּׁנַ֖יִם יַעַמְד֣וּ נֶגְדֹּ֑ו וְהַחוּט֙ הַֽמְשֻׁלָּ֔שׁ לֹ֥א בִמְהֵרָ֖ה יִנָּתֵֽק׃

Lit: And Though may be overpowered by another one two can withstand him and a cord threefold not quickly is broken

KJV: And if one prevail against him, two shall withstand him; and a threefold cord is not quickly broken.

H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). H3808לֹא־lō-   (Adv-NegPrt)

13 Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.Ecclesiastes 4:13
Stats
Rank: #6202 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 95 characters, 19 words, 74 letters, 29 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: טֹ֛וב יֶ֥לֶד מִסְכֵּ֖ן וְחָכָ֑ם מִמֶּ֤לֶךְ זָקֵן֙ וּכְסִ֔יל אֲשֶׁ֛ר לֹא־יָדַ֥ע לְהִזָּהֵ֖ר עֹֽוד׃

Lit: Better a youth poor and wise Than king an old and foolish who no will be admonished more

KJV: Better is a poor and a wise child than an old and foolish king, who will no more be admonished.
References

"is a poor"
Ec 9:15: 16: Now there was found in it a poor wise man: and he by his wisdom delivered the city; yet no man remembered that same poor man.
Ge 37:2: These are the generations of Jacob. Joseph: being 17 years old: was feeding the flock with his brothers; and the lad was with the sons of Bilhah: and with the sons of Zilpah: his father's wives: and Joseph brought to his father their evil report.
Pr 19:1: Better is the poor that walks in his integrity: than he who is perverse in his lips: and is a fool.
Pr 28:6: 15: 16: Better is the poor that walks in his uprightness: than he who is perverse in his ways: though he be rich.

"will no more be"
1Ki 22:8: The king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat: There is yet one man: Micaiah the son of Imlah: by whom we may inquire of the LORD: but I hate Him; for He does not prophesy good concerning me: but evil. And Jehoshaphat said: not Let the king say so.
2Ch 16:9: 10: For the eyes of the LORD run to and fro throughout the whole earth: to show Himself strong in the behalf of them whose heart is perfect toward Him. Herein you have done foolishly: therefore from henceforth you will have wars.
2Ch 24:20-22: The Spirit of God came upon Zechariah the son of Jehoiada the priest: which stood above the people: and said to them: Thus says God: Why transgress you the commandments of the LORD: that you cannot prosper? because you have forsaken the LORD: He has also forsaken you.
2Ch 25:16: It came to pass: as He talked with Him: that the king said to Him: Are you made of the king's counsel? forbear; why should you be smitten? Then the prophet forbare: and said: I know that God has determined to destroy you: because you have done this: and have not listened to my counsel.

14 For out of prison he comes to reign; whereas also he who is born in his kingdom becomes poor.Ecclesiastes 4:14
Stats
Counts: 96 characters, 18 words, 76 letters, 30 vowels, 46 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּֽי־מִבֵּ֥ית הָסוּרִ֖ים יָצָ֣א לִמְלֹ֑ךְ כִּ֛י גַּ֥ם בְּמַלְכוּתֹ֖ו נֹולַ֥ד רָֽשׁ׃

Lit: For out of prison band he comes to be king whereas Although in his kingdom he was born poor

KJV: For out of prison he cometh to reign; whereas also he that is born in his kingdom becometh poor.

"For out"

Ps 113:7: 8: He raises up the poor out of the dust: and lifts the needy out of the dunghill;

"also"

2Ki 24:1: 2: 6: 12: In his days Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon came up: and Jehoiakim became his servant 3 years: then he turned and rebelled against him.

Da 4:31: While the word was in the king's mouth: there fell a voice from heaven: saying: O king Nebuchadnezzar: to you it is spoken; The kingdom is departed from you.

15 I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that will stand up in his stead.Ecclesiastes 4:15
Stats
Counts: 109 characters, 20 words, 87 letters, 28 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: רָאִ֙יתִי֙ אֶת־כָּל־הַ֣חַיִּ֔ים הַֽמְהַלְּכִ֖ים תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ עִ֚ם הַיֶּ֣לֶד הַשֵּׁנִ֔י אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲמֹ֖ד תַּחְתָּֽיו׃

Lit: I saw all the living who walk under the sun they were with the youth second who stands in his place

KJV: I considered all the living which walk under the sun, with the second child that shall stand up in his stead.

H834אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer-   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). H7307רֽוּחַ׃rū-aḥ.   (N-cs)
H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		רֽוּחַ׃rū-aḥ. the wind N-cs
16 There is no end of all the people, even of all that have been before them: they also that come after will not rejoice in him. Surely this also is vanity and vexation of spirit.Ecclesiastes 4:16
Stats
Rank: #7513 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 181 characters, 29 words, 139 letters, 56 vowels, 83 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֵֽין־קֵ֣ץ לְכָל־הָעָ֗ם לְכֹ֤ל אֲשֶׁר־הָיָה֙ לִפְנֵיהֶ֔ם גַּ֥ם הָאַחֲרֹונִ֖ים לֹ֣א יִשְׂמְחוּ־בֹ֑ו כִּֽי־גַם־זֶ֥ה הֶ֖בֶל וְרַעְיֹ֥ון רֽוּחַ׃

Lit: There was no end of all the people over whom he was made king yet those who come afterward not will rejoice in him surely also this is vanity and grasping for the wind

KJV: There is no end of all the people, [even] of all that have been before them: they also that come after shall not rejoice in him. Surely this also [is] vanity and vexation of spirit.
References

"no end"
2Sa 15:12: 13: Absalom sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite: David's counseller: from his city: even from Giloh: while he offered sacrifices. And the conspiracy was strong; for the people increased continually with Absalom.
1Ki 1:5-7: 40: Then Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself: saying: I will be king: and he prepared him chariots and horsemen: and 50 men to run before him.
1Ki 12:10-16: The young men that were grown up with him spoke to him: saying: Thus will you speak to this people that spoke to you: saying: Your father made our yoke heavy: but make you it lighter to us; thus will you say to them: My little finger will be thicker than my father's loins.

"they also"
Jg 9:19: 20: If you then have dealt truly and sincerely with Jerubbaal and with his house this day: then rejoice you in Abimelech: and let him also rejoice in you:
2Sa 18:7: 8: Where the people of Israel were killed before the servants of David: and there was there a great slaughter that day of 20000 men.
2Sa 19:9: All the people were at strife throughout all the tribes of Israel: saying: The king saved us out of the hand of our enemies: and he delivered us out of the hand of the Philistines; and now he is fled out of the land for Absalom.

"this"
Ec 1:14: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and: look: all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 2:11: 17: 26: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought: and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and: look: all was vanity and vexation of spirit: and there was no profit under the sun.

5
Approaching God with Awe

אַל־תְּבַהֵ֨ל עַל־פִּ֜יךָ וְלִבְּךָ֧ אַל־יְמַהֵ֛ר לְהֹוצִ֥יא דָבָ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֤ים בַּשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְאַתָּ֣ה עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ עַֽל־כֵּ֛ן יִהְי֥וּ דְבָרֶ֖יךָ מְעַטִּֽים׃

H7451רָֽע׃rā‘.   (Adj-ms)
H7451 רַע raʻ rah from רָעַע; bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral); adversity, affliction, bad, calamity, phrase displease(-ure), distress, evil((-favouredness), man, thing), phrase exceedingly, idiom great, grief(-vous), harm, heavy, hurt(-ful), ill (favoured), phrase mark, mischief(-vous), misery, naught(-ty), noisome, phrase not please, sad(-ly), sore, sorrow, trouble, vex, wicked(-ly, -ness, one), worse(-st), wretchedness, wrong. 1 Keep your foot when you go to the house of God, and be more ready to hear, than to give the sacrifice of fools: for they not consider that they do evil.Ecclesiastes 5:1
Stats
Counts: 155 characters, 29 words, 120 letters, 48 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַל־תְּבַהֵ֨ל עַל־פִּ֜יךָ וְלִבְּךָ֧ אַל־יְמַהֵ֛ר לְהֹוצִ֥יא דָבָ֖ר לִפְנֵ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֣י הָאֱלֹהִ֤ים בַּשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ וְאַתָּ֣ה עַל־הָאָ֔רֶץ עַֽל־כֵּ֛ן יִהְי֥וּ דְבָרֶ֖יךָ מְעַטִּֽים׃

Lit: Prudently Walk when you go to the house of God and draw near to hear rather than to give the fools sacrifice for not they do know that they do evil

KJV: Keep thy foot when thou goest to the house of God, and be more ready to hear, than to give the sacrifice of fools: for they consider not that they do evil.
References

"thy foot"
Ge 28:16: 17: Jacob awaked out of His sleep: and He said: Surely the LORD is in this place; and I knew it not.
Ex 3:5: He said: not Draw nigh here: put off your shoes from off your feet: for the place whereon you stand is holy ground.
Le 10:3: Then Moses said to Aaron: This is it that the LORD spoke: saying: I will be sanctified in them that come nigh me: and before all the people I will be glorified. And Aaron held His peace.
Jos 5:15: The captain of the LORD's host said to Joshua: Loose your shoe from off your foot; for the place whereon you stand is holy. And Joshua did so.
2Ch 26:16: But when He was strong: His heart was lifted up to His destruction: for He transgressed against the LORD His God: and went into the temple of the LORD to burn incense upon the altar of incense.
Ps 89:7: God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints: and to be had in reverence of all them that are about Him.
Isa 1:12-20: When you come to appear before me: who has required this at your hand: to tread my courts?
1Co 11:22: What? have you not houses to eat and to drink in? or despise you the church of God: and shame them that not have? What will I say to you? will I praise you in this? I praise you not.
Heb 12:28: 29: For what reason we receiving a kingdom which cannot be moved: let us have grace: whereby we may serve God acceptably with reverence and godly fear:

"ready"
Ac 10:33: Immediately therefore I sent to you; and you have well done that you are come. Now therefore are we all here present before God: to hear all things that are commanded you of God.
Ac 17:11: These were more noble than those in Thessalonica: in that they received the word with all readiness of mind: and searched the scriptures daily: whether those things were so.
Jas 1:19: For what reason: my beloved brothers: let every man be swift to hear: slow to speak: slow to wrath:
1Pe 2:1: 2: For what reason laying aside all malice: and all guile: and hypocrisies: and envies: and all evil speakings:

"give"
Ge 4:3-5: In process of time it came to pass: that Cain brought of the fruit of the ground an offering to the LORD.
1Sa 13:12: 13: Therefore said I: The Philistines will come down now upon me to Gilgal: and I not have made supplication to the LORD: I forced myself therefore: and offered a burnt offering.
1Sa 15:21: 22: But the people took of the spoil: sheep and oxen: the chief of the things which should have been utterly destroyed: to sacrifice to the LORD your God in Gilgal.
Ps 50:8-18: I not will reprove you for your sacrifices or your burnt offerings: to have been continually before me.
Pr 15:8: The sacrifice of the wicked is an abomination to the LORD: but the prayer of the upright is His delight.
Pr 21:27: The sacrifice of the wicked is abomination: how much more: when he brings it with a wicked mind?
Isa 1:12-15: When you come to appear before me: who has required this at your hand: to tread my courts?
Isa 66:3: He who kills an ox is as if he killed a man; he who sacrifices a lamb: as if he cut off a dog's neck; he who offers an oblation: as if he offered swine's blood; he who burns incense: as if he blessed an idol. Yes: they have chosen their own ways: and their soul delights in their abominations.
Jer 7:21-23: Thus says the LORD of hosts: the God of Israel; Put your burnt offerings to your sacrifices: and eat flesh.
Ho 6:6: 7: For I desired mercy: not and sacrifice; and the knowledge of God more than burnt offerings.
Mal 1:10: 11: Who is there even among you that would shut the doors for nought? neither do you kindle fire on my altar for nought. I have no pleasure in you: says the LORD of hosts: neither will I accept an offering at your hand.
Heb 10:26: For if we sin wilfully after that we have received the knowledge of the truth: there remains no more sacrifice for sins:

כִּ֛י בָּ֥א הַחֲלֹ֖ום בְּרֹ֣ב עִנְיָ֑ן וְקֹ֥ול כְּסִ֖יל בְּרֹ֥ב דְּבָרִֽים׃

H4592מְעַטִּֽים׃mə-‘aṭ-ṭîm.   (Adj-mp)
H4592 מְעַט mᵉʻaṭ meh-at or מְעָט; from מָעַט; a little or few (often adverbial or compar.); almost (some, very) few(-er, -est), lightly, little (while), (very) small (matter, thing), some, soon, idiom very., 		מְעַטִּֽים׃mə-‘aṭ-ṭîm. few Adj-mp
2 not Be rash with your mouth, and not let your heart be hasty to utter any thing before God: for God is in heaven, and you upon earth: therefore let your words be few.Ecclesiastes 5:2
Stats
Counts: 168 characters, 28 words, 128 letters, 46 vowels, 82 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֛י בָּ֥א הַחֲלֹ֖ום בְּרֹ֣ב עִנְיָ֑ן וְקֹ֥ול כְּסִ֖יל בְּרֹ֥ב דְּבָרִֽים׃

Lit: Not do be rash with your mouth and your heart not let hastily utter anything before God For God is in heaven and you on earth upon thus let be your words few

KJV: Be not rash with thy mouth, and let not thine heart be hasty to utter any thing before God: for God [is] in heaven, and thou upon earth: therefore let thy words be few.
References

"not rash"
Ge 18:27: 30: 32: Abraham answered and said: Look now: I have taken upon me to speak to the Lord: which am but dust and ashes:
Ge 28:20: 22: Jacob vowed a vow: saying: If God will be with me: and will keep me in this way that I go: and will give me bread to eat: and clothing to put on:
Nu 30:2-5: If a man vow a vow to the LORD: or swear an oath to bind His soul with a bond; He will not break His word: He will do according to all that proceeds out of His mouth.
Jg 11:30: Jephthah vowed a vow to the LORD: and said: If you will without fail deliver the children of Ammon into my hands:
1Sa 14:24-45: The men of Israel were distressed that day: for Saul had adjured the people: saying: Cursed be the man that eats any food until evening: that I may be avenged on my enemies. So none of the people tasted any food.
Mr 6:23: He sware to her: Whatever you will ask of me: I will give it you: to the half of my kingdom.

"for"
Ps 115:3: But our God is in the heavens: He has done whatever He has pleased.
Isa 55:9: For as the heavens are higher than the earth: so are my ways higher than your ways: and my thoughts than your thoughts.
Mt 6:9: After this manner therefore pray you: Our Father which are in heaven: Hallowed be your name.

"let thy"
Ec 5:3: 7: For a dream comes through the multitude of business; and a fool's voice is known by multitude of words.
Pr 10:19: In the multitude of words there wants not sin: but he who refrains his lips is wise.
Mt 6:7: But when you pray: not use vain repetitions: as the heathen do: for they think that they will be heard for their much speaking.
Jas 3:2: For in many things we offend all. If any man not offend in word: the same is a perfect man: and able also to bridle the whole body.

 כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ תִּדֹּ֨ר נֶ֜דֶר לֵֽאלֹהִ֗ים אַל־תְּאַחֵר֙ לְשַׁלְּמֹ֔ו כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין חֵ֖פֶץ בַּכְּסִילִ֑ים אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־תִּדֹּ֖ר שַׁלֵּֽם׃

H7230בְּרֹ֥בbə-rōḇ   (Prep-b | N-msc)

H1697דְּבָרִֽים׃də-ḇā-rîm.   (N-mp)

3 For a dream comes through the multitude of business; and a fool's voice is known by multitude of words.Ecclesiastes 5:3
Stats
Counts: 104 characters, 18 words, 83 letters, 32 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ תִּדֹּ֨ר נֶ֜דֶר לֵֽאלֹהִ֗ים אַל־תְּאַחֵר֙ לְשַׁלְּמֹ֔ו כִּ֛י אֵ֥ין חֵ֖פֶץ בַּכְּסִילִ֑ים אֵ֥ת אֲשֶׁר־תִּדֹּ֖ר שַׁלֵּֽם׃

Lit: For comes a dream through much activity and a voice is known of fool by many his words

KJV: For a dream cometh through the multitude of business; and a fool's voice is known by multitude of words.
References

"a fool's"
Ec 10:12-14: The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself.
Pr 10:19: In the multitude of words there wants not sin: but he who refrains his lips is wise.
Pr 15:2: The tongue of the wise uss knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools pours out foolishness.

H834כַּאֲשֶׁר֩ka-’ă-šer   (Prep-k | Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). H3588כִּ֛יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֛יkî for Conj

Pay V-Piel-Imp-ms
4 When you vow a vow to God, not defer to pay it; for He has no pleasure in fools: pay that which you have vowed.Ecclesiastes 5:4
Stats
Counts: 119 characters, 22 words, 91 letters, 35 vowels, 56 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: טֹ֖וב אֲשֶׁ֣ר לֹֽא־תִדֹּ֑ר מִשֶּׁתִּדֹּ֖ור וְלֹ֥א תְשַׁלֵּֽם׃

Lit: When you make a vow to God not do delay to pay it for He has no pleasure in fools What you have vowed Pay

KJV: When thou vowest a vow unto God, defer not to pay it; for he hath no pleasure in fools: pay that which thou hast vowed.
References

"vowest"
Ge 28:20: Jacob vowed a vow: saying: If God will be with me: and will keep me in this way that I go: and will give me bread to eat: and clothing to put on:
Ge 35:1: 3: God said to Jacob: Arise: go up to Bethel: and dwell there: and make there an altar to God: that appeared to you when you fled from the face of Esau your brother.
Nu 30:2: If a man vow a vow to the LORD: or swear an oath to bind His soul with a bond; He will not break His word: He will do according to all that proceeds out of His mouth.
De 23:21-23: When you will vow a vow to the LORD your God: you will not slack to pay it: for the LORD your God will surely require it of you; and it would be sin in you.
Ps 50:14: Offer to God thanksgiving; and pay your vows to the most High:
Ps 76:11: Vow: and pay to the LORD your God: let all that be round about Him bring presents to Him that ought to be feared.
Ps 119:106: I have sworn: and I will perform it: that I will keep your righteous judgments.
Isa 19:21: The LORD will be known to Egypt: and the Egyptians will know the LORD in that day: and will do sacrifice and oblation; yes: they will vow a vow to the LORD: and perform it.
Mt 5:33: Again: you have heard that it has been said by them of old time: You will not forswear yourself: but will perform to the Lord your oaths:

"for"
Ps 147:10: 11: He delights not in the strength of the horse: he takes not pleasure in the legs of a man.
Mal 1:10: Who is there even among you that would shut the doors for nought? neither do you kindle fire on my altar for nought. I have no pleasure in you: says the LORD of hosts: neither will I accept an offering at your hand.
Heb 10:6: In burnt offerings and sacrifices for sin you have had no pleasure.

"pay"
Ps 66:13: 14: I will go into your house with burnt offerings: I will pay you my vows:
Ps 116:14: 16-18: I will pay my vows to the LORD now in the presence of all His people.
Jon 2:9: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving; I will pay that that I have vowed. Salvation is of the LORD.

 אַל־תִּתֵּ֤ן אֶת־פִּ֙יךָ֙ לַחֲטִ֣יא אֶת־בְּשָׂרֶ֔ךָ וְאַל־תֹּאמַר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמַּלְאָ֔ךְ כִּ֥י שְׁגָגָ֖ה הִ֑יא לָ֣מָּה יִקְצֹ֤ף הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ עַל־קֹולֶ֔ךָ וְחִבֵּ֖ל אֶת־מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדֶֽיךָ׃

5 Better is it that you should'>should not vow, than that you should'>should vow not and pay.Ecclesiastes 5:5
Stats
Counts: 83 characters, 15 words, 66 letters, 23 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַל־תִּתֵּ֤ן אֶת־פִּ֙יךָ֙ לַחֲטִ֣יא אֶת־בְּשָׂרֶ֔ךָ וְאַל־תֹּאמַר֙ לִפְנֵ֣י הַמַּלְאָ֔ךְ כִּ֥י שְׁגָגָ֖ה הִ֑יא לָ֣מָּה יִקְצֹ֤ף הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ עַל־קֹולֶ֔ךָ וְחִבֵּ֖ל אֶת־מַעֲשֵׂ֥ה יָדֶֽיךָ׃

Lit: Better that not to vow than to vow and not pay

KJV: Better is it that thou shouldest not vow, than that thou shouldest vow and not pay.
References

"Better is it that thou shouldest not vow, than that thou shouldest vow and not pay."

Pr 20:25: It is a snare to the man who devours that which is holy: and after vows to make inquiry.
Ac 5:4: While it remained: was not it your own? and after it was sold: was not it in your own power? why have you conceived this thing in your heart? you have not lied to men: but to God.

6 not Suffer your mouth to cause your flesh to sin; neither say you before the angel, that it was an error: for what reason should God be angry at your voice, and destroy the work of your hands?Ecclesiastes 5:6
Stats
Rank: #2726 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 185 characters, 32 words, 145 letters, 52 vowels, 93 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֣י בְרֹ֤ב חֲלֹמֹות֙ וַהֲבָלִ֔ים וּדְבָרִ֖ים הַרְבֵּ֑ה כִּ֥י אֶת־הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים יְרָֽא׃

Lit: Not do let your mouth cause to sin your flesh nor say before the messenger of God that an error It was why should be angry God at your excuse and destroy the work of your hands

KJV: Suffer not thy mouth to cause thy flesh to sin; neither say thou before the angel, that it was an error: wherefore should God be angry at thy voice, and destroy the work of thine hands?
References

"thy mouth"
Ec 5:1: 2: Keep your foot when you go to the house of God: and be more ready to hear: than to give the sacrifice of fools: for they not consider that they do evil.
Jas 1:26: If any man among you seem to be religious: and bridles not his tongue: but deceives his own heart: this man's religion is vain.
Jas 3:2: For in many things we offend all. If any man not offend in word: the same is a perfect man: and able also to bridle the whole body.

"before"
Le 5:4: 5: Or if a soul swear: pronouncing with his lips to do evil: or to do good: whatever it be that a man will pronounce with an oath: and it be hid from him; when he knows of it: then he will be guilty in one of these.
Ge 48:16: The Angel which redeemed me from all evil: bless the lads; and let my name be named on them: and the name of my fathers Abraham and Isaac; and let them grow into a multitude in the middle of the earth.
Ho 12:4: 5: Yes: he had power over the angel: and prevailed: he wept: and made supplication to him: he found him in Bethel: and there he spoke with us;
Mal 2:7: For the priest's lips should keep knowledge: and they should seek the law at His mouth: for He is the messenger of the LORD of hosts.
Mal 3:1: Look: I will send my messenger: and He will prepare the way before me: and the Lord: whom you seek: will suddenly come to His temple: even the messenger of the covenant: whom you delight in: look: He will come: says the LORD of hosts.
Ac 7:30-35: When 40 years were expired: there appeared to Him in the wilderness of mount Sina an angel of the Lord in a flame of fire in a bush.
1Co 11:10: For this cause ought the woman to have power on her head because of the angels.
1Ti 5:21: I charge you before God: and the Lord Jesus Christ: and the elect angels: that you observe these things without preferring one before another: not doinghing by partiality.
Heb 1:14: Are not they all ministering spirits: sent forth to minister for them who will be heirs of salvation?

"it was"
Le 5:4-6: Or if a soul swear: pronouncing with his lips to do evil: or to do good: whatever it be that a man will pronounce with an oath: and it be hid from him; when he knows of it: then he will be guilty in one of these.
Le 27:9: 10: If it be a beast: whereof men bring an offering to the LORD: all that any man gives of such to the LORD will be holy.

"destroy"
Hag 1:9-11: You looked for much: and: indeed: it came to little; and when you brought it home: I did blow upon it. Why? says the LORD of hosts. Because of my house that is waste: and you run every man to His own house.
Hag 2:14-17: Then answered Haggai: and said: So is this people: and so is this nation before me: says the LORD; and so is every work of their hands; and that which they offer there is unclean.
1Co 3:13-15: Every man's work will be made manifest: for the day will declare it: because it will be revealed by fire; and the fire will try every man's work of what sort it is.
2Jo 1:8: Look to yourselves: that we not lose those things which we have wrought: but that we receive a full reward.

7 For in the multitude of dreams and many words there are also divers vanities: but fear you God.Ecclesiastes 5:7
Stats
Rank: #3557 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 98 characters, 15 words, 77 letters, 31 vowels, 46 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִם־עֹ֣שֶׁק רָ֠שׁ וְגֵ֨זֶל מִשְׁפָּ֤ט וָצֶ֙דֶק֙ תִּרְאֶ֣ה בַמְּדִינָ֔ה אַל־תִּתְמַ֖הּ עַל־הַחֵ֑פֶץ כִּ֣י גָבֹ֜הַּ מֵעַ֤ל גָּבֹ֙הַּ֙ שֹׁמֵ֔ר וּגְבֹהִ֖ים עֲלֵיהֶֽם׃

Lit: for in the multitude of dreams and there is vanity And words many but God fear

KJV: For in the multitude of dreams and many words there are also [divers] vanities: but fear thou God.
References

"in the"
Ec 5:3: For a dream comes through the multitude of business; and a fool's voice is known by multitude of words.
Mt 12:36: But I say to you: That every idle word that men will speak: they will give account thereof in the day of judgment.

"but"
Ec 7:18: It is good that you should take hold of this; yes: also from this not withdraw your hand: for He that'>He who fears God will come forth of them all.
Ec 8:12: Though a sinner do evil 100 times: and His days be prolonged: yet surely I know that it will be well with them that fear God: which fear before Him:
Ec 12:13: Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God: and keep His commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.
Pr 23:17: not Let your heart envy sinners: but be you in the fear of the LORD all the day long.
Isa 50:10: 11: Who is among you that fears the LORD: that obeies the voice of His servant: that walks in darkness: and has no light? let Him trust in the name of the LORD: and stay upon His God.

8 If you see the oppression of the poor, and violent perverting of judgment and justice in a province, not marvel at the matter: for he who is higher than the high regards; and there be higher than they.Ecclesiastes 5:8
Stats
Rank: #4559 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 212 characters, 32 words, 168 letters, 61 vowels, 107 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְיִתְרֹ֥ון אֶ֖רֶץ בַּכֹּ֣ל [הִיא כ] (ה֑וּא ק) מֶ֥לֶךְ לְשָׂדֶ֖ה נֶעֱבָֽד׃

Lit: If the oppression of the poor and the violent perversion of justice and righteousness you see in a province not do marvel at the matter for high official over high official watches and higher officials are over them

KJV: If thou seest the oppression of the poor, and violent perverting of judgment and justice in a province, marvel not at the matter: for he that is higher than the highest regardeth; and [there be] higher than they.
References

"thou seest"
Ec 3:16: Moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment: that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness: that iniquity was there.
Ec 4:1: So I returned: and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and look the tears of such as were oppressed: and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.
Ps 12:5: For the oppression of the poor: for the sighing of the needy: now will I arise: says the LORD; I will set Him in safety from Him that puffeth at Him.
Ps 55:9: Destroy: O Lord: and divide their tongues: for I have seen violence and strife in the city.
Ps 58:11: So that a man will say: Truly there is a reward for the righteous: truly He is a God that judges in the earth.
Pr 8:17: I love them that love me; and those that seek me early will find me.
Hab 1:2: 3: 13: O LORD: how long will I cry: and you will not hear! even cry out to you of violence: and you will not save!

"marvel"
Zec 8:6: Thus says the LORD of hosts; If it be marvellous in the eyes of the remnant of this people in these days: should it also be marvellous in my eyes? says the LORD of hosts.
1Jo 3:13: not Marvel: my brothers: if the world hate you.
Re 17:6: 7: I saw the woman drunken with the blood of the saints: and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus: and when I saw her: I wondered with great admiration.

"matter"
Isa 10:5-7: 12: O Assyrian: the rod of my anger: and the staff in their hand is my indignation.
Isa 46:10: 11: Declaring the end from the beginning: and from ancient times the things that not are yet done: saying: My counsel will stand: and I will do all my pleasure:
Hab 1:12: Are you not from everlasting: O LORD my God: my Holy one? we will not die. O LORD: you have ordained them for judgment; and: O mighty God: you have established them for correction.
Ac 4:27: 28: For of a truth against your holy child Jesus: whom you have anointed: both Herod: and Pontius Pilate: with the Gentiles: and the people of Israel: were gathered together:
Ro 11:33: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are His judgments: and His ways past finding out!

"for"
Isa 57:15: For thus says the high and lofty one that inhabits eternity: whose name is Holy; I dwell in the high and holy place: with Him also that is of a contrite and humble spirit: to revive the spirit of the humble: and to revive the heart of the contrite ones.
Lu 1:32: 35: 76: He will be great: and will be called the Son of the High: and the Lord God will give to Him the throne of His father David:

"regardeth"

Job 27:8-23: For what is the hope of the hypocrite: though He has gained: when God takes away His soul?
