Ps 12:5: For the oppression of the poor: for the sighing of the needy: now will I arise: says the LORD; I will set Him in safety from Him that puffeth at Him.
Ps 58:10: 11: The righteous will rejoice when he sees the vengeance: he will wash his feet in the blood of the wicked.
Ps 82:1: > God stands in the congregation of the mighty; He judges among the gods.
Ps 83:18: That men may know that you: whose name alone is Jehovah: are the most high over all the earth.
Ps 140:11: 12: not Let an evil speaker be established in the earth: evil will hunt the violent man to overthrow him.
Isa 3:15: What mean you that you beat my people to pieces: and grind the faces of the poor? says the Lord GOD of hosts.
Isa 5:7: For the vineyard of the LORD of hosts is the house of Israel: and the men of Judah His pleasant plant: and He looked for judgment: but look oppression; for righteousness: but look a cry.
Isa 59:13-16: In transgressing and lying against the LORD: and departing away from our God: speaking oppression and revolt: conceiving and uttering from the heart words of falsehood.
Jer 22:17-19: But your eyes and your heart are not but for your covetousness: and for to shed innocent blood: and for oppression: and for violence: to do it.
Eze 22:6-14: Look: the princes of Israel: every one were in you to their power to shed blood.
Am 5:12: For I know your manifold transgressions and your mighty sins: they afflict the just: they take a bribe: and they turn aside the poor in the gate from their right.
Am 6:2-6: 12: Pass you to Calneh: and see; and from there go you to Hamath the great: then go down to Gath of the Philistines: be they better than these kingdoms? or their border greater than your border?
Am 8:4-7: Hear this: O you that swallow up the needy: even to make the poor of the land to fail:
Mic 2:1-3: 9: Woe to them that devise iniquity: and work evil upon their beds! when the morning is light: they practise it: because it is in the power of their hand.
Mic 3:1-4: 9-12: I said: Hear: I pray you: O heads of Jacob: and you princes of the house of Israel; Is it not for you to know judgment?
Mic 6:10-13: Are there yet the treasures of wickedness in the house of the wicked: and the scant measure that is abominable?
Zec 7:9-13: Thus speaks the LORD of hosts: saying: Execute true judgment: and show mercy and compassions every man to His brother:
Mal 3:5: I will come near to you to judgment; and I will be a swift witness against the sorcerers: and against the adulterers: and against false swearers: and against those that oppress the hireling in His wages: the widow: and the fatherless: and that turn aside the stranger from His right: and not fear me: says the LORD of hosts.
Jas 2:13: For he will have judgment without mercy: that has showed no mercy; and mercy rejoices against judgment.
Jas 5:2-7: your riches are corrupted: and your garments are motheaten.

"higher than they"
1Ch 21:15: 16: God sent an angel to Jerusalem to destroy it: and as He was destroying: the LORD beheld: and He repented Him of the evil: and said to the angel that destroyed: It is enough: stay now your hand. And the angel of the LORD stood by the threshingfloor of Ornan the Jebusite.
Ps 95:3: For the LORD is a great God: and a great King above all gods.
Isa 37:36: Then the angel of the LORD went forth: and smote in the camp of the Assyrians a00 and fourscore and 5000: and when they arose early in the morning: look: they were all dead corpses.
Mt 13:41: 42: The Son of man will send forth His angels: and they will gather out of His kingdom all things that offend: and them which do iniquity;
Ac 12:7-10: 23: And: look: the angel of the Lord came upon Him: and a light shined in the prison: and He smote Peter on the side: and raised Him up: saying: Arise up quickly. And His chains fell off from His hands.

9 Moreover the profit of the earth is for all: the king himself is served by the field.Ecclesiastes 5:9
Stats
Rank: #6792 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 85 characters, 16 words, 67 letters, 24 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֹהֵ֥ב כֶּ֙סֶף֙ לֹא־יִשְׂבַּ֣ע כֶּ֔סֶף וּמִֽי־אֹהֵ֥ב בֶּהָמֹ֖ון לֹ֣א תְבוּאָ֑ה גַּם־זֶ֖ה הָֽבֶל׃

Lit: Moreover the profit of the land for all is is even the king from the field is served

KJV: Moreover the profit of the earth is for all: the king himself is served by the field.
References

"the profit"
Ge 1:29: 30: God said: Look: I have given you every herb bearing seed: which is upon the face of all the earth: and every tree: in the which is the fruit of a tree yielding seed; to you it will be for meat.
Ge 3:17-19: to Adam he said: Because you have listened to the voice of your wife: and have eaten of the tree: of which I commanded you: saying: You will not eat of it: cursed is the ground for your sake; in sorrow will you eat of it all the days of your life;
Ps 104:14: 15: He causes the grass to grow for the cattle: and herb for the service of man: that he may bring forth food out of the earth;
Ps 115:16: The heaven: even the heavens: are the LORD's: but the earth has He given to the children of men.
Pr 13:23: Much food is in the tillage of the poor: but there is that is destroyed for want of judgment.
Pr 27:23-27: Be you diligent to know the state of your flocks: and look well to your herds.
Pr 28:19: He who tills his land will have plenty of bread: but he who follows after vain persons will have poverty enough.
Jer 40:10-12: As for me: look: I will dwell at Mizpah to serve the Chaldeans: which will come to us: but you: gather you wine: and summer fruits: and oil: and put them in your vessels: and dwell in your cities that you have taken.

"the king"

H1892הָֽבֶל׃hā-ḇel.   (N-ms)
H1892 הֶבֶל hebel hehbel or (rarely in the abs.) הֲבֵל; from הָבַל; emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb; idiom altogether, vain, vanity. 		הָֽבֶל׃hā-ḇel. is vanity N-ms
10 He who loves'>loves silver will not be satisfied with silver; nor he who loves'>loves abundance with increase: this is also vanity.Ecclesiastes 5:10
Stats
Counts: 122 characters, 19 words, 99 letters, 36 vowels, 63 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בִּרְבֹות֙ הַטֹּובָ֔ה רַבּ֖וּ אֹוכְלֶ֑יהָ וּמַה־כִּשְׁרֹון֙ לִבְעָלֶ֔יהָ כִּ֖י אִם־ [רְאִיַּת כ] (רְא֥וּת ק) עֵינָֽיו׃

Lit: He who loves silver not will be satisfied with silver and who loves abundance not with its income Also this is vanity

KJV: He that loveth silver shall not be satisfied with silver; nor he that loveth abundance with increase: this is also vanity.
References

"He that"
Ec 4:8: There is one alone: and there is not a second; yes: he has neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither says he: For whom do I labour: and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity: yes: it is a sore travail.
Ec 6:7: All the labour of man is for his mouth: and yet the appetite not is filled.
Ps 52:1: 7: A Psalm of David: when Doeg the Edomite came and told Saul: and said to Him: David is come to the house of Ahimelech.>> Why boast you yourself in mischief: O mighty man? the goodness of God endureth continually.
Ps 62:10: not Trust in oppression: and not become vain in robbery: if riches increase: not set your heart upon them.
Pr 30:15: 16: The horseleach has two daughters: crying: Give: give. There are 3 things that are never satisfied: yes: 4 things not say: It is enough:
Hab 2:5-7: Yes also: because he transgresss by wine: he is a proud man: neither keeps at home: who enlarges his desire as hell: and is as death: and cannot be satisfied: but gathers to him all nations: and heaps to him all people:
Mt 6:19: 24: not Lay up for yourselves treasures upon earth: where moth and rust does corrupt: and where thieves break through and steal:
Lu 12:15: He said to them: Take heed: and beware of covetousness: for a man's life consists not in the abundance of the things which he possesseth.
1Ti 6:10: For the love of money is the root of all evil: which while some coveted after: they have erred from the faith: and pierced themselves through with many sorrows.

"this"
Ec 1:17: I gave my heart to know wisdom: and to know madness and folly: I perceived that this also is vexation of spirit.
Ec 2:11: 17: 18: 26: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought: and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and: look: all was vanity and vexation of spirit: and there was no profit under the sun.
Ec 3:19: For that which befalls'>befalls'>befalls the sons of men befalls'>befalls'>befalls beasts; even one thing befalls'>befalls'>befalls them: as the one dies'>dies: so dies'>dies the other; yes: they have all one breath; so that a man has no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.
Ec 4:4: 8: 16: Again: I considered all travail: and every right work: that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.

11 When goods increase, they are increased that eat them: and what good is there to the owners thereof, saving the beholding of them with their eyes?Ecclesiastes 5:11
Stats
Rank: #7862 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 148 characters, 21 words, 117 letters, 45 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מְתוּקָה֙ שְׁנַ֣ת הָעֹבֵ֔ד אִם־מְעַ֥ט וְאִם־הַרְבֵּ֖ה יֹאכֵ֑ל וְהַשָּׂבָע֙ לֶֽעָשִׁ֔יר אֵינֶ֛נּוּ מַנִּ֥יחַֽ לֹ֖ו לִישֹֽׁון׃

Lit: When increase goods they increase who eat them so what have profit the owners except Except to see them with their eyes

KJV: When goods increase, they are increased that eat them: and what good is there to the owners thereof, saving the beholding [of them] with their eyes?

1Jo 2:16: For all that is in the world: the lust of the flesh: and the lust of the eyes: and the pride of life: not is of the Father: but is of the world.

H3462 יָשֵׁן yâshên yaw-shane a primitive root; properly, to be slack or languid, i.e. (by implication) sleep (figuratively, to die); also to grow old, stale or inveterate; old (store), remain long, (make to) sleep. 		לִישֽׁוֹן׃lî-šō-wn. to sleep Prep-l | V-Qal-Inf
12 The sleep of a labouring man is sweet, whether he eat little or much: but the abundance of the rich not will suffer him to sleep.Ecclesiastes 5:12
Stats
Rank: #9874 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 129 characters, 24 words, 101 letters, 39 vowels, 62 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יֵ֚שׁ רָעָ֣ה חֹולָ֔ה רָאִ֖יתִי תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ עֹ֛שֶׁר שָׁמ֥וּר לִבְעָלָ֖יו לְרָעָתֹֽו׃

Lit: is sweet the sleep of a laboring man Whether little or much he eats but the abundance of the rich not will permit him to sleep

KJV: The sleep of a labouring man is sweet, whether he eat little or much: but the abundance of the rich will not suffer him to sleep.
References

"The sleep of a labouring man is sweet, whether he eat little or much: but the abundance of the rich will not suffer him to sleep."
Ps 4:8: I will both lay me down in peace: and sleep: for you: LORD: only make me dwell in safety.
Ps 127:2: It is vain for you to rise up early: to sit up late: to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he gives his beloved sleep.
Pr 3:24: When you lie down: you will not be afraid: yes: you will lie down: and your sleep will be sweet.
Jer 31:26: Upon this I awaked: and beheld; and my sleep was sweet to me.

 וְאָבַ֛ד הָעֹ֥שֶׁר הַה֖וּא בְּעִנְיַ֣ן רָ֑ע וְהֹולִ֣יד בֵּ֔ן וְאֵ֥ין בְּיָדֹ֖ו מְאֽוּמָה׃

13 There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, namely, riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.Ecclesiastes 5:13
Stats
Rank: #9265 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 113 characters, 20 words, 87 letters, 34 vowels, 53 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאָבַ֛ד הָעֹ֥שֶׁר הַה֖וּא בְּעִנְיַ֣ן רָ֑ע וְהֹולִ֣יד בֵּ֔ן וְאֵ֥ין בְּיָדֹ֖ו מְאֽוּמָה׃

Lit: There is a evil severe which I have seen under the sun Riches kept for their owner to his hurt

KJV: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun, [namely], riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.
References

"a sore"
Ec 4:8: There is one alone: and there is not a second; yes: he has neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither says he: For whom do I labour: and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity: yes: it is a sore travail.
Ec 6:1: 2: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun: and it is common among men:

"riches"

Ge 13:5-11: Lot also: which went with Abram: had flocks: and herds: and tents.
Ge 14:16: He brought back all the goods: and also brought again his brother Lot: and his goods: and the women also: and the people.
Ge 19:14: 26: 31-38: Lot went out: and spoke to His sons in law: which married His daughters: and said: Up: get you out of this place; for the LORD will destroy this city. But He seemed as one that mocked to His sons in law.
Pr 1:11-13: 19: 32: If they say: Come with us: let us lay wait for blood: let us lurk privily for the innocent without cause:
Pr 11:4: 24: 25: Riches not profit in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivers from death.
Isa 2:20: In that day a man will cast his idols of silver: and his idols of gold: which they made each one for himself to worship: to the moles and to the bats;
Isa 32:6-8: For the vile person will speak villany: and His heart will work iniquity: to practise hypocrisy: and to utter error against the LORD: to make empty the soul of the hungry: and He will cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.
Zep 1:18: Neither their silver nor their gold will be able to deliver them in the day of the LORD's wrath; but the whole land will be devoured by the fire of His jealousy: for He will make even a speedy riddance of all them that dwell in the land.

Lu 18:22: 23: Now when Jesus heard these things: He said to Him: Yet lack you one thing: sell all that you have: and distribute to the poor: and you will have treasure in heaven: and come: follow me.

Jas 2:5-7: Listen: my beloved brothers: Has not God chosen the poor of this world rich in faith: and heirs of the kingdom which He has promised to them that love Him?
Jas 5:1-4: Go to now: you rich men: weep and howl for your miseries that will come upon you.

KJV: But those riches perish by evil travail: and he begetteth a son, and there is nothing in his hand.

15 As he came forth of his mother's womb, naked will he return to go as he came, and will not takehing of his labour, which he may carry away in his hand.Ecclesiastes 5:15
Stats
Counts: 153 characters, 29 words, 117 letters, 42 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְגַם־זֹה֙ רָעָ֣ה חֹולָ֔ה כָּל־עֻמַּ֥ת שֶׁבָּ֖א כֵּ֣ן יֵלֵ֑ךְ וּמַה־יִּתְרֹ֣ון לֹ֔ו שֶֽׁיַּעֲמֹ֖ל לָרֽוּחַ׃

Lit: as he came from womb of his mother naked shall he return to go as he came and nothing he shall take from his labor which he may carry away in his hand

KJV: As he came forth of his mother's womb, naked shall he return to go as he came, and shall take nothing of his labour, which he may carry away in his hand.
References

"As he came forth of his mother's womb, naked shall he return to go as he came, and shall take nothing of his labour, which he may carry away in his hand."
Job 1:21: Said: Naked came I out of my mother's womb: and naked will I return there: the LORD gave: and the LORD has taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD.
Ps 49:17: For when he dies he will not carryhing away: his glory will not descend after him.
Lu 12:20: But God said to Him: You fool: this night your soul will be required of you: then whose will those things be: which you have provided?
1Ti 6:7: For we not broughthing into this world: and it is certain we can not carryhing out.

 גַּ֥ם כָּל־יָמָ֖יו בַּחֹ֣שֶׁךְ יֹאכֵ֑ל וְכָעַ֥ס הַרְבֵּ֖ה וְחָלְיֹ֥ו וָקָֽצֶף׃

H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		לָרֽוּחַ׃lā-rū-aḥ. for the wind Prep-l, Art | N-cs
16 This also is a sore evil, that in all points as he came, so will he go: and what profit has he who has laboured for the wind?Ecclesiastes 5:16
Stats
Rank: #8478 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 135 characters, 25 words, 101 letters, 38 vowels, 63 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גַּ֥ם כָּל־יָמָ֖יו בַּחֹ֣שֶׁךְ יֹאכֵ֑ל וְכָעַ֥ס הַרְבֵּ֖ה וְחָלְיֹ֥ו וָקָֽצֶף׃

Lit: And also this evil is a severe just exactly as he came so shall he go And what profit has he who has labored for the wind

KJV: And this also is a sore evil, [that] in all points as he came, so shall he go: and what profit hath he that hath laboured for the wind?
References

"a sore"
Ec 5:13: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun: namely: riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.
Ec 2:22: 23: For what has man of all his labour: and of the vexation of his heart: wherein he has laboured under the sun?

"what"
1Sa 12:21: Turn you not aside: for then should you go after vain things: which cannot profit nor deliver; for they are vain.
Jer 2:8: The priests not said: Where is the LORD? and they that handle the law knew not me: the pastors also transgressed against me: and the prophets prophesied by Baal: and walked after things that not do profit.
Mr 8:36: For what will it profit a man: if he will gain the whole world: and lose his own soul?

"for"
Ec 1:3: What profit has a man of all his labour which he takes under the sun?
Pr 11:29: He who troubles his own house will inherit the wind: and the fool will be servant to the wise of heart.
Isa 26:18: We have been with child: we have been in pain: we have as it were brought forth wind; we not have wrought any deliverance in the earth; neither have the inhabitants of the world fallen.
Ho 8:7: For they have sown the wind: and they will reap the whirlwind: it has no stalk: the bud will yield no meal: if so be it yield: the strangers will swallow it up.
Joh 6:27: not Labour for the meat which perishes: but for that meat which endures to everlasting life: which the Son of man will give to you: for Him has God the Father sealed.

 הִנֵּ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־רָאִ֣יתִי אָ֗נִי טֹ֣וב אֲשֶׁר־יָפֶ֣ה לֶֽאֶכֹול־וְ֠לִשְׁתֹּות וְלִרְאֹ֨ות טֹובָ֜ה בְּכָל־עֲמָלֹ֣ו ׀ שֶׁיַּעֲמֹ֣ל תַּֽחַת־הַשֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ מִסְפַּ֧ר יְמֵי־ [חַיָּו כ] (חַיָּ֛יו ק) אֲשֶׁר־נָֽתַן־לֹ֥ו הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־ה֥וּא חֶלְקֹֽו׃

17 All his days also he eats in darkness, and he has much sorrow and wrath with his sickness.Ecclesiastes 5:17
Stats
Rank: #7598 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 93 characters, 17 words, 74 letters, 24 vowels, 50 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הִנֵּ֞ה אֲשֶׁר־רָאִ֣יתִי אָ֗נִי טֹ֣וב אֲשֶׁר־יָפֶ֣ה לֶֽאֶכֹול־וְ֠לִשְׁתֹּות וְלִרְאֹ֨ות טֹובָ֜ה בְּכָל־עֲמָלֹ֣ו ׀ שֶׁיַּעֲמֹ֣ל תַּֽחַת־הַשֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ מִסְפַּ֧ר יְמֵי־ [חַיָּו כ] (חַיָּ֛יו ק) אֲשֶׁר־נָֽתַן־לֹ֥ו הָאֱלֹהִ֖ים כִּי־ה֥וּא חֶלְקֹֽו׃

Lit: also all his days in darkness he eats and he has sorrow much and sickness and anger

KJV: All his days also he eateth in darkness, and he hath much sorrow and wrath with his sickness.
References

"he eateth"
Ge 3:17: to Adam he said: Because you have listened to the voice of your wife: and have eaten of the tree: of which I commanded you: saying: You will not eat of it: cursed is the ground for your sake; in sorrow will you eat of it all the days of your life;
1Ki 17:12: She said: As the LORD your God lives: I not have a cake: but an handful of meal in a barrel: and a little oil in a cruse: and: look: I am gathering two sticks: that I may go in and dress it for me and my son: that we may eat it: and die.
Job 21:25: Another dies in the bitterness of his soul: and never eats with pleasure.
Ps 78:33: Therefore their days did he consume in vanity: and their years in trouble.
Ps 102:9: For I have eaten ashes like bread: and mingled my drink with weeping:
Ps 127:2: It is vain for you to rise up early: to sit up late: to eat the bread of sorrows: for so he gives his beloved sleep.
Eze 4:16: 17: Moreover He said to me: Son of man: look: I will break the staff of bread in Jerusalem: and they will eat bread by weight: and with care; and they will drink water by measure: and with astonishment:

"much"
2Ki 1:2: 6: Ahaziah fell down through a lattice in his upper chamber that was in Samaria: and was sick: and he sent messengers: and said to them: Go: inquire of Baalzebub the god of Ekron whether I will recover of this disease.
2Ki 5:27: The leprosy therefore of Naaman will cleave to you: and to your seed for ever. And he went out from his presence a leper as white as snow.
2Ch 16:10-12: Then Asa was angry with the seer: and put him in a prison house; for he was in a rage with him because of this thing. And Asa oppressed some of the people the same time.
2Ch 24:24: 25: For the army of the Syrians came with a small company of men: and the LORD delivered a very great host into their hand: because they had forsaken the LORD God of their fathers. So they executed judgment against Joash.
Ps 90:7-11: For we are consumed by your anger: and by your wrath are we troubled.
Pr 1:27-29: When your fear comes'>comes'>comes as desolation: and your destruction comes'>comes'>comes as a whirlwind; when distress and anguish comes'>comes'>comes upon you.
Ac 12:23: Immediately the angel of the Lord smote Him: because He not gave God the glory: and He was eaten of worms: and gave up the ghost.
1Co 11:30-32: For this cause many are weak and sickly among you: and many sleep.

 גַּ֣ם כָּֽל־הָאָדָ֡ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָֽתַן־לֹ֣ו הָאֱלֹהִים֩ עֹ֨שֶׁר וּנְכָסִ֜ים וְהִשְׁלִיטֹ֨ו לֶאֱכֹ֤ל מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ וְלָשֵׂ֣את אֶת־חֶלְקֹ֔ו וְלִשְׂמֹ֖חַ בַּעֲמָלֹ֑ו זֹ֕ה מַתַּ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֖ים הִֽיא׃

H834אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer-   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). H3588כִּי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּי־kî- for Conj

H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		ה֥וּאhū it is Pro-3ms
H2506חֶלְקֽוֹ׃ḥel-qōw.   (N-msc | 3ms)
H2506 חֵלֶק chêleq khaylek from חָלַק; properly, smoothness (of the tongue); also an allotment; flattery, inheritance, part, idiom partake, portion. 		חֶלְקֽוֹ׃ḥel-qōw. his heritage N-msc | 3ms
18 Look that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink, and to enjoy the good of all His labour that He takes under the sun all the days of His life, which God gives Him: for it is His portion.Ecclesiastes 5:18
Stats
Counts: 227 characters, 39 words, 169 letters, 65 vowels, 104 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גַּ֣ם כָּֽל־הָאָדָ֡ם אֲשֶׁ֣ר נָֽתַן־לֹ֣ו הָאֱלֹהִים֩ עֹ֨שֶׁר וּנְכָסִ֜ים וְהִשְׁלִיטֹ֨ו לֶאֱכֹ֤ל מִמֶּ֙נּוּ֙ וְלָשֵׂ֣את אֶת־חֶלְקֹ֔ו וְלִשְׂמֹ֖חַ בַּעֲמָלֹ֑ו זֹ֕ה מַתַּ֥ת אֱלֹהִ֖ים הִֽיא׃

Lit: Here is what have seen I it is good that and fitting for one to eat and drink and to enjoy the good of all his labor in which he toils under the sun all the days of his life which gives him God for it is his heritage

KJV: Behold that which I have seen: [it is] good and comely [for one] to eat and to drink, and to enjoy the good of all his labour that he taketh under the sun all the days of his life, which God giveth him: for it [is] his portion.
References

"it is good and comely"
Ec 2:24: There is nothing better for a man: than that He should eat and drink: and that He should make His soul enjoy good in His labour. This also I saw: that it was from the hand of God.
Ec 3:12: 13: 22: I know that there is no good in them: but for a man to rejoice: and to do good in his life.
Ec 8:15: Then I commended mirth: because a man has no better thing under the sun: than to eat: and to drink: and to be merry: for that will abide with Him of His labour the days of His life: which God gives Him under the sun.
Ec 9:7: Go your way: eat your bread with joy: and drink your wine with a merry heart; for God now accepts your works.
Ec 11:9: Rejoice: O young man: in your youth; and let your heart cheer you in the days of your youth: and walk in the ways of your heart: and in the sight of your eyes: but know you: that for all these things God will bring you into judgment.
1Ti 6:17: Charge them that are rich in this world: that they not be highminded: nor trust in uncertain riches: but in the living God: who gives us richly all things to enjoy;

"it is his"
Ec 2:10: whatever my eyes desired I not kept from them: I not withheld my heart from any joy; for my heart rejoiced in all my labour: and this was my portion of all my labour.
Ec 3:22: For what reason I perceive that there is nothing better: than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who will bring him to see what will be after him?
Jer 52:34: for his diet: there was a continual diet given him of the king of Babylon: every day a portion until the day of his death: all the days of his life.

 כִּ֚י לֹ֣א הַרְבֵּ֔ה יִזְכֹּ֖ר אֶת־יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֑יו כִּ֧י הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים מַעֲנֶ֖ה בְּשִׂמְחַ֥ת לִבֹּֽו׃

H1571גַּ֣םgam   (Conj)
H1571 גַּם gam gam by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and; again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea. 		גַּ֣םgam As for Conj

H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כָּֽל־kāl- every N-msc

19 Every man also to whom God has given riches and wealth, and has given Him power to eat thereof, and to take His portion, and to rejoice in His labour; this is the gift of God.Ecclesiastes 5:19
Stats
Counts: 177 characters, 32 words, 137 letters, 54 vowels, 83 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֚י לֹ֣א הַרְבֵּ֔ה יִזְכֹּ֖ר אֶת־יְמֵ֣י חַיָּ֑יו כִּ֧י הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים מַעֲנֶ֖ה בְּשִׂמְחַ֥ת לִבֹּֽו׃

Lit: As for every man to whom has given to whom God riches and wealth and given him power to eat of it and to receive his heritage and rejoice in his labor this the gift of God is

KJV: Every man also to whom God hath given riches and wealth, and hath given him power to eat thereof, and to take his portion, and to rejoice in his labour; this is the gift of God.
References

"to whom"
Ec 2:24: There is nothing better for a man: than that He should eat and drink: and that He should make His soul enjoy good in His labour. This also I saw: that it was from the hand of God.
Ec 3:13: Also that every man should eat and drink: and enjoy the good of all His labour: it is the gift of God.
Ec 6:2: A man to whom God has given riches: wealth: and honour: so that He wants nothing for His soul of all that He desires: yet God gives Him not">not Him power to eat thereof: but a stranger eats it: this is vanity: and it is an evil disease.
De 8:18: But you will remember the LORD your God: for it is He that'>He who gives you power to get wealth: that He may establish His covenant which He sware to your fathers: as it is this day.
1Ki 3:13: I have also given you that which you have not asked: both riches: and honour: so that there will not be any among the kings like to you all your days.

"this is"
Ec 2:24-26: There is nothing better for a man: than that He should eat and drink: and that He should make His soul enjoy good in His labour. This also I saw: that it was from the hand of God.

 20 For He will not much remember the days of His life; because God answers Him in the joy of His heart.Ecclesiastes 5:20
Stats
Counts: 103 characters, 20 words, 81 letters, 30 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Hebrew:

Lit: For not unduly he will dwell on the days of his life because God keeps him busy with the joy of his heart

KJV: For he shall not much remember the days of his life; because God answereth him in the joy of his heart.
References

"For he shall not much remember"
Ps 37:16: A little that a righteous man has is better than the riches of many wicked.

"because"
De 28:8-12: 47: The LORD will command the blessing upon you in your storehouses: and in all that you set your hand to; and He will bless you in the land which the LORD your God gives you.
Ps 4:6: 7: There be many that say: Who will show us any good? LORD: lift you up the light of your face upon us.
Isa 64:5: You meet him that rejoices and works righteousness: those that remember you in your ways: look: you are angry; for we have sinned: in those is continuance: and we will be saved.
Isa 65:13: 14: 21-24: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Look: my servants will eat: but you will be hungry: look: my servants will drink: but you will be thirsty: look: my servants will rejoice: but you will be ashamed:
Ro 5:1: 5-11: Therefore being justified by faith: we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ:

6
The Futility of Life

יֵ֣שׁ רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָאִ֖יתִי תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וְרַבָּ֥ה הִ֖יא עַל־הָאָדָֽם׃

1 There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is common among men:Ecclesiastes 6:1
Stats
Counts: 77 characters, 16 words, 59 letters, 24 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ רָעָ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר רָאִ֖יתִי תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וְרַבָּ֥ה הִ֖יא עַל־הָאָדָֽם׃

Lit: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun and common it is among men

KJV: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is common among men:
References

"There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, and it is common among men:"
Ec 5:13: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun: namely: riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.

 אִ֣ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִתֶּן־לֹ֣ו הָאֱלֹהִ֡ים עֹשֶׁר֩ וּנְכָסִ֨ים וְכָבֹ֜וד וְֽאֵינֶ֨נּוּ חָסֵ֥ר לְנַפְשֹׁ֣ו ׀ מִכֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־יִתְאַוֶּ֗ה וְלֹֽא־יַשְׁלִיטֶ֤נּוּ הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ לֶאֱכֹ֣ל מִמֶּ֔נּוּ כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ נָכְרִ֖י יֹֽאכֲלֶ֑נּוּ זֶ֥ה הֶ֛בֶל וָחֳלִ֥י רָ֖ע הֽוּא׃

H376אִ֣ישׁ’îš   (N-ms)
H376 אִישׁ ʼîysh eesh contracted for אֱנוֹשׁ (or perhaps rather from an unused root meaning to be extant); a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation); also, another, any (man), a certain, phrase champion, consent, each, every (one), fellow, (foot-, husband-) man, (good-, great, mighty) man, he, high (degree), him (that is), husband, man(-kind), phrase none, one, people, person, phrase steward, what (man) soever, whoso(-ever), worthy. As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֣ר’ă-šer to whom Pro-r
H5414יִתֶּן־yit-ten-   (V-Qal-Imperf-3ms)

H430הָאֱלֹהִ֡יםhā-’ĕ-lō-hîm   (Art | N-mp)
H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		הָאֱלֹהִ֡יםhā-’ĕ-lō-hîm God Art | N-mp

H1931הֽוּא׃hū.   (Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		הֽוּא׃hū. it is Pro-3ms
2 A man to whom God has given riches, wealth, and honour, so that He wants nothing for His soul of all that He desires, yet God gives not Him power to eat thereof, but a stranger eats it: this is vanity, and it is an evil disease.Ecclesiastes 6:2
Stats
Counts: 237 characters, 38 words, 181 letters, 70 vowels, 111 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִ֣ישׁ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יִתֶּן־לֹ֣ו הָאֱלֹהִ֡ים עֹשֶׁר֩ וּנְכָסִ֨ים וְכָבֹ֜וד וְֽאֵינֶ֨נּוּ חָסֵ֥ר לְנַפְשֹׁ֣ו ׀ מִכֹּ֣ל אֲשֶׁר־יִתְאַוֶּ֗ה וְלֹֽא־יַשְׁלִיטֶ֤נּוּ הָֽאֱלֹהִים֙ לֶאֱכֹ֣ל מִמֶּ֔נּוּ כִּ֛י אִ֥ישׁ נָכְרִ֖י יֹֽאכֲלֶ֑נּוּ זֶ֥ה הֶ֛בֶל וָחֳלִ֥י רָ֖ע הֽוּא׃

Lit: a man to whom has given to whom God riches and wealth and honor so that nothing he is lacking for himself of all that he desires and yet not does give him power God to eat of it but man a foreigner consumes it this is vanity and an affliction evil it is

KJV: A man to whom God hath given riches, wealth, and honour, so that he wanteth nothing for his soul of all that he desireth, yet God giveth him not power to eat thereof, but a stranger eateth it: this is vanity, and it [is] an evil disease.
References

"a man"
Ec 5:19: Every man also to whom God has given riches and wealth: and has given Him power to eat thereof: and to take His portion: and to rejoice in His labour; this is the gift of God.
1Ki 3:13: I have also given you that which you have not asked: both riches: and honour: so that there will not be any among the kings like to you all your days.
1Ch 29:25: 28: The LORD magnified Solomon exceedingly in the sight of all Israel: and bestowed upon Him such royal majesty as not had been on any king before Him in Israel.
2Ch 1:11: God said to Solomon: Because this was in your heart: and you have not asked riches: wealth: or honour: nor the life of your enemies: neither yet have asked long life; but have asked wisdom and knowledge for yourself: that you may judge my people: over whom I have made you king:
Da 5:18: O you king: the most high God gave Nebuchadnezzar your father a kingdom: and majesty: and glory: and honour:

"so"
Ec 2:4-10: I made me great works; I built me houses; I planted me vineyards:
De 8:7-10: For the LORD your God brings you into a good land: a land of brooks of water: of fountains and depths that spring out of valleys and hills;
Jg 18:10: When you go: you will come to a people secure: and to a large land: for God has given it into your hands; a place where there is no want of any thing that is in the earth.
Job 21:9-15: Their houses are safe from fear: neither is the rod of God upon them.
Ps 17:14: From men which are your hand: O LORD: from men of the world: which have their portion in this life: and whose belly you fill with your hid treasure: they are full of children: and leave the rest of their substance to their babes.
Ps 73:7: Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart could wish.
Lu 12:19: 20: I will say to my soul: Soul: you have much goods laid up for many years; take your ease: eat: drink: and be merry.

"but"
De 28:33: 43: The fruit of your land: and all your labours: will a nation which you know not eat up; and you will be only oppressed and crushed alway:
Ps 39:6: Surely every man walks in a vain show: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heaps up riches: and knows not who will gather them.
La 5:2: Our inheritance is turned to strangers: our houses to aliens.
Ho 7:9: Strangers have devoured his strength: and he knows'>knows it not: yes: gray hairs are here and there upon him: yet he knows'>knows not.

"vanity"
Ec 4:4: 8: Again: I considered all travail: and every right work: that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 5:16: This also is a sore evil: that in all points as he came: so will he go: and what profit has he who has laboured for the wind?

 אִם־יֹולִ֣יד אִ֣ישׁ מֵאָ֡ה וְשָׁנִים֩ רַבֹּ֨ות יִֽחְיֶ֜ה וְרַ֣ב ׀ שֶׁיִּהְי֣וּ יְמֵֽי־שָׁנָ֗יו וְנַפְשֹׁו֙ לֹא־תִשְׂבַּ֣ע מִן־הַטֹּובָ֔ה וְגַם־קְבוּרָ֖ה לֹא־הָ֣יְתָה לֹּ֑ו אָמַ֕רְתִּי טֹ֥וב מִמֶּ֖נּוּ הַנָּֽפֶל׃

H3117יְמֵֽי־yə-mê-   (N-mpc)
H3117 יוֹם yôwm yome from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, phrase always, phrase chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), phrase elder, idiom end, phrase evening, phrase (for) ever(-lasting, -more), idiom full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, phrase old, phrase outlived, phrase perpetually, presently, phrase remaineth, idiom required, season, idiom since, space, then, (process of) time, phrase as at other times, phrase in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), idiom whole (phrase age), (full) year(-ly), phrase younger. 		יְמֵֽי־yə-mê- the days N-mpc

H5309הַנָּֽפֶל׃han-nā-p̄el.   (Art | N-ms)
H5309 נֶפֶל nephel neh-fel or נֵפֶל; from נָפַל; something fallen, i.e. an abortion; untimely birth. 		הַנָּֽפֶל׃han-nā-p̄el. a stillborn child Art | N-ms
3 If a man beget 100 children, and live many years, so that the days of his years be many, and his soul not be filled with good, and also that he have no burial; I say, that an untimely birth is better than he.Ecclesiastes 6:3
Stats
Counts: 221 characters, 34 words, 164 letters, 61 vowels, 103 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִם־יֹולִ֣יד אִ֣ישׁ מֵאָ֡ה וְשָׁנִים֩ רַבֹּ֨ות יִֽחְיֶ֜ה וְרַ֣ב ׀ שֶׁיִּהְי֣וּ יְמֵֽי־שָׁנָ֗יו וְנַפְשֹׁו֙ לֹא־תִשְׂבַּ֣ע מִן־הַטֹּובָ֔ה וְגַם־קְבוּרָ֖ה לֹא־הָ֣יְתָה לֹּ֑ו אָמַ֕רְתִּי טֹ֥וב מִמֶּ֖נּוּ הַנָּֽפֶל׃

Lit: If begets a man a hundred children and years many lives so many that are the days of his years but his soul not is satisfied with goodness or indeed burial no he has to I say that is better than he a stillborn child

KJV: If a man beget an hundred children, and live many years, so that the days of his years be many, and his soul be not filled with good, and also [that] he have no burial; I say, [that] an untimely birth [is] better than he.
References

"a man"
Ge 33:5: He lifted up His eyes: and saw the women and the children; and said: Who are those with you? And He said: The children which God has graciously given your servant.
1Sa 2:20: 21: Eli blessed Elkanah and His wife: and said: The LORD give you seed of this woman for the loan which is lent to the LORD. And they went to their own home.
2Ki 10:1: Ahab had 70 sons in Samaria. And Jehu wrote letters: and sent to Samaria: to the rulers of Jezreel: to the elders: and to them that brought up Ahab's children: saying:
1Ch 28:5: Of all my sons: (for the LORD has given me many sons: ) He has chosen Solomon my son to sit upon the throne of the kingdom of the LORD over Israel.
2Ch 11:21: Rehoboam loved Maachah the daughter of Absalom above all his wives and his concubines: (for he took 18 wives: and threescore concubines; and begot 28 sons: and threescore daughters.)
Es 5:11: Haman told them of the glory of his riches: and the multitude of his children: and all the things wherein the king had promoted him: and how he had advanced him above the princes and servants of the king.
Ps 127:4: 5: As arrows are in the hand of a mighty man; so are children of the youth.
Pr 17:6: Children's children are the crown of old men; and the glory of children are their fathers.

"so"
Ec 5:17-19: All his days also he eats in darkness: and he has much sorrow and wrath with his sickness.
Ge 47:9: Jacob said to Pharaoh: The days of the years of my pilgrimage are 130 years: few and evil have the days of the years of my life been: and not have attained to the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.

"and also"
2Ki 9:35: They went to bury her: but they found no more of her than the skull: and the feet: and the palms of her hands.
Es 7:10: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king's wrath pacified.
Es 9:14: 15: The king commanded it so to be done: and the decree was given at Shushan; and they hanged Haman's 10 sons.
Isa 14:19: 20: But you are cast out of your grave like an abominable branch: and as the clothing of those that are killed: thrust through with a sword: that go down to the stones of the pit; as a carcase trodden under feet.
Jer 22:19: He will be buried with the burial of an ass: drawn and cast forth beyond the gates of Jerusalem.
Jer 36:30: Therefore thus says the LORD of Jehoiakim king of Judah; He will have none to sit upon the throne of David: and His dead body will be cast out in the day to the heat: and in the night to the frost.

"that an"
Ec 4:3: Yes: better is he than both they: which has not yet been: who has not seen the evil work that is done under the sun.
Job 3:16: Or as an hidden untimely birth I not had been; as infants which never saw light.
Ps 58:8: As a snail which melts: let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman: that they not may see the sun.
Mt 26:24: The Son of man goes as it is written of Him: but woe to that man by whom the Son of man is betrayed! it had been good for that man if He not had been born.

 כִּֽי־בַהֶ֥בֶל בָּ֖א וּבַחֹ֣שֶׁךְ יֵלֵ֑ךְ וּבַחֹ֖שֶׁךְ שְׁמֹ֥ו יְכֻסֶּֽה׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- For Conj

H2088 זֶה zeh zeh a primitive word; the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that; he, idiom hence, idiom here, it(-self), idiom now, idiom of him, the one...the other, idiom than the other, (idiom out of) the (self) same, such (a one) that, these, this (hath, man), on this side...on that side, idiom thus, very, which. 5 Moreover he has not seen the sun, nor known any thing: this has more rest than the other.Ecclesiastes 6:5
Stats
Counts: 91 characters, 16 words, 71 letters, 24 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גַּם־שֶׁ֥מֶשׁ לֹא־רָאָ֖ה וְלֹ֣א יָדָ֑ע נַ֥חַת לָזֶ֖ה מִזֶּֽה׃

Lit: Though the sun not it has seen or known anything has more rest this than this man

KJV: Moreover he hath not seen the sun, nor known any thing: this hath more rest than the other.
References

"this"
Job 3:10-13: Because it not shut up the doors of my mother's womb: nor hid sorrow from my eyes.
Job 14:1: Man that is born of a woman is of few days: and full of trouble.
Ps 58:8: As a snail which melts: let every one of them pass away: like the untimely birth of a woman: that they not may see the sun.
Ps 90:7-9: For we are consumed by your anger: and by your wrath are we troubled.

6 Yes, though he live a000 years twice told, yet has he seen no good: not do all go to one place?Ecclesiastes 6:6
Stats
Counts: 102 characters, 19 words, 77 letters, 33 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְאִלּ֣וּ חָיָ֗ה אֶ֤לֶף שָׁנִים֙ פַּעֲמַ֔יִם וְטֹובָ֖ה לֹ֣א רָאָ֑ה הֲלֹ֛א אֶל־מָקֹ֥ום אֶחָ֖ד הַכֹּ֥ל הֹולֵֽךְ׃

Lit: And even if he lives a thousand years twice but goodness not has seen do not to place one all go

KJV: Yea, though he live a thousand years twice told, yet hath he seen no good: do not all go to one place?
References

"though"
Ge 5:5: 23: 24: All the days that Adam lived were 930 years: and he died.
Isa 65:22: They will not build: and another inhabit; they will not plant: and another eat: for as the days of a tree are the days of my people: and my elect will long enjoy the work of their hands.

"yet"
Ec 6:3: If a man beget 100 children: and live many years: so that the days of his years be many: and his soul not be filled with good: and also that he have no burial; I say: that an untimely birth is better than he.
Job 7:7: O remember that my life is wind: my eye will no more see good.
Ps 4:6: 7: There be many that say: Who will show us any good? LORD: lift you up the light of your face upon us.
Ps 34:12: What man is he who desires life: and loves many days: that he may see good?
Isa 65:20: There will be no more there an infant of days: nor an old man that has not filled his days: for the child will die 100 years old; but the sinner being 100 years old will be accursed.
Jer 17:6: For he will be like the heath in the desert: and will not see when good comes; but will inhabit the parched places in the wilderness: in a salt land not and inhabited.

"do"
Ec 3:20: All go to one place; all are of the dust: and all turn to dust again.
Ec 12:7: Then will the dust return to the earth as it was: and the spirit will return to God who gave it.
Job 1:21: Said: Naked came I out of my mother's womb: and naked will I return there: the LORD gave: and the LORD has taken away; blessed be the name of the LORD.
Job 30:23: For I know that you will bring me to death: and to the house appointed for all living.
Heb 9:27: As it is appointed to men once to die: but after this the judgment:

7 All the labour of man is for his mouth, and yet the appetite not is filled.Ecclesiastes 6:7
Stats
Rank: #5517 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 75 characters, 15 words, 58 letters, 23 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כָּל־עֲמַ֥ל הָאָדָ֖ם לְפִ֑יהוּ וְגַם־הַנֶּ֖פֶשׁ לֹ֥א תִמָּלֵֽא׃

Lit: All the labor of man is for his mouth and yet the soul not is satisfied

KJV: All the labour of man is for his mouth, and yet the appetite is not filled.
References

"the labour"
Ge 3:17-19: to Adam he said: Because you have listened to the voice of your wife: and have eaten of the tree: of which I commanded you: saying: You will not eat of it: cursed is the ground for your sake; in sorrow will you eat of it all the days of your life;
Pr 16:26: He who labours'>labours labours'>labours for himself; for his mouth craveth it of him.
Mt 6:25: Therefore I say to you: Take no thought for your life: what you will eat: or what you will drink; nor yet for your body: what you will put on. not Is the life more than meat: and the body than clothing?
Joh 6:27: not Labour for the meat which perishes: but for that meat which endures to everlasting life: which the Son of man will give to you: for Him has God the Father sealed.
1Ti 6:6-8: But godliness with contentment is great gain.

"appetite"
Ec 6:3: If a man beget 100 children: and live many years: so that the days of his years be many: and his soul not be filled with good: and also that he have no burial; I say: that an untimely birth is better than he.
Ec 5:10: He who loves'>loves silver will not be satisfied with silver; nor he who loves'>loves abundance with increase: this is also vanity.
Lu 12:19: I will say to my soul: Soul: you have much goods laid up for many years; take your ease: eat: drink: and be merry.

H3045 יָדַע yâdaʻ yaw-dah a primitive root; to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.); acknowledge, acquaintance(-ted with), advise, answer, appoint, assuredly, be aware, (un-) awares, can(-not), certainly, comprehend, consider, idiom could they, cunning, declare, be diligent, (can, cause to) discern, discover, endued with, familiar friend, famous, feel, can have, be (ig-) norant, instruct, kinsfolk, kinsman, (cause to let, make) know, (come to give, have, take) knowledge, have (knowledge), (be, make, make to be, make self) known, phrase be learned, phrase lie by man, mark, perceive, privy to, idiom prognosticator, regard, have respect, skilful, shew, can (man of) skill, be sure, of a surety, teach, (can) tell, understand, have (understanding), idiom will be, wist, wit, wot. 		יוֹדֵ֔עַyō-w-ḏê-a‘, who knows how V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms

H1980 הָלַךְ hâlak haw-lak akin to יָלַךְ; a primitive root; to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively); (all) along, apace, behave (self), come, (on) continually, be conversant, depart, phrase be eased, enter, exercise (self), phrase follow, forth, forward, get, go (about, abroad, along, away, forward, on, out, up and down), phrase greater, grow, be wont to haunt, lead, march, idiom more and more, move (self), needs, on, pass (away), be at the point, quite, run (along), phrase send, speedily, spread, still, surely, phrase tale-bearer, phrase travel(-ler), walk (abroad, on, to and fro, up and down, to places), wander, wax, (way-) faring man, idiom be weak, whirl. 		לַהֲלֹ֖ךְla-hă-lōḵ to walk Prep-l | V-Qal-Inf

H5048 נֶגֶד neged neh-ghed from נָגַד; a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before; about, (over) against, idiom aloof, idiom far (off), idiom from, over, presence, idiom other side, sight, idiom to view., 		נֶ֥גֶדne-ḡeḏ before Prep
H2416הַחַיִּֽים׃ha-ḥay-yîm.   (Art | Adj-mp)
H2416 חַי chay khah-ee from חָיָה; alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively; phrase age, alive, appetite, (wild) beast, company, congregation, life(-time), live(-ly), living (creature, thing), maintenance, phrase merry, multitude, phrase (be) old, quick, raw, running, springing, troop., 		הַחַיִּֽים׃ha-ḥay-yîm. the living Art | Adj-mp
8 For what has the wise more than the fool? what has the poor, that knows to walk before the living?Ecclesiastes 6:8
Stats
Rank: #6964 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 102 characters, 18 words, 80 letters, 28 vowels, 52 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֛י מַה־יֹּותֵ֥ר לֶחָכָ֖ם מִֽן־הַכְּסִ֑יל מַה־לֶּעָנִ֣י יֹודֵ֔עַ לַהֲלֹ֖ךְ נֶ֥גֶד הַחַיִּֽים׃

Lit: For what has more the wise man than the fool what does have the poor man who knows how to walk before the living

KJV: For what hath the wise more than the fool? what hath the poor, that knoweth to walk before the living?
References

"what hath the wise"
Ec 2:14-16: The wise man's eyes are in his head; but the fool walks in darkness: and I myself perceived also that one event happens to them all.
Ec 5:11: When goods increase: they are increased that eat them: and what good is there to the owners thereof: saving the beholding of them with their eyes?

"the poor"
Ge 17:1: When Abram was 90 years old and 9: the LORD appeared to Abram: and said to Him: I am the Almighty God; walk before me: and be you perfect.
Ps 101:2: I will behave myself wisely in a perfect way. O when will you come to me? I will walk within my house with a perfect heart.
Ps 116:9: I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.
Pr 19:1: Better is the poor that walks in his integrity: than he who is perverse in his lips: and is a fool.
Lu 1:6: They were both righteous before God: walking in all the commandments and ordinances of the Lord blameless.
1Ti 6:17: Charge them that are rich in this world: that they not be highminded: nor trust in uncertain riches: but in the living God: who gives us richly all things to enjoy;

H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		רֽוּחַ׃rū-aḥ. the wind N-cs
9 Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of the desire: this is also vanity and vexation of spirit.Ecclesiastes 6:9
Stats
Rank: #7791 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 111 characters, 18 words, 87 letters, 33 vowels, 54 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: טֹ֛וב מַרְאֵ֥ה עֵינַ֖יִם מֵֽהֲלָךְ־נָ֑פֶשׁ גַּם־זֶ֥ה הֶ֖בֶל וּרְע֥וּת רֽוּחַ׃

Lit: Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of desire also this is vanity and grasping for the wind

KJV: Better is the sight of the eyes than the wandering of the desire: this [is] also vanity and vexation of spirit.
References

"Better"
Ec 2:24: There is nothing better for a man: than that He should eat and drink: and that He should make His soul enjoy good in His labour. This also I saw: that it was from the hand of God.
Ec 3:12: 13: I know that there is no good in them: but for a man to rejoice: and to do good in his life.
Ec 5:18: Look that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink: and to enjoy the good of all His labour that He takes under the sun all the days of His life: which God gives Him: for it is His portion.

"wandering of the desire"
Job 31:7: If my step has turned out of the way: and my heart walked after my eyes: and if any blot has cleaved to my hands;
Pr 30:15: 16: The horseleach has two daughters: crying: Give: give. There are 3 things that are never satisfied: yes: 4 things not say: It is enough:
Jer 2:20: For of old time I have broken your yoke: and burst your bands; and you said: I not will transgress; when upon every high hill and under every green tree you wander: playing the harlot.

"this"
Ec 6:2: A man to whom God has given riches: wealth: and honour: so that He wants nothing for His soul of all that He desires: yet God gives Him not">not Him power to eat thereof: but a stranger eats it: this is vanity: and it is an evil disease.
Ec 1:2: 14: Vanity of vanities: says the Preacher: vanity of vanities; all is vanity.
Ec 2:11: 22: 23: Then I looked on all the works that my hands had wrought: and on the labour that I had laboured to do: and: look: all was vanity and vexation of spirit: and there was no profit under the sun.
Ec 4:4: Again: I considered all travail: and every right work: that for this a man is envied of his neighbour. This is also vanity and vexation of spirit.

H4100מַה־mah-   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מַה־mah- What Interrog

10 That which has been is named already, and it is known that it is man: neither may he contend with him that is mightier than he.Ecclesiastes 6:10
Stats
Counts: 128 characters, 24 words, 100 letters, 35 vowels, 65 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מַה־שֶּֽׁהָיָ֗ה כְּבָר֙ נִקְרָ֣א שְׁמֹ֔ו וְנֹודָ֖ע אֲשֶׁר־ה֣וּא אָדָ֑ם וְלֹא־יוּכַ֣ל לָדִ֔ין עִ֥ם [שֶׁהַתְקִיף כ] (שֶׁתַּקִּ֖יף ק) מִמֶּֽנּוּ׃

Lit: What one is already he has been named for it is known that he is man and cannot he contend with Him who is mightier than he

KJV: That which hath been is named already, and it is known that it is man: neither may he contend with him that is mightier than he.
References

"which"
Ec 1:9-11: The thing that has been: it is that which will be; and that which is done is that which will be done: and there is no new thing under the sun.
Ec 3:15: That which has been is now; and that which is to be has already been; and God requires that which is past.

"and it"
Ge 3:9: 17-19: The LORD God called to Adam: and said to Him: Where are you?
Job 14:1-4: Man that is born of a woman is of few days: and full of trouble.
Ps 39:6: Surely every man walks in a vain show: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heaps up riches: and knows not who will gather them.
Ps 82:6: 7: I have said: You are gods; and all of you are children of the most High.
Ps 103:15: As for man: his days are as grass: as a flower of the field: so he flourishes.

"neither"
Job 9:3: 4: 32: If he will contend with him: he cannot answer him one of a000.
Job 33:13: Why do you strive against him? for he gives not account of any of his matters.
Job 40:2: Will He that'>He who contends with the Almighty instruct Him? He that'>He who reproves God: let Him answer it.
Isa 45:9: 10: Woe to him that strives with his Maker! Let the potsherd strive with the potsherds of the earth. Will the clay say to him that fashions it: What make you? or your work: He has no hands?
Jer 49:19: Look: he will come up like a lion from the swelling of Jordan against the habitation of the strong: but I will suddenly make him run away from her: and who is a chosen man: that I may appoint over her? for who is like me? and who will appoint me the time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before me?
Ro 9:19: 20: You will say then to me: Why does he yet find fault? For who has resisted his will?

H3588כִּ֛יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֛יkî Since Conj

11 Seeing there be many things that increase vanity, what is man the better?Ecclesiastes 6:11
Stats
Counts: 73 characters, 12 words, 59 letters, 21 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֛י יֵשׁ־דְּבָרִ֥ים הַרְבֵּ֖ה מַרְבִּ֣ים הָ֑בֶל מַה־יֹּתֵ֖ר לָאָדָֽם׃

Lit: Since there are things many that increase vanity how is the better man

KJV: Seeing there be many things that increase vanity, what is man the better?
References

"Seeing there be many things that increase vanity, what is man the better?"
Ec 1:6-9: 17: 18: The wind goes toward the south: and turns about to the north; it whirleth about continually: and the wind returns again according to his circuits.
Ec 2:3-11: I sought in my heart to give myself to wine: yet acquainting my heart with wisdom; and to lay hold on folly: till I might see what was that good for the sons of men: which they should do under the heaven all the days of their life.
Ec 3:19: For that which befalls'>befalls'>befalls the sons of men befalls'>befalls'>befalls beasts; even one thing befalls'>befalls'>befalls them: as the one dies'>dies: so dies'>dies the other; yes: they have all one breath; so that a man has no preeminence above a beast: for all is vanity.
Ec 4:1-4: 8: 16: So I returned: and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and look the tears of such as were oppressed: and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.
Ec 5:7: For in the multitude of dreams and many words there are also divers vanities: but fear you God.
Ps 73:6: Therefore pride compasss them about as a chain; violence covers them as a garment.
Ho 12:1: Ephraim feeds on wind: and follows after the east wind: he daily increases lies and desolation; and they do make a covenant with the Assyrians: and oil is carried into Egypt.

H8121 שֶׁמֶשׁ shemesh sheh-mesh from an unused root meaning to be brilliant; the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement; phrase east side(-ward), sun (rising), phrase west(-ward), window. 12 For who knows what is good for man in this life, all the days of his vain life which he spends as a shadow? for who can tell a man what will be after him under the sun?Ecclesiastes 6:12
Stats
Counts: 175 characters, 34 words, 133 letters, 47 vowels, 86 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֣י מִֽי־יֹודֵעַ֩ מַה־טֹּ֨וב לָֽאָדָ֜ם בַּֽחַיִּ֗ים מִסְפַּ֛ר יְמֵי־חַיֵּ֥י הֶבְלֹ֖ו וְיַעֲשֵׂ֣ם כַּצֵּ֑ל אֲשֶׁר֙ מִֽי־יַגִּ֣יד לָֽאָדָ֔ם מַה־יִּהְיֶ֥ה אַחֲרָ֖יו תַּ֥חַת הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃

Lit: for who knows what is good for man in life all the days of life his vain and which he passes like a shadow which who can tell a man what will happen after him under the sun

KJV: For who knoweth what is good for man in [this] life, all the days of his vain life which he spendeth as a shadow? for who can tell a man what shall be after him under the sun?
References

"who knoweth"
Ec 2:3: I sought in my heart to give myself to wine: yet acquainting my heart with wisdom; and to lay hold on folly: till I might see what was that good for the sons of men: which they should do under the heaven all the days of their life.
Ec 12:13: Let us hear the conclusion of the whole matter: Fear God: and keep His commandments: for this is the whole duty of man.
Ps 4:6: There be many that say: Who will show us any good? LORD: lift you up the light of your face upon us.
Ps 16:5: The LORD is the portion of my inheritance and of my cup: you maintain my lot.
Ps 17:15: As for me: I will look your face in righteousness: I will be satisfied: when I awake: with your likeness.
Ps 47:4: He will choose our inheritance for us: the excellency of Jacob whom he loved. Selah.
La 3:24-27: The LORD is my portion: says my soul; therefore will I hope in Him.
Mic 6:8: He has showed you: O man: what is good; and what does the LORD require of you: but to do justly: and to love mercy: and to walk humbly with your God?

"the days of his vain life"
Ec 8:13: But it will not be well with the wicked: neither will He prolong His days: which are as a shadow; because He fears not before God.
Ec 9:6: Also their love: and their hatred: and their envy: is now perished; neither have they any more a portion for ever in any thing that is done under the sun.
1Ch 29:15: For we are strangers before you: and sojourners: as were all our fathers: our days on the earth are as a shadow: and there is none abiding.
Job 8:9: (For we are but of yesterday: and not knowhing: because our days upon earth are a shadow:)
Job 14:2: He comes forth like a flower: and is cut down: he flees also as a shadow: and continues not.
Ps 39:5: 6: Look: you have made my days as an handbreadth; and my age is not ashing before you: truly every man at his best state is altogether vanity. Selah.
Ps 89:47: Remember how short my time is: for what reason have you made all men in vain?
Ps 90:10-12: The days of our years are threescore years and 10; and if by reason of strength they be fourscore years: yet is their strength labour and sorrow; for it is soon cut off: and we fly away.
Ps 102:11: My days are like a shadow that declines; and I am withered like grass.
Ps 109:23: I am gone like the shadow when it declines: I am tossed up and down as the locust.
Ps 144:4: Man is like to vanity: his days are as a shadow that passs away.
Jas 4:14: Whereas you not know what will be on the morrow. For what is your life? It is even a vapour: that appears for a little time: and then vanishes away.

"for who can"
Ec 3:22: For what reason I perceive that there is nothing better: than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who will bring him to see what will be after him?
Ec 8:7: For he knows not that which will be: for who can tell him when it will be?
Job 14:21: His sons come to honour: and he knows it not; and they are brought low: but he perceives it not of them.

7
The Teacher’s Conclusions

The Value of Wisdom

טֹ֥וב שֵׁ֖ם מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן טֹ֑וב וְיֹ֣ום הַמָּ֔וֶת מִיֹּ֖ום הִוָּלְדֹֽו׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H2896ט֥וֹבṭō-wḇ   (Adj-ms)
H2896 טוֹב ṭôwb tobe from טוֹב; good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well); beautiful, best, better, bountiful, cheerful, at ease, idiom fair (word), (be in) favour, fine, glad, good (deed, -lier, -liest, -ly, -ness, -s), graciously, joyful, kindly, kindness, liketh (best), loving, merry, idiom most, pleasant, phrase pleaseth, pleasure, precious, prosperity, ready, sweet, wealth, welfare, (be) well(-favoured)., 		ט֥וֹבṭō-wḇ is better Adj-ms

H8034 שֵׁם shêm shame a primitive word (perhaps rather from through the idea of definite and conspicuous position; compare שָׁמַיִם); an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character; phrase base, (in-) fame(-ous), named(-d), renown, report. 		שֵׁ֖םšêm a good name N-ms

H3205הִוָּלְדֽוֹ׃hiw-wā-lə-ḏōw.   (V-Nifal-Inf | 3ms)
H3205 יָלַד yâlad yaw-lad a primitive root; to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage; bear, beget, birth(-day), born, (make to) bring forth (children, young), bring up, calve, child, come, be delivered (of a child), time of delivery, gender, hatch, labour, (do the office of a) midwife, declare pedigrees, be the son of, (woman in, woman that) travail(-eth, -ing woman). 		הִוָּלְדֽוֹ׃hiw-wā-lə-ḏōw. of ones birth V-Nifal-Inf | 3ms
1 A good name is better than precious ointment; and the day of death than the day of one's birth.Ecclesiastes 7:1
Stats
Counts: 95 characters, 18 words, 74 letters, 29 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: טֹ֥וב שֵׁ֖ם מִשֶּׁ֣מֶן טֹ֑וב וְיֹ֣ום הַמָּ֔וֶת מִיֹּ֖ום הִוָּלְדֹֽו׃

Lit: is better a good name than ointment precious and the day of death than the day of ones birth

KJV: A good name is better than precious ointment; and the day of death than the day of one's birth.
References

"name"
Pr 15:30: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart: and a good report makes the bones fat.
Pr 22:1: A good name is rather to be chosen than great riches: and loving favour rather than silver and gold.
Isa 56:5: Even to them will I give in my house and within my walls a place and a name better than of sons and of daughters: I will give them an everlasting name: that will not be cut off.
Lu 10:20: Notwithstanding in this not rejoice: that the spirits are subject to you; but rather rejoice: because your names are written in heaven.
Heb 11:2: 39: For by it the elders obtained a good report.

"precious"
Ec 10:1: Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: so does a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom and honour.
Ps 133:2: It is like the precious ointment upon the head: that ran down upon the beard: even Aaron's beard: that went down to the skirts of his garments;
Pr 27:9: Ointment and perfume rejoice the heart: so does the sweetness of a man's friend by hearty counsel.
Song 1:3: Because of the savour of your good ointments your name is as ointment poured forth: therefore do the virgins love you.
Song 4:10: How fair is your love: my sister: my spouse! how much better is your love than wine! and the smell of your ointments than all spices!
Joh 13:2: Supper being ended: the devil having now put into the heart of Judas Iscariot: Simon's son: to betray him;

"the day"
Ec 4:2: For what reason I praised the dead which are already dead more than the living which are yet alive.
Job 3:17: There the wicked cease from troubling; and there the weary be at rest.
Isa 57:1: 2: The righteous perishes: and no man lays it to heart: and merciful men are taken away: none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
2Co 5:1: 8: For we know that if our earthly house of this tabernacle were dissolved: we have a building of God: an not house made with hands: eternal in the heavens.
Php 1:21-23: For to me to live is Christ: and to die is gain.
Re 14:13: I heard a voice from heaven saying to me: Write: Blessed are the dead which die in the Lord from henceforth: Yes: says the Spirit: that they may rest from their labours; and their works do follow them.

H3820לִבּֽוֹ׃lib-bōw.   (N-msc | 3ms)
H3820 לֵב lêb labe a form of לֵבָב; the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything; phrase care for, comfortably, consent, idiom considered, courag(-eous), friend(-ly), ((broken-), (hard-), (merry-), (stiff-), (stout-), double) heart(-ed), idiom heed, idiom I, kindly, midst, mind(-ed), idiom regard(-ed), idiom themselves, idiom unawares, understanding, idiom well, willingly, wisdom. 		לִבּֽוֹ׃lib-bōw. heart N-msc | 3ms
2 It is better to go to the house of mourning, than to go to the house of feasting: for that is the end of all men; and the living will lay it to his heart.Ecclesiastes 7:2
Stats
Counts: 158 characters, 28 words, 116 letters, 46 vowels, 70 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: טֹ֞וב לָלֶ֣כֶת אֶל־בֵּֽית־אֵ֗בֶל מִלֶּ֙כֶת֙ אֶל־בֵּ֣ית מִשְׁתֶּ֔ה בַּאֲשֶׁ֕ר ה֖וּא סֹ֣וף כָּל־הָאָדָ֑ם וְהַחַ֖י יִתֵּ֥ן אֶל־לִבֹּֽו׃

Lit: Better to go to the house of mourning Than to go to the house of feasting for that is the end of all men and the living will take it to heart

KJV: It is better to go to the house of mourning, than to go to the house of feasting: for that [is] the end of all men; and the living will lay [it] to his heart.
References

"better"
Ge 48:1-22: It came to pass after these things: that one told Joseph: Look: your father is sick: and he took with him his two sons: Manasseh and Ephraim.
Ge 49:2-33: Gather yourselves together: and hear: you sons of Jacob; and listen to Israel your father.
Ge 50:15-17: When Joseph's brothers saw that their father was dead: they said: Joseph will perhaps hate us: and will certainly requite us all the evil which we did to him.
Job 1:4: 5: His sons went and feasted in their houses: every one his day; and sent and called for their 3 sisters to eat and to drink with them.
Isa 5:11: 12: Woe to them that rise up early in the morning: that they may follow strong drink; that continue until night: till wine inflame them!
Isa 22:12-14: In that day did the Lord GOD of hosts call to weeping: and to mourning: and to baldness: and to girding with sackcloth:
Am 6:3-6: You that put far away the evil day: and cause the seat of violence to come near;
Mt 5:4: Blessed are they that mourn: for they will be comforted.
Mt 14:6-12: But when Herod's birthday was kept: the daughter of Herodias danced before them: and pleased Herod.
1Pe 4:3: 4: For the time past of our life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles: when we walked in lasciviousness: lusts: excess of wine: revellings: banquetings: and abominable idolatries:

"that"
Nu 23:10: Who can count the dust of Jacob: and the number of the fourth part of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous: and let my last end be like his!
De 32:29: O that they were wise: that they understood this: that they would consider their latter end!
Ro 6:21: 22: What fruit had you then in those things whereof you are now ashamed? for the end of those things is death.
Php 3:19: Whose end is destruction: whose God is their belly: and whose glory is in their shame: who mind earthly things.)
Heb 9:27: As it is appointed to men once to die: but after this the judgment:

"living"
De 32:46: He said to them: Set your hearts to all the words which I testify among you this day: which you will command your children to observe to do: all the words of this law.
Isa 47:7: you said: I will be a lady for ever: so that you did not lay these things to your heart: neither did remember the latter end of it.
Hag 1:5: Now therefore thus says the LORD of hosts; Consider your ways.
Mal 2:2: If you not will hear: and if you not will lay it to heart: to give glory to my name: says the LORD of hosts: I will even send a curse upon you: and I will curse your blessings: yes: I have cursed them already: because you not do lay it to heart.

 טֹ֥וב כַּ֖עַס מִשְּׂחֹ֑ק כִּֽי־בְרֹ֥עַ פָּנִ֖ים יִ֥יטַב לֵֽב׃

H3588כִּֽי־kî-   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּֽי־kî- for Conj

H6440פָּנִ֖יםpā-nîm   (N-mp)
H6440 פָּנִים pânîym paw-neem plural (but always as singular) of an unused noun פָּנֶה; from פָּנָה); the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.); phrase accept, a-(be-) fore(-time), against, anger, idiom as (long as), at, phrase battle, phrase because (of), phrase beseech, countenance, edge, phrase employ, endure, phrase enquire, face, favour, fear of, for, forefront(-part), form(-er time, -ward), from, front, heaviness, idiom him(-self), phrase honourable, phrase impudent, phrase in, it, look(-eth) (-s), idiom me, phrase meet, idiom more than, mouth, of, off, (of) old (time), idiom on, open, phrase out of, over against, the partial, person, phrase please, presence, propect, was purposed, by reason of, phrase regard, right forth, phrase serve, idiom shewbread, sight, state, straight, phrase street, idiom thee, idiom them(-selves), through (phrase -out), till, time(-s) past, (un-) to(-ward), phrase upon, upside (phrase down), with(-in, phrase -stand), idiom ye, idiom you. 		פָּנִ֖יםpā-nîm a countenance N-mp

H3190 יָטַב yâṭab yaw-tab a primitive root; to be (causative) make well, literally (sound, beautiful) or figuratively (happy, successful, right); be accepted, amend, use aright, benefit, be (make) better, seem best, make cheerful, be comely, phrase be content, diligent(-ly), dress, earnestly, find favour, give, be glad, do (be, make) good(-ness), be (make) merry, please (phrase well), shew more (kindness), skilfully, idiom very small, surely, make sweet, thoroughly, tire, trim, very, be (can, deal, entreat, go, have) well (said, seen). 		יִ֥יטַבyî-ṭaḇ is made better V-Qal-Imperf-3ms
H3820לֵֽב׃lêḇ.   (N-ms)
H3820 לֵב lêb labe a form of לֵבָב; the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything; phrase care for, comfortably, consent, idiom considered, courag(-eous), friend(-ly), ((broken-), (hard-), (merry-), (stiff-), (stout-), double) heart(-ed), idiom heed, idiom I, kindly, midst, mind(-ed), idiom regard(-ed), idiom themselves, idiom unawares, understanding, idiom well, willingly, wisdom. 		לֵֽב׃lêḇ. the heart N-ms
3 Sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sadness of the face the heart is made better.Ecclesiastes 7:3
Stats
Counts: 95 characters, 16 words, 77 letters, 28 vowels, 49 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: טֹ֥וב כַּ֖עַס מִשְּׂחֹ֑ק כִּֽי־בְרֹ֥עַ פָּנִ֖ים יִ֥יטַב לֵֽב׃

Lit: is better Sorrow than laughter for by sad a countenance is made better the heart

KJV: Sorrow is better than laughter: for by the sadness of the countenance the heart is made better.

Zec 12:10-14: I will pour upon the house of David: and upon the inhabitants of Jerusalem: the spirit of grace and of supplications: and they will look upon me whom they have pierced: and they will mourn for him: as one mourns for his only son: and will be in bitterness for him: as one that is in bitterness for his firstborn.
Lu 6:21: 25: Blessed are you that hunger now: for you will be filled. Blessed are you that weep now: for you will laugh.

"by"

4 The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.Ecclesiastes 7:4
Stats

Lit: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth

KJV: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools [is] in the house of mirth.

H3651 כֵּן kên kane from כּוּן; properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles); phrase after that (this, -ward, -wards), as... as, phrase (for-) asmuch as yet, phrase be (for which) cause, phrase following, howbeit, in (the) like (manner, -wise), idiom the more, right, (even) so, state, straightway, such (thing), surely, phrase there (where) -fore, this, thus, true, well, idiom you., 		כֵּ֖ןkên so Adv
