H1571וְגַם־wə-ḡam-   (Conj-w | Conj)
H1571 גַּם gam gam by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and; again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea. 		וְגַם־wə-ḡam- and also Conj-w | Conj
H2088זֶ֖הzeh   (Pro-ms)
H2088 זֶה zeh zeh a primitive word; the masculine demonstrative pronoun, this or that; he, idiom hence, idiom here, it(-self), idiom now, idiom of him, the one...the other, idiom than the other, (idiom out of) the (self) same, such (a one) that, these, this (hath, man), on this side...on that side, idiom thus, very, which. Compare זֹאת, זֹה, זוֹ, זוּ., 		זֶ֖הzeh this is Pro-ms
H1892הָֽבֶל׃hā-ḇel.   (N-ms)
H1892 הֶבֶל hebel hehbel or (rarely in the abs.) הֲבֵל; from הָבַל; emptiness or vanity; figuratively, something transitory and unsatisfactory; often used as an adverb; idiom altogether, vain, vanity. 		הָֽבֶל׃hā-ḇel. vanity N-ms
6 For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so is the laughter of the fool: this also is vanity.Ecclesiastes 7:6
Stats
Counts: 98 characters, 16 words, 74 letters, 27 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֣י כְקֹ֤ול הַסִּירִים֙ תַּ֣חַת הַסִּ֔יר כֵּ֖ן שְׂחֹ֣ק הַכְּסִ֑יל וְגַם־זֶ֖ה הָֽבֶל׃

Lit: For like the crackling of thorns under a pot so is the laughter of the fool and also this is vanity

KJV: For as the crackling of thorns under a pot, so is the laughter of the fool: this also [is] vanity.
References

"as"
Ec 2:2: I said of laughter: It is mad: and of mirth: What does it?
Ps 58:9: Before your pots can feel the thorns: he will take them away as with a whirlwind: both living: and in his wrath.
Ps 118:12: They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.
Isa 65:13-15: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD: Look: my servants will eat: but you will be hungry: look: my servants will drink: but you will be thirsty: look: my servants will rejoice: but you will be ashamed:
Am 8:10: I will turn your feasts into mourning: and all your songs into lamentation; and I will bring up sackcloth upon all loins: and baldness upon every head; and I will make it as the mourning of an only son: and the end thereof as a bitter day.
Lu 6:25: Woe to you that are full! for you will hunger. Woe to you that laugh now! for you will mourn and weep.
Lu 16:25: But Abraham said: Son: remember that you in your lifetime receivedst your good things: and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now He is comforted: and you are tormented.
2Pe 2:13-17: will receive the reward of unrighteousness: as they that count it pleasure to riot in the day time. Spots they are and blemishes: sporting themselves with their own deceivings while they feast with you;
Jude 1:12: 13: These are spots in your feasts of charity: when they feast with you: feeding themselves without fear: clouds they are without water: carried about of winds; trees whose fruit withers: without fruit: twice dead: plucked up by the roots;

"the laughter"
Pr 29:9: If a wise man contends with a foolish man: whether he rage or laugh: there is no rest.

H3588כִּ֥יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֥יkî Surely Conj

7 Surely oppression makes a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.Ecclesiastes 7:7
Stats

Translation

Lit: Surely oppression destroys reason a wise mans and debases the heart a bribe

KJV: Surely oppression maketh a wise man mad; and a gift destroyeth the heart.
References

"oppression"

"a gift"
Ex 23:8: you will take no gift: for the gift blinds the wise: and perverts the words of the righteous.
De 16:19: You will not wrest judgment; you will not respect persons: neither take a gift: for a gift does blind the eyes of the wise: and pervert the words of the righteous.
1Sa 8:3: His sons not walked in his ways: but turned aside after lucre: and took bribes: and perverted judgment.
1Sa 12:3: Look: here I am: witness against me before the LORD: and before His anointed: whose ox have I taken? or whose ass have I taken? or whom have I defrauded? whom have I oppressed? or of whose hand have I received any bribe to blind my eyes therewith? and I will restore it you.
Pr 17:23: A wicked man takes a gift out of the bosom to pervert the ways of judgment.
Isa 1:23: Your princes are rebellious: and companions of thieves: every one loves gifts: and follows after rewards: they not judge the fatherless: neither does the cause of the widow come to them.
Isa 33:15: He who walks righteously: and speaks uprightly; he who despises the gain of oppressions: that shakes his hands from holding of bribes: that stops his ears from hearing of blood: and shuts his eyes from seeing evil;

H7307ר֖וּחַrū-aḥ   (N-cs)

8 Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: and the patient in spirit is better than the proud in spirit.Ecclesiastes 7:8

Translation
Hebrew: טֹ֛וב אַחֲרִ֥ית דָּבָ֖ר מֵֽרֵאשִׁיתֹ֑ו טֹ֥וב אֶֽרֶךְ־ר֖וּחַ מִגְּבַהּ־רֽוּחַ׃

Lit: is better the end of a thing than its beginning is better the slow in spirit than the high in spirit

KJV: Better is the end of a thing than the beginning thereof: [and] the patient in spirit [is] better than the proud in spirit.
References

"Better"
Ps 126:5: 6: They that sow in tears will reap in joy.
Isa 10:24: 25: 28-34: Therefore thus says the Lord GOD of hosts: O my people that dwell in Zion: not be afraid of the Assyrian: He will smite you with a rod: and will lift up His staff against you: after the manner of Egypt.
Lu 16:25: But Abraham said: Son: remember that you in your lifetime receivedst your good things: and likewise Lazarus evil things: but now He is comforted: and you are tormented.
Jas 5:11: Look: we count them happy which endure. You have heard of the patience of Job: and have seen the end of the Lord; that the Lord is very pitiful: and of tender mercy.
1Pe 1:13: For what reason gird up the loins of your mind: be sober: and hope to the end for the grace that is to be brought to you at the revelation of Jesus Christ;

"the patient"
Pr 13:10: Only by pride comes contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.
Pr 14:29: He who is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he who is hasty of spirit exalts folly.
Pr 15:18: A wrathful man stirs up strife: but he who is slow to anger appeases strife.
Pr 16:32: He who is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
Pr 28:25: He who is of a proud heart stirs up strife: but He that'>He who puts His trust in the LORD will be made fat.
Lu 21:19: In your patience possess you your souls.
Ro 2:7: 8: To them who by patient continuance in well doing seek for glory and honour and immortality: eternal life:
Heb 10:36: For you have need of patience: that: after you have done the will of God: you might receive the promise.
Jas 5:8: Be you also patient; stablish your hearts: for the coming of the Lord draws nigh.
1Pe 2:20: 21: For what glory is it: if: when you be buffeted for your faults: you will take it patiently? but if: when you do well: and suffer for it: you take it patiently: this is acceptable with God.
1Pe 5:5: 6: Likewise: you younger: submit yourselves to the elder. Yes: all of you be subject one to another: and be clothed with humility: for God resists the proud: and gives grace to the humble.

H5117יָנֽוּחַ׃yā-nū-aḥ.   (V-Qal-Imperf-3ms)
H5117 נוּחַ nûwach noo-akh a primitive root; to rest, i.e. settle down; used in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, intransitive, transitive and causative (to dwell, stay, let fall, place, let alone, withdraw, give comfort, etc.); cease, be confederate, lay, let down, (be) quiet, remain, (cause to, be at, give, have, make to) rest, set down. Counts: 80 characters, 16 words, 62 letters, 21 vowels, 41 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַל־תְּבַהֵ֥ל בְּרֽוּחֲךָ֖ לִכְעֹ֑וס כִּ֣י כַ֔עַס בְּחֵ֥יק כְּסִילִ֖ים יָנֽוּחַ׃

Lit: Not do hasten in your spirit to be angry for anger in the bosom of fools rests

KJV: Be not hasty in thy spirit to be angry: for anger resteth in the bosom of fools.
References

"hasty"
1Sa 25:21: 22: Now David had said: Surely in vain have I kept all that this fellow has in the wilderness: so not thathing was missed of all that pertained to him: and he has requited me evil for good.
2Sa 19:43: The men of Israel answered the men of Judah: and said: We have 10 parts in the king: and we have also more right in David than you: why then did you despise us: that our advice not should be first had in bringing back our king? And the words of the men of Judah were fiercer than the words of the men of Israel.
Es 3:5: 6: When Haman saw that Mordecai not bowed: nor did him reverence: then was Haman full of wrath.
Pr 14:17: He who is soon angry deals foolishly: and a man of wicked devices is hated.
Pr 16:32: He who is slow to anger is better than the mighty; and he who rules his spirit than he who takes a city.
Jon 4:9: God said to Jonah: Do you well to be angry for the gourd? And He said: I do well to be angry: even to death.
Eph 4:26: 27: Be you angry: and not sin: not let the sun go down upon your wrath:
Jas 1:19: For what reason: my beloved brothers: let every man be swift to hear: slow to speak: slow to wrath:

"anger"
Ge 4:5: 6: 8: But to Cain and to his offering he not had respect. And Cain was very angry: and his face fell.
Ge 34:7: 8: 25: 26: 30: 31: The sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved: and they were very angry: because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter; which thing not ought to be done.
2Sa 13:22: 28: 32: Absalom spoke to his brother Amnon neither good nor bad: for Absalom hated Amnon: because he had forced his sister Tamar.
Pr 26:23-26: Burning lips and a wicked heart are like a potsherd covered with silver dross.
Mr 6:19: 24: Therefore Herodias had a quarrel against him: and would have killed him; but she not could:

H408 אַל ʼal al a negative particle (akin to לֹא); not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing; nay, neither, phrase never, no, nor, not, nothing (worth), rather than., 		אַל־’al- Not Adv

H559 אָמַר ʼâmar aw-mar a primitive root; to say (used with great latitude); answer, appoint, avouch, bid, boast self, call, certify, challenge, charge, phrase (at the, give) command(-ment), commune, consider, declare, demand, idiom desire, determine, idiom expressly, idiom indeed, idiom intend, name, idiom plainly, promise, publish, report, require, say, speak (against, of), idiom still, idiom suppose, talk, tell, term, idiom that is, idiom think, use (speech), utter, idiom verily, idiom yet. 		תֹּאמַר֙tō-mar do say V-Qal-Imperf-2ms
H4100מֶ֣הmeh   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מֶ֣הmeh why Interrog

10 not Say you, What is the cause that the former days were better than these? for you do not inquire wisely concerning this.Ecclesiastes 7:10

Translation
Hebrew: אַל־תֹּאמַר֙ מֶ֣ה הָיָ֔ה שֶׁ֤הַיָּמִים֙ הָרִ֣אשֹׁנִ֔ים הָי֥וּ טֹובִ֖ים מֵאֵ֑לֶּה כִּ֛י לֹ֥א מֵחָכְמָ֖ה שָׁאַ֥לְתָּ עַל־זֶֽה׃

Lit: Not do say why were the days former were better than these for not wisely you do inquire concerning this

KJV: Say not thou, What is the cause that the former days were better than these? for thou dost not inquire wisely concerning this.
References

"What"
Jg 6:13: Gideon said to Him: Oh my Lord: if the LORD be with us: why then is all this befallen us? and where be all His miracles which our fathers told us of: saying: not Did the LORD bring us up from Egypt? but now the LORD has forsaken us: and delivered us into the hands of the Midianites.
Jer 44:17-19: But we will certainly do whatever thing goes forth out of our own mouth: to burn incense to the queen of heaven: and to pour out drink offerings to her: as we have done: we: and our fathers: our kings: and our princes: in the cities of Judah: and in the streets of Jerusalem: for then had we plenty of victuals: and were well: and saw no evil.

"wisely"
Ge 6:11: 12: The earth also was corrupt before God: and the earth was filled with violence.
Ps 14:2: 3: The LORD looked down from heaven upon the children of men: to see if there were any that did understand: and seek God.
Isa 50:1: Thus says the LORD: Where is the bill of your mother's divorcement: whom I have put away? or which of my creditors is it to whom I have sold you? Look: for your iniquities have you sold yourselves: and for your transgressions is your mother put away.
Ro 1:22-32: Professing themselves to be wise: they became fools:
Ro 3:9-19: What then? are we better than they? No: in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles: that they are all under sin;

H8121 שֶׁמֶשׁ shemesh sheh-mesh from an unused root meaning to be brilliant; the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement; phrase east side(-ward), sun (rising), phrase west(-ward), window. 11 Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.Ecclesiastes 7:11

Translation
Hebrew: טֹובָ֥ה חָכְמָ֖ה עִֽם־נַחֲלָ֑ה וְיֹתֵ֖ר לְרֹאֵ֥י הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃

Lit: is good Wisdom with an inheritance and profitable to those who see the sun

KJV: Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and [by it there is] profit to them that see the sun.
References

"good with an inheritance"

Lu 16:8: 9: The lord commended the unjust steward: because he had done wisely: for the children of this world are in their generation wiser than the children of light.

"them"

Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֛י בְּצֵ֥ל הַֽחָכְמָ֖ה בְּצֵ֣ל הַכָּ֑סֶף וְיִתְרֹ֣ון דַּ֔עַת הַֽחָכְמָ֖ה תְּחַיֶּ֥ה בְעָלֶֽיהָ׃

Lit: For is a defense wisdom is a defense as money but the excellence of knowledge is that wisdom gives life to those who have it

KJV: For wisdom is a defence, [and] money [is] a defence: but the excellency of knowledge [is, that] wisdom giveth life to them that have it.
References

"wisdom"
Job 1:10: Have not you made an hedge about him: and about his house: and about all that he has on every side? you have blessed the work of his hands: and his substance is increased in the land.
Job 22:21-25: Acquaint now yourself with him: and be at peace: thereby good will come to you.
Pr 2:7: 11: He lays up sound wisdom for the righteous: he is a buckler to them that walk uprightly.
Pr 14:20: The poor is hated even of his own neighbour: but the rich has many friends.
Pr 18:10: 11: The name of the LORD is a strong tower: the righteous runs into it: and is safe.
Isa 33:6: Wisdom and knowledge will be the stability of your times: and strength of salvation: the fear of the LORD is His treasure.

"a defence"
Jg 9:15: The bramble said to the trees: If in truth you anoint me king over you: then come and put your trust in my shadow: and not if: let fire come out of the bramble: and devour the cedars of Lebanon.
Ps 57:1: He fled from Saul in the cave.>> Be merciful to me: O God: be merciful to me: for my soul trusts in you: yes: in the shadow of your wings will I make my refuge: until these calamities be overpast.
Isa 30:2: That walk to go down into Egypt: and not have asked at my mouth; to strengthen themselves in the strength of Pharaoh: and to trust in the shadow of Egypt!
Isa 32:2: A man will be as an hiding place from the wind: and a covert from the tempest; as rivers of water in a dry place: as the shadow of a great rock in a weary land.

"the excellency"
De 30:19: 20: I call heaven and earth to record this day against you: that I have set before you life and death: blessing and cursing: therefore choose life: that both you and your seed may live:
De 32:47: For it is not a vain thing for you; because it is your life: and through this thing you will prolong your days in the land: whither you go over Jordan to possess it.
Pr 3:18: She is a tree of life to them that lay hold upon her: and happy is every one that retains her.
Pr 8:35: For whoever finds'>finds me finds'>finds life: and will obtain favour of the LORD.
Pr 9:11: For by me your days will be multiplied: and the years of your life will be increased.
Pr 11:4: Riches not profit in the day of wrath: but righteousness delivers from death.
Joh 12:50: I know that His commandment is life everlasting: whatever I speak therefore: even as the Father said to me: so I speak.
Joh 17:3: This is life eternal: that they might know you the only true God: and Jesus Christ: whom you have sent.
Php 3:8: Yes doubtless: and I count all things but loss for the excellency of the knowledge of Christ Jesus my Lord: for whom I have suffered the loss of all things: and do count them but dung: that I may win Christ:

H7200 רָאָה râʼâh raw-aw a primitive root; to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative); advise self, appear, approve, behold, idiom certainly, consider, discern, (make to) enjoy, have experience, gaze, take heed, idiom indeed, idiom joyfully, lo, look (on, one another, one on another, one upon another, out, up, upon), mark, meet, idiom be near, perceive, present, provide, regard, (have) respect, (fore-, cause to, let) see(-r, -m, one another), shew (self), idiom sight of others, (e-) spy, stare, idiom surely, idiom think, view, visions. 		רְאֵ֖הrə-’êh Consider V-Qal-Imp-ms

H430הָאֱלֹהִ֑יםhā-’ĕ-lō-hîm;   (Art | N-mp)
H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		הָאֱלֹהִ֑יםhā-’ĕ-lō-hîm; of God Art | N-mp
H3588כִּ֣יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî for Conj

H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). 13 Consider the work of God: for who can make that straight, which He has made crooked?Ecclesiastes 7:13
Stats
Rank: #6121 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 85 characters, 14 words, 67 letters, 23 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: רְאֵ֖ה אֶת־מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה הָאֱלֹהִ֑ים כִּ֣י מִ֤י יוּכַל֙ לְתַקֵּ֔ן אֵ֖ת אֲשֶׁ֥ר עִוְּתֹֽו׃

Lit: Consider the work of God for who can make straight what He has made crooked

KJV: Consider the work of God: for who can make that straight, which he hath made crooked?
References

"Consider"
Job 37:14: Listen to this: O Job: stand still: and consider the wondrous works of God.
Ps 8:3: When I consider your heavens: the work of your fingers: the moon and the stars: which you have ordained;
Ps 107:43: Whoever is wise: and will observe these things: even they will understand the lovingkindness of the LORD.
Isa 5:12: The harp: and the viol: the tabret: and pipe: and wine: are in their feasts: but they not regard the work of the LORD: neither consider the operation of His hands.

"who"
Ec 1:15: That which is crooked cannot be made straight: and that which is wanting cannot be numbered.
Job 9:12: Look: he takes away: who can hinder him? who will say to him: What do you?
Job 11:10: If he cut off: and shut up: or gather together: then who can hinder him?
Job 12:14: Look: he breaks down: and it cannot be built again: he shuts up a man: and there can be no opening.
Job 34:29: When he gives quietness: who then can make trouble? and when he hides his face: who then can look him? whether it be done against a nation: or against a man only:
Isa 14:27: For the LORD of hosts has purposed: and who will disannul it? and His hand is stretched out: and who will turn it back?
Isa 43:13: Yes: before the day was I am he; and there is none that can deliver out of my hand: I will work: and who will let it?
Isa 46:10: 11: Declaring the end from the beginning: and from ancient times the things that not are yet done: saying: My counsel will stand: and I will do all my pleasure:
Da 4:35: All the inhabitants of the earth are reputed not ashing: and he does according to his will in the army of heaven: and among the inhabitants of the earth: and none can stay his hand: or say to him: What do you?
Ro 9:15: 19: For he says to Moses: I will have mercy on whom I will have mercy: and I will have compassion on whom I will have compassion.
Eph 1:11: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance: being predestinated according to the purpose of him who works all things after the counsel of his own will:

14 In the day of prosperity be joyful, but in the day of adversity consider: God also has set the one over against the other, to the end that man should not findhing after Him.Ecclesiastes 7:14

Counts: 174 characters, 31 words, 137 letters, 50 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בְּיֹ֤ום טֹובָה֙ הֱיֵ֣ה בְטֹ֔וב וּבְיֹ֥ום רָעָ֖ה רְאֵ֑ה גַּ֣ם אֶת־זֶ֤ה לְעֻמַּת־זֶה֙ עָשָׂ֣ה הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים עַל־דִּבְרַ֗ת שֶׁלֹּ֨א יִמְצָ֧א הָֽאָדָ֛ם אַחֲרָ֖יו מְאֽוּמָה׃

Lit: in the day of prosperity be joyful but in the day of adversity consider surely this one as well as this one has appointed God to the end so that nothing can find out man that will come after him nothing

KJV: In the day of prosperity be joyful, but in the day of adversity consider: God also hath set the one over against the other, to the end that man should find nothing after him.
References

"the day"
Ec 3:4: A time to weep: and a time to laugh; a time to mourn: and a time to dance;
De 28:47: Because you not servedst the LORD your God with joyfulness: and with gladness of heart: for the abundance of all things;
Ps 30:11: 12: You have turned for me my mourning into dancing: you have put off my sackcloth: and girded me with gladness;
Ps 40:3: He has put a new song in my mouth: even praise to our God: many will see it: and fear: and will trust in the LORD.
Mt 9:13: But go you and learn what that means: I will have mercy: not and sacrifice: for I not am come to call the righteous: but sinners to repentance.
Joh 16:22: 23: you now therefore have sorrow: but I will see you again: and your heart will rejoice: and your joy no man takes from you.
Jas 5:13: Is any among you afflicted? let him pray. Is any merry? let him sing psalms.

"but"
De 8:3: He humbled you: and suffered you to hunger: and fed you with manna: which you knew not: neither did your fathers know; that He might make you know that man does not live by bread only: but by every word that proceeds out of the mouth of the LORD does man live.
1Ki 8:47: Yet if they will bethink themselves in the land whither they were carried captives: and repent: and make supplication to you in the land of them that carried them captives: saying: We have sinned: and have done perversely: we have committed wickedness;
1Ki 17:17: 18: It came to pass after these things: that the son of the woman: the mistress of the house: fell sick; and his sickness was so sore: that there was no breath left in him.
2Ch 33:12: 13: When He was in affliction: He besought the LORD His God: and humbled Himself greatly before the God of His fathers:
Job 10:1: 2: My soul is weary of my life; I will leave my complaint upon myself; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
Ps 94:12: 13: Blessed is the man whom you chasten: O LORD: and teach Him out of your law;
Ps 119:71: It is good for me that I have been afflicted; that I might learn your statutes.
Isa 22:12-14: In that day did the Lord GOD of hosts call to weeping: and to mourning: and to baldness: and to girding with sackcloth:
Isa 26:11: LORD: when your hand is lifted up: they not will see: but they will see: and be ashamed for their envy at the people; yes: the fire of your enemies will devour them.
Isa 42:25: Therefore he has poured upon him the fury of his anger: and the strength of battle: and it has set him on fire round about: yet he not knew; and it burned him: yet he laid it not to heart.
Jer 23:20: The anger of the LORD will not return: until He have executed: and till He have performed the thoughts of His heart: in the latter days you will consider it perfectly.
Mic 6:9: The LORD's voice cries to the city: and the man of wisdom will see your name: hear you the rod: and who has appointed it.
Hag 1:5-7: Now therefore thus says the LORD of hosts; Consider your ways.
Lu 15:17: 18: When he came to himself: he said: How many hired servants of my father's have bread enough and to spare: and I perish with hunger!
Ac 14:22: Confirming the souls of the disciples: and exhorting them to continue in the faith: and that we must through much tribulation enter into the kingdom of God.

"set"
Ec 12:8: 13: Vanity of vanities: says the preacher; all is vanity.
Ho 2:6: 7: Therefore: look: I will hedge up your way with thorns: and make a wall: that she will not find her paths.

The Limits of Human Wisdom

אֶת־הַכֹּ֥ל רָאִ֖יתִי בִּימֵ֣י הֶבְלִ֑י יֵ֤שׁ צַדִּיק֙ אֹבֵ֣ד בְּצִדְקֹ֔ו וְיֵ֣שׁ רָשָׁ֔ע מַאֲרִ֖יךְ בְּרָעָתֹֽו׃

15 All things have I seen in the days of my vanity: there is a just man that perishes in his righteousness, and there is a wicked man that prolongs his life in his wickedness.Ecclesiastes 7:15
Stats
Rank: #9024 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 181 characters, 26 words, 139 letters, 50 vowels, 89 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶת־הַכֹּ֥ל רָאִ֖יתִי בִּימֵ֣י הֶבְלִ֑י יֵ֤שׁ צַדִּיק֙ אֹבֵ֣ד בְּצִדְקֹ֔ו וְיֵ֣שׁ רָשָׁ֔ע מַאֲרִ֖יךְ בְּרָעָתֹֽו׃

Lit: Everything I have seen in days of my vanity there is a just man who perishes in his righteousness and there is a wicked man who prolongs life in his wickedness

KJV: All things have I seen in the days of my vanity: there is a just [man] that perisheth in his righteousness, and there is a wicked [man] that prolongeth [his life] in his wickedness.
References

"have I"
Ec 2:23: For all his days are sorrows: and his travail grief; yes: his heart takes not rest in the night. This is also vanity.
Ec 5:16: 17: This also is a sore evil: that in all points as he came: so will he go: and what profit has he who has laboured for the wind?
Ec 6:12: For who knows what is good for man in this life: all the days of his vain life which he spends as a shadow? for who can tell a man what will be after him under the sun?
Ge 47:9: Jacob said to Pharaoh: The days of the years of my pilgrimage are 130 years: few and evil have the days of the years of my life been: and not have attained to the days of the years of the life of my fathers in the days of their pilgrimage.
Ps 39:6: Surely every man walks in a vain show: surely they are disquieted in vain: he heaps up riches: and knows not who will gather them.

"there is a just"
Ec 3:16: Moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment: that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness: that iniquity was there.
Ec 8:14: There is a vanity which is done upon the earth; that there be just men: to whom it happens'>happens according to the work of the wicked; again: there be wicked men: to whom it happens'>happens according to the work of the righteous: I said that this also is vanity.
Ec 9:1: 2: For all this I considered in my heart even to declare all this: that the righteous: and the wise: and their works: are in the hand of God: no man knows either love or hatred by all that is before them.
1Sa 22:18: 19: The king said to Doeg: Turn you: and fall upon the priests. And Doeg the Edomite turned: and he fell upon the priests: and killed on that day fourscore and 5 persons that did wear a linen ephod.
1Ki 21:13: There came in two men: children of Belial: and sat before Him: and the men of Belial witnessed against Him: even against Naboth: in the presence of the people: saying: Naboth did blaspheme God and the king. Then they carried Him forth out of the city: and stoned Him with stones: that He died.
2Ch 24:21: 22: They conspired against Him: and stoned Him with stones at the commandment of the king in the court of the house of the LORD.
Job 9:22: 23: This is one thing: therefore I said it: He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.
Mt 23:34: 35: For what reason: look: I send to you prophets: and wise men: and scribes: and some of them you will kill and crucify; and some of them will you scourge in your synagogues: and persecute them from city to city:
Joh 16:2: They will put you out of the synagogues: yes: the time comes: that whoever kills you will think that He does God service.
Ac 7:52: Which of the prophets not have your fathers persecuted? and they have killed them which showed before of the coming of the Just one; of whom you have been now the betrayers and murderers:

"there is a wicked"
Ec 8:12: 13: Though a sinner do evil 100 times: and His days be prolonged: yet surely I know that it will be well with them that fear God: which fear before Him:
Job 21:7-15: For what reason do the wicked live: become old: yes: are mighty in power?
Ps 73:3-13: For I was envious at the foolish: when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
Isa 65:20: There will be no more there an infant of days: nor an old man that has not filled his days: for the child will die 100 years old; but the sinner being 100 years old will be accursed.
Jer 12:1: 2: Righteous are you: O LORD: when I plead with you: yet let me talk with you of your judgments: For what reason does the way of the wicked prosper? for what reason are all they happy that deal very treacherously?

H4100לָ֖מָּהlām-māh   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		לָ֖מָּהlām-māh why Interrog
H8074תִּשּׁוֹמֵֽם׃tiš-šō-w-mêm.   (V-Hitpael-Imperf-2ms)
H8074 שָׁמֵם shâmêm shaw-mame a primitive root; to stun (or intransitively, grow numb), i.e. devastate or (figuratively) stupefy (both usually in a passive sense); make amazed, be astonied, (be an) astonish(-ment), (be, bring into, unto, lay, lie, make) desolate(-ion, places), be destitute, destroy (self), (lay, lie, make) waste, wonder. 		תִּשּׁוֹמֵֽם׃tiš-šō-w-mêm. should you destroy yourself V-Hitpael-Imperf-2ms
16 not Be righteous over much; neither make yourself over wise: why should you destroy yourself?Ecclesiastes 7:16
Stats
Rank: #9809 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 95 characters, 13 words, 78 letters, 27 vowels, 51 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַל־תְּהִ֤י צַדִּיק֙ הַרְבֵּ֔ה וְאַל־תִּתְחַכַּ֖ם יֹותֵ֑ר לָ֖מָּה תִּשֹּׁומֵֽם׃

Lit: Not do be righteous overly nor be wise overly why should you destroy yourself

KJV: Be not righteous over much; neither make thyself over wise: why shouldest thou destroy thyself?
References

"Be not"
Pr 25:16: Have you found honey? eat so much as is sufficient for you: lest you be filled therewith: and vomit it.
Mt 6:1-7: Take heed that you not do your alms before men: to be seen of them: otherwise you have no reward of your Father which is in heaven.
Mt 9:14: Then came to him the disciples of John: saying: Why do we and the Pharisees fast often: but your disciples not fast?
Mt 15:2-9: Why do your disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they not wash their hands when they eat bread.
Mt 23:5: 23: 24: 29: But all their works they do for to be seen of men: they make broad their phylacteries: and enlarge the borders of their garments:
Lu 18:12: I fast twice in the week: I give tithes of all that I possess.
Ro 10:2: For I bear them record that they have a zeal of God: not but according to knowledge.
Php 3:6: Concerning zeal: persecuting the church; touching the righteousness which is in the law: blameless.
1Ti 4:3: Forbidding to marry: and commanding to abstain from meats: which God has created to be received with thanksgiving of them which believe and know the truth.

"neither"
Ec 12:12: Further: by these: my son: be admonished: of making many books there is no end; and much study is a weariness of the flesh.
Ge 3:6: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food: and that it was pleasant to the eyes: and a tree to be desired to make one wise: she took of the fruit thereof: and did eat: and gave also to her husband with her; and he did eat.
Job 11:12: For vain man would be wise: though man be born like a wild ass's colt.
Job 28:28: to man He said: Look: the fear of the Lord: that is wisdom; and to depart from evil is understanding.
Pr 23:4: not Labour to be rich: cease from your own wisdom.
Ro 11:25: For I not would: brothers: that you should be ignorant of this mystery: lest you should be wise in your own conceits; that blindness in part is happened to Israel: until the fulness of the Gentiles be come in.
Ro 12:3: For I say: through the grace given to me: to every man that is among you: not to think of Himself more highly than He ought to think; but to think soberly: according as God has dealt to every man the measure of faith.
1Co 3:18: 20: Let no man deceive himself. If any man among you seems to be wise in this world: let him become a fool: that he may be wise.
Col 2:18: 23: Let no man beguile you of your reward in a voluntary humility and worshipping of angels: intruding into those things which he has not seen: vainly puffed up by his fleshly mind:
Jas 3:13-17: Who is a wise man and endued with knowledge among you? let him show out of a good conversation his works with meekness of wisdom.

"destroy thyself"
Mt 23:38: Look: your house is left to you desolate.
Re 18:19: They cast dust on their heads: and cried: weeping and wailing: saying: Alas: alas: that great city: wherein were made rich all that had ships in the sea by reason of her costliness! for in one hour is she made desolate.

17 not Be over much wicked, neither be you foolish: why should you die before your time?Ecclesiastes 7:17
Stats
Rank: #9622 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 89 characters, 14 words, 71 letters, 28 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַל־תִּרְשַׁ֥ע הַרְבֵּ֖ה וְאַל־תְּהִ֣י סָכָ֑ל לָ֥מָּה תָמ֖וּת בְּלֹ֥א עִתֶּֽךָ׃

Lit: not do be wicked overly nor be foolish Why should you die before your time

KJV: Be not over much wicked, neither be thou foolish: why shouldest thou die before thy time?
References

"not"
Jer 2:33: 34: Why trimmest you your way to seek love? therefore have you also taught the wicked ones your ways.
Eze 8:17: Then he said to me: Have you seen this: O son of man? Is it a light thing to the house of Judah that they commit the abominations which they commit here? for they have filled the land with violence: and have returned to provoke me to anger: and: indeed: they put the branch to their nose.
Eze 16:20: Moreover you have taken your sons and your daughters: whom you have borne to me: and these have you sacrificed to them to be devoured. Is this of your whoredoms a small matter:
Jas 1:21: For what reason lay apart all filthiness and superfluity of naughtiness: and receive with meekness the engrafted word: which is able to save your souls.

"why"
Ge 38:7-10: Er: Judah's firstborn: was wicked in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD killed Him.
1Sa 25:38: It came to pass about 10 days after: that the LORD smote Nabal: that He died.
Job 15:32: 33: It will be accomplished before his time: and his branch will not be green.
Ps 55:23: But you: O God: will bring them down into the pit of destruction: bloody and deceitful men will not live out half their days; but I will trust in you.
Pr 10:27: The fear of the LORD prolongs days: but the years of the wicked will be shortened.
Ac 5:5: 10: Ananias hearing these words fell down: and gave up the ghost: and great fear came on all them that heard these things.
Ac 12:23: Immediately the angel of the Lord smote Him: because He not gave God the glory: and He was eaten of worms: and gave up the ghost.

Translation

Lit: it is good that you grasp this and also from this one not remove your hand for he who fears God will escape with them all

KJV: It is good that thou shouldest take hold of this; yea, also from this withdraw not thine hand: for he that feareth God shall come forth of them all.

19 Wisdom strengthens the wise more than 10 mighty men which are in the city.Ecclesiastes 7:19
Stats
Rank: #7742 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 77 characters, 14 words, 63 letters, 20 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: הַֽחָכְמָ֖ה תָּעֹ֣ז לֶחָכָ֑ם מֵֽעֲשָׂרָה֙ שַׁלִּיטִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר הָי֖וּ בָּעִֽיר׃

Lit: Wisdom strengthens the wise More than ten rulers that are of the city

KJV: Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty men which are in the city.
References

"Wisdom strengtheneth the wise more than ten mighty men which are in the city."
Ec 9:15-18: Now there was found in it a poor wise man: and he by his wisdom delivered the city; yet no man remembered that same poor man.
2Sa 20:16-22: Then cried a wise woman out of the city: Hear: hear; say: I pray you: to Joab: Come near here: that I may speak with you.
Pr 21:22: A wise man scaleth the city of the mighty: and casts down the strength of the confidence thereof.
Pr 24:5: A wise man is strong; yes: a man of knowledge increases strength.
Col 1:9-11: For this cause we also: since the day we heard it: not do cease to pray for you: and to desire that you might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;

H3588כִּ֣יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî For Conj

H369אֵ֥ין’ên   (Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer who Pro-r

H2398יֶחֱטָֽא׃ye-ḥĕ-ṭā.   (V-Qal-Imperf-3ms)
H2398 חָטָא châṭâʼ khaw-taw a primitive root; properly, to miss; hence (figuratively and generally) to sin; by inference, to forfeit, lack, expiate, repent, (causatively) lead astray, condemn; bear the blame, cleanse, commit (sin), by fault, harm he hath done, loss, miss, (make) offend(-er), offer for sin, purge, purify (self), make reconciliation, (cause, make) sin(-ful, -ness), trespass. 		יֶחֱטָֽא׃ye-ḥĕ-ṭā. does sin V-Qal-Imperf-3ms
20 For there is not a just man upon earth, that does good, and sins not.Ecclesiastes 7:20
Stats
Counts: 73 characters, 13 words, 56 letters, 21 vowels, 35 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֣י אָדָ֔ם אֵ֥ין צַדִּ֖יק בָּאָ֑רֶץ אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲשֶׂה־טֹּ֖וב וְלֹ֥א יֶחֱטָֽא׃

Lit: For a man there is not just on earth who does good and not does sin

KJV: For there is not a just man upon earth, that doeth good, and sinneth not.
References

"there"

2Ch 6:36: If they sin against you: (for there is no man which sins not: ) and you be angry with them: and deliver them over before their enemies: and they carry them away captives to a land far off or near;
Job 15:14-16: What is man: that he should be clean? and he which is born of a woman: that he should be righteous?
Ps 130:3: If you: LORD: should mark iniquities: O Lord: who will stand?
Ps 143:2: not enter into judgment with your servant: for in your sight will no man living be justified.
Pr 20:9: Who can say: I have made my heart clean: I am pure from my sin?
Isa 53:6: All we like sheep have gone astray; we have turned every one to His own way; and the LORD has laid on Him the iniquity of us all.
Ro 3:23: For all have sinned: and come short of the glory of God;
Jas 3:2: For in many things we offend all. If any man not offend in word: the same is a perfect man: and able also to bridle the whole body.
1Jo 1:8-10: If we say that we have no sin: we deceive ourselves: and the truth not is in us.

"doeth"
Isa 64:6: But we are all as an unclean thing: and all our righteousnesses are as filthy rags; and we all do fade as a leaf; and our iniquities: like the wind: have taken us away.

Translation
Hebrew: גַּ֤ם לְכָל־הַדְּבָרִים֙ אֲשֶׁ֣ר יְדַבֵּ֔רוּ אַל־תִּתֵּ֖ן לִבֶּ֑ךָ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־תִשְׁמַ֥ע אֶֽת־עַבְדְּךָ֖ מְקַלְלֶֽךָ׃

Lit: Also everything words that people say not do take to heart lest lest you hear your servant cursing you

KJV: Also take no heed unto all words that are spoken; lest thou hear thy servant curse thee:

H1571 גַּם gam gam by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and; again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea. 		גַּם־gam- even Conj

25 I applied my heart to know, and to search, and to seek out wisdom, and the reason of things, and to know the wickedness of folly, even of foolishness and madness:Ecclesiastes 7:25
Stats
Counts: 166 characters, 24 words, 128 letters, 48 vowels, 80 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: סַבֹּ֨ותִֽי אֲנִ֤י וְלִבִּי֙ לָדַ֣עַת וְלָת֔וּר וּבַקֵּ֥שׁ חָכְמָ֖ה וְחֶשְׁבֹּ֑ון וְלָדַ֙עַת֙ רֶ֣שַׁע כֶּ֔סֶל וְהַסִּכְל֖וּת הֹולֵלֹֽות׃

Lit: applied I and my heart to know and to search and seek out wisdom and the reason of things and to know the wickedness of folly and Even of foolishness and madness

KJV: I applied mine heart to know, and to search, and to seek out wisdom, and the reason of things, and to know the wickedness of folly, even of foolishness [and] madness:
References

"I applied mine heart"
Ec 1:13-17: I gave my heart to seek and search out by wisdom concerning all things that are done under heaven: this sore travail has God given to the sons of man to be exercised therewith.
Ec 2:1-3: 12: 20: I said in my heart: Go to now: I will prove you with mirth: therefore enjoy pleasure: and: look: this also is vanity.

"the reason"
Ec 7:27: Look: this have I found: says the preacher: counting one by one: to find out the account:
Ec 2:15: Then said I in my heart: As it happens'>happens to the fool: so it happens'>happens even to me; and why was I then more wise? Then I said in my heart: that this also is vanity.
Ec 3:16: 17: Moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment: that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness: that iniquity was there.
Ec 9:1: 2: For all this I considered in my heart even to declare all this: that the righteous: and the wise: and their works: are in the hand of God: no man knows either love or hatred by all that is before them.
Jer 12:1: 2: Righteous are you: O LORD: when I plead with you: yet let me talk with you of your judgments: For what reason does the way of the wicked prosper? for what reason are all they happy that deal very treacherously?
2Pe 2:3-9: Through covetousness will they with feigned words make merchandise of you: whose judgment now of a long time lingereth not: and their damnation slumbers not.
2Pe 3:3-9: Knowing this first: that there will come in the last days scoffers: walking after their own lusts:

"know"
Ec 9:3: This is an evil among all things that are done under the sun: that there is one event to all: yes: also the heart of the sons of men is full of evil: and madness is in their heart while they live: and after that they go to the dead.
Ec 10:13: The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness: and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.
Ge 34:7: The sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved: and they were very angry: because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob's daughter; which thing not ought to be done.
Jos 7:13: Up: sanctify the people: and say: Sanctify yourselves against to morrow: for thus says the LORD God of Israel: There is an accursed thing in the middle of you: O Israel: you not canst stand before your enemies: until you take away the accursed thing from among you.
2Sa 13:12: She answered him: No: my brother: not do force me; for no such thing ought to be done in Israel: not do you this folly.
Pr 17:12: Let a bear robbed of her whelps meet a man: rather than a fool in his folly.
Pr 26:11: As a dog returns'>returns to his vomit: so a fool returns'>returns to his folly.

H834אֲשֶׁר־’ă-šer-   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). Hבָּֽהּ׃bāh.   (Prep | 3fs)
 		בָּֽהּ׃bāh. by her Prep | 3fs
26 I find more bitter than death the woman, whose heart is snares and nets, and her hands as bands: whoever pleases God will escape from her; but the sinner will be taken by her.Ecclesiastes 7:26
Stats
Rank: #8119 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 184 characters, 28 words, 141 letters, 48 vowels, 93 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמֹוצֶ֨א אֲנִ֜י מַ֣ר מִמָּ֗וֶת אֶת־הָֽאִשָּׁה֙ אֲשֶׁר־הִ֨יא מְצֹודִ֧ים וַחֲרָמִ֛ים לִבָּ֖הּ אֲסוּרִ֣ים יָדֶ֑יהָ טֹ֞וב לִפְנֵ֤י הָאֱלֹהִים֙ יִמָּלֵ֣ט מִמֶּ֔נָּה וְחֹוטֵ֖א יִלָּ֥כֶד בָּֽהּ׃

Lit: And find I more bitter than death the woman whose is snares and nets heart are bonds Whose hands He who pleases God shall escape from her but the sinner shall be trapped by her

KJV: And I find more bitter than death the woman, whose heart is snares and nets, [and] her hands [as] bands: whoso pleaseth God shall escape from her; but the sinner shall be taken by her.
References

"I find"
Jg 16:18-21: When Delilah saw that he had told her all his heart: she sent and called for the lords of the Philistines: saying: Come up this once: for he has showed me all his heart. Then the lords of the Philistines came up to her: and brought money in their hand.
Pr 2:18: 19: For her house inclines to death: and her paths to the dead.
Pr 5:3-5: For the lips of a strange woman drop as an honeycomb: and her mouth is smoother than oil:
Pr 7:21-27: With her much fair speech she caused him to yield: with the flattering of her lips she forced him.
Pr 9:18: But he knows not that the dead are there; and that her guests are in the depths of hell.
Pr 22:14: The mouth of strange women is a deep pit: He that'>He who is abhorred of the LORD will fall therein.
Pr 23:27: 28: For a whore is a deep ditch; and a strange woman is a narrow pit.

"whoso pleaseth God"
Ec 2:26: For God gives'>gives to a man that is good in His sight wisdom: and knowledge: and joy: but to the sinner He gives'>gives travail: to gather and to heap up: that He may give to Him that is good before God. This also is vanity and vexation of spirit.

27 Look, this have I found, says the preacher, counting one by one, to find out the account:Ecclesiastes 7:27
Stats

Translation
Hebrew: רְאֵה֙ זֶ֣ה מָצָ֔אתִי אָמְרָ֖ה קֹהֶ֑לֶת אַחַ֥ת לְאַחַ֖ת לִמְצֹ֥א חֶשְׁבֹּֽון׃

Lit: Here is this that I have found says the Teacher Adding one [thing] to the other one to find out the reason

KJV: Behold, this have I found, saith the preacher, counting one by one, to find out the account:

I have found V-Qal-Perf-1cs
28 Which yet my soul seeks, but I not find: one man among a000 have I found; but a woman among all those have not I found.Ecclesiastes 7:28
Stats
Counts: 127 characters, 24 words, 97 letters, 40 vowels, 57 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֲשֶׁ֛ר עֹוד־בִּקְשָׁ֥ה נַפְשִׁ֖י וְלֹ֣א מָצָ֑אתִי אָדָ֞ם אֶחָ֤ד מֵאֶ֙לֶף֙ מָצָ֔אתִי וְאִשָּׁ֥ה בְכָל־אֵ֖לֶּה לֹ֥א מָצָֽאתִי׃

Lit: which still seeks my soul but cannot I find man one among a thousand I have found but a woman among all these not I have found

KJV: Which yet my soul seeketh, but I find not: one man among a thousand have I found; but a woman among all those have I not found.
References

"yet"
Ec 7:23: 24: All this have I proved by wisdom: I said: I will be wise; but it was far from me.
Isa 26:9: With my soul have I desired you in the night; yes: with my spirit within me will I seek you early: for when your judgments are in the earth: the inhabitants of the world will learn righteousness.

"one"
Job 33:23: If there be a messenger with him: an interpreter: one among a000: to show to man his uprightness:
Ps 12:1: A Psalm of David.>> Help: LORD; for the godly man ceases; for the faithful fail from among the children of men.

"but"
1Ki 11:1-3: But king Solomon loved many strange women: together with the daughter of Pharaoh: women of the Moabites: Ammonites: Edomites: Zidonians: and Hittites;

29 Indeed, this only have I found, that God has made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions.Ecclesiastes 7:29
Stats
Counts: 101 characters, 16 words, 79 letters, 29 vowels, 50 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לְבַד֙ רְאֵה־זֶ֣ה מָצָ֔אתִי אֲשֶׁ֨ר עָשָׂ֧ה הָאֱלֹהִ֛ים אֶת־הָאָדָ֖ם יָשָׁ֑ר וְהֵ֥מָּה בִקְשׁ֖וּ חִשְּׁבֹנֹ֥ות רַבִּֽים׃

Lit: Only Truly this I have found that made God man upright but they have sought out schemes many

KJV: Lo, this only have I found, that God hath made man upright; but they have sought out many inventions.
References

"God"

Ge 5:1: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man: in the likeness of God made He Him;

"they"
Ge 3:6: 7: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food: and that it was pleasant to the eyes: and a tree to be desired to make one wise: she took of the fruit thereof: and did eat: and gave also to her husband with her; and he did eat.
Ge 6:5: 6: 11: 12: GOD saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth: and that every imagination of the thoughts of his heart was only evil continually.
Ge 11:4-6: They said: Go to: let us build us a city and a tower: whose top may reach to heaven; and let us make us a name: lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.
Ps 99:8: You answeredst them: O LORD our God: you were a God that forgave them: though you took vengeance of their inventions.
Ps 106:29: 39: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.
Jer 2:12: 13: Be astonished: O you heavens: at this: and be horribly afraid: be you very desolate: says the LORD.
Jer 4:22: For my people is foolish: they not have known me; they are sottish children: and they have none understanding: they are wise to do evil: but to do good they have no knowledge.
Eze 22:6-13: Look: the princes of Israel: every one were in you to their power to shed blood.
Mr 7:8: 9: For laying aside the commandment of God: you hold the tradition of men: as the washing of pots and cups: and many other such like things you do.
Ac 7:40-43: Saying to Aaron: Make us gods to go before us: for as for this Moses: which brought us out of the land of Egypt: we know not what is become of him.
Ro 1:21-32: Because that: when they knew God: they glorified Him not as God: neither were thankful; but became vain in their imaginations: and their foolish heart was darkened.
Ro 3:9-19: What then? are we better than they? No: in no wise: for we have before proved both Jews and Gentiles: that they are all under sin;

Tit 3:3: For we ourselves also were sometimes foolish: disobedient: deceived: serving divers lusts and pleasures: living in malice and envy: hateful: and hating one another.

The Wise Man and the King

H6440פָּנָ֔יוpā-nāw,   (N-cpc | 3ms)

H8132יְשֻׁנֶּֽא׃yə-šun-ne.   (V-Pual-Imperf-3ms)
H8132 שָׁנָא shânâʼ shaw-naw a primitive root; to alter; change. 		יְשֻׁנֶּֽא׃yə-šun-ne. is changed V-Pual-Imperf-3ms
1 Who is as the wise man? and who knows the interpretation of a thing? a man's wisdom makes his face to shine, and the boldness of his face will be changed.Ecclesiastes 8:1
Stats
Counts: 160 characters, 27 words, 123 letters, 45 vowels, 78 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מִ֚י כְּהֶ֣חָכָ֔ם וּמִ֥י יֹודֵ֖עַ פֵּ֣שֶׁר דָּבָ֑ר חָכְמַ֤ת אָדָם֙ תָּאִ֣יר פָּנָ֔יו וְעֹ֥ז פָּנָ֖יו יְשֻׁנֶּֽא׃

Lit: Who is like a wise man and who knows the interpretation of a thing wisdom of a man makes shine his face and the sternness of his face is changed

KJV: Who is as the wise [man]? and who knoweth the interpretation of a thing? a man's wisdom maketh his face to shine, and the boldness of his face shall be changed.
References

"Who is as the wise man? and who knoweth the interpretation of a thing? a man's wisdom maketh his face to shine, and the boldness of his face shall be changed."
Ec 2:13: 14: Then I saw that wisdom excels'>excels folly: as far as light excels'>excels darkness.
1Co 2:13-16: Which things also we speak: not in the words which man's wisdom teaches'>teaches: but which the Holy Ghost teaches'>teaches; comparing spiritual things with spiritual.

"who knoweth"
Ge 40:8: They said to Him: We have dreamed a dream: and there is no interpreter of it. And Joseph said to them: Do not interpretations belong to God? tell me them: I pray you.
Ge 41:15: 16: 38: 39: Pharaoh said to Joseph: I have dreamed a dream: and there is none that can interpret it: and I have heard say of you: that you canst understand a dream to interpret it.
Job 33:23: If there be a messenger with him: an interpreter: one among a000: to show to man his uprightness:
Pr 1:6: To understand a proverb: and the interpretation; the words of the wise: and their dark sayings.
Da 2:28-30: 47: But there is a God in heaven that reveals secrets: and makes known to the king Nebuchadnezzar what will be in the latter days. Your dream: and the visions of your head upon your bed: are these;
Da 4:18: 19: This dream I king Nebuchadnezzar have seen. Now you: O Belteshazzar: declare the interpretation thereof: forasmuch as all the wise men of my kingdom not are able to make known to me the interpretation: but you are able; for the spirit of the holy gods is in you.
2Pe 1:20: Knowing this first: that no prophecy of the scripture is of any private interpretation.

"a man's"
Ex 34:29: 30: It came to pass: when Moses came down from mount Sinai with the two tables of testimony in Moses' hand: when he came down from the mount: that Moses not wist that the skin of his face shone while he talked with him.
Pr 4:8: 9: Exalt her: and she will promote you: she will bring you to honour: when you do embrace her.
Pr 17:24: Wisdom is before him that has understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
Pr 24:5: A wise man is strong; yes: a man of knowledge increases strength.
Mt 17:2: Was transfigured before them: and his face did shine as the sun: and his clothing was white as the light.
Ac 6:15: All that sat in the council: looking stedfastly on him: saw his face as it had been the face of an angel.

"and the"
De 28:50: A nation of fierce face: which will not regard the person of the old: nor show favour to the young:
Ac 4:13: 29: Now when they saw the boldness of Peter and John: and perceived that they were unlearned and ignorant men: they marvelled; and they took knowledge of them: that they had been with Jesus.
Eph 6:19: For me: that utterance may be given to me: that I may open my mouth boldly: to make known the mystery of the gospel:

"boldness"
2Ti 4:17: Notwithstanding the Lord stood with me: and strengthened me; that by me the preaching might be fully known: and that all the Gentiles might hear: and I was delivered out of the mouth of the lion.

 אֲנִי֙ פִּי־מֶ֣לֶךְ שְׁמֹ֔ור וְעַ֕ל דִּבְרַ֖ת שְׁבוּעַ֥ת אֱלֹהִֽים׃

H430אֱלֹהִֽים׃’ĕ-lō-hîm.   (N-mp)
H430 אֱלֹהִים ʼĕlôhîym el-o-heem plural of אֱלוֹהַּ; gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative; angels, idiom exceeding, God (gods) (-dess, -ly), idiom (very) great, judges, idiom mighty. 		אֱלֹהִֽים׃’ĕ-lō-hîm. God N-mp
2 I counsel you to keep the king's commandment, and that in regard of the oath of God.Ecclesiastes 8:2
Stats
Counts: 87 characters, 14 words, 66 letters, 25 vowels, 41 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֲנִי֙ פִּי־מֶ֣לֶךְ שְׁמֹ֔ור וְעַ֕ל דִּבְרַ֖ת שְׁבוּעַ֥ת אֱלֹהִֽים׃

Lit: I say commandment of the king Keep for the sake of your oath to God

KJV: I counsel thee to keep the king's commandment, and [that] in regard of the oath of God.
References

"I counsel"
Pr 24:21: My son: fear you the LORD and the king: and not meddle with them that are given to change:
Ro 13:1-4: Let every soul be subject to the higher powers. For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.
Tit 3:1: Put them in mind to be subject to principalities and powers: to obey magistrates: to be ready to every good work:
1Pe 2:13-17: Submit yourselves to every ordinance of man for the Lord's sake: whether it be to the king: as supreme;

"in regard"
1Ki 2:43: Why then have you not kept the oath of the LORD: and the commandment that I have charged you with?
1Ch 29:24: All the princes: and the mighty men: and all the sons likewise of king David: submitted themselves to Solomon the king.
Eze 17:13-20: has taken of the king's seed: and made a covenant with him: and has taken an oath of him: he has also taken the mighty of the land:
Ro 13:5: For what reason you must needs be subject: not only for wrath: but also for conscience sake.

H3605כָּל־kāl-   (N-msc)

H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer whatever Pro-r

3 not Be hasty to go out of his sight: not stand in an evil thing; for he does whatever pleases him.Ecclesiastes 8:3
Stats
Counts: 102 characters, 19 words, 79 letters, 29 vowels, 50 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַל־תִּבָּהֵ֤ל מִפָּנָיו֙ תֵּלֵ֔ךְ אַֽל־תַּעֲמֹ֖ד בְּדָבָ֣ר רָ֑ע כִּ֛י כָּל־אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַחְפֹּ֖ץ יַעֲשֶֽׂה׃

Lit: Not do be hasty from his presence to go not do take your stand for an thing evil for all whatever pleases him he does

KJV: Be not hasty to go out of his sight: stand not in an evil thing; for he doeth whatsoever pleaseth him.
References

"not hasty"
Ec 10:4: If the spirit of the ruler rise up against you: not leave your place; for yielding pacifies great offences.
Pr 14:29: He who is slow to wrath is of great understanding: but he who is hasty of spirit exalts folly.

"stand"
1Ki 1:50-52: Adonijah feared because of Solomon: and arose: and went: and caught hold on the horns of the altar.
1Ki 2:21-24: She said: Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah your brother to wife.
Isa 48:4: Because I knew that you are obstinate: and your neck is an iron sinew: and your brow brass;
Jer 44:16: 17: As for the word that you have spoken to us in the name of the LORD: we not will listen to you.
Ac 5:8: 9: Peter answered to her: Tell me whether you sold the land for so much? And she said: Yes: for so much.

"for"
Pr 16:14: 15: The wrath of a king is as messengers of death: but a wise man will pacify it.
Pr 30:31: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king: against whom there is no rising up.
Da 4:35: All the inhabitants of the earth are reputed not ashing: and he does according to his will in the army of heaven: and among the inhabitants of the earth: and none can stay his hand: or say to him: What do you?
Da 5:19: For the majesty that he gave him: all people: nations: and languages: trembled and feared before him: whom he would he killed; and whom he would he kept alive; and whom he would he set up; and whom he would he put down.

 בַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דְּבַר־מֶ֖לֶךְ שִׁלְטֹ֑ון וּמִ֥י יֹֽאמַר־לֹ֖ו מַֽה־תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H834בַּאֲשֶׁ֥רba-’ă-šer   (Prep-b | Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		בַּאֲשֶׁ֥רba-’ă-šer Where Prep-b | Pro-r

H4100מַֽה־mah-   (Interrog)
H4100 מָה mâh maw or מַה; or מָ; or מַ; also מֶה; a primitive particle; properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses; how (long, oft, (-soever)), (no-) thing, what (end, good, purpose, thing), whereby(-fore, -in, -to, -with), (for) why., 		מַֽה־mah- what Interrog

4 Where the word of a king is, there is power: and who may say to him, What do you?Ecclesiastes 8:4
Stats
Counts: 87 characters, 16 words, 65 letters, 25 vowels, 40 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּאֲשֶׁ֥ר דְּבַר־מֶ֖לֶךְ שִׁלְטֹ֑ון וּמִ֥י יֹֽאמַר־לֹ֖ו מַֽה־תַּעֲשֶֽׂה׃

Lit: Where the word of a king is there is power and who may say to him what are you doing

KJV: Where the word of a king is, there is power: and who may say unto him, What doest thou?
References

"the word"
1Ki 2:25: 29-34: 46: King Solomon sent by the hand of Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell upon him that he died.
Pr 19:12: The king's wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favour is as dew upon the grass.
Pr 20:2: The fear of a king is as the roaring of a lion: whoever provokes him to anger sins against his own soul.
Pr 30:31: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king: against whom there is no rising up.
Da 3:15: Now if you be ready that at what time you hear the sound of the cornet: flute: harp: sackbut: psaltery: and dulcimer: and all kinds of musick: you fall down and worship the image which I have made; well: but if you not worship: you will be cast the same hour into the middle of a burning fiery furnace; and who is that God that will deliver you out of my hands?
Lu 12:4: 5: I say to you my friends: not Be afraid of them that kill the body: and after that have no more that they can do.
Ro 13:1-4: Let every soul be subject to the higher powers. For there is no power but of God: the powers that be are ordained of God.

"What"
Job 33:12: 13: Look: in this you are not just: I will answer you: that God is greater than man.
Job 34:18: 19: Is it fit to say to a king: You are wicked? and to princes: You are ungodly?
Ro 9:20: No but: O man: who are you that repliest against God? Will the thing formed say to Him that formed it: Why have you made me thus?

5 Whoever keeps the commandment will feel no evil thing: and a wise man's heart discerns both time and judgment.Ecclesiastes 8:5
Stats
Counts: 113 characters, 18 words, 92 letters, 32 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שֹׁומֵ֣ר מִצְוָ֔ה לֹ֥א יֵדַ֖ע דָּבָ֣ר רָ֑ע וְעֵ֣ת וּמִשְׁפָּ֔ט יֵדַ֖ע לֵ֥ב חָכָֽם׃

Lit: He who keeps his command nothing will experience thing harmful and both time and judgment And discerns heart of a wise man

KJV: Whoso keepeth the commandment shall feel no evil thing: and a wise man's heart discerneth both time and judgment.
References

"keepeth"
Ec 8:2: I counsel you to keep the king's commandment: and that in regard of the oath of God.
Ex 1:17: 20: 21: But the midwives feared God: and not did as the king of Egypt commanded them: but saved the men children alive.
Ps 119:6: Then will not I be ashamed: when I have respect to all your commandments.
Ho 5:11: Ephraim is oppressed and broken in judgment: because he willingly walked after the commandment.
Lu 20:25: He said to them: Render therefore to Caesar the things which be Caesar's: and to God the things which be God's.
Ac 4:19: But Peter and John answered and said to them: Whether it be right in the sight of God to listen to you more than to God: judge you.
Ac 5:29: Then Peter and the other apostles answered and said: We ought to obey God rather than men.
Ro 13:5-7: For what reason you must needs be subject: not only for wrath: but also for conscience sake.
1Pe 3:13: 14: Who is he who will harm you: if you be followers of that which is good?

"a wise"
Ec 2:14: The wise man's eyes are in his head; but the fool walks in darkness: and I myself perceived also that one event happens to them all.
Ec 10:2: A wise man's heart is at his right hand; but a fool's heart at his left.
1Ch 12:32: Of the children of Issachar: which were men that had understanding of the times: to know what Israel ought to do; the heads of them were 200; and all their brothers were at their commandment.
Pr 17:24: Wisdom is before him that has understanding; but the eyes of a fool are in the ends of the earth.
Lu 12:56: 57: You hypocrites: you can discern the face of the sky and of the earth; but how is it that you not do discern this time?
1Co 2:14: 15: But the natural man receives not the things of the Spirit of God: for they are foolishness to Him: neither can He know them: because they are spiritually discerned.
Php 1:9: 10: This I pray: that your love may abound yet more and more in knowledge and in all judgment;
Col 1:9: For this cause we also: since the day we heard it: not do cease to pray for you: and to desire that you might be filled with the knowledge of his will in all wisdom and spiritual understanding;
Heb 5:14: But strong meat belongs to them that are of full age: even those who by reason of use have their senses exercised to discern both good and evil.

 כִּ֣י לְכָל־חֵ֔פֶץ יֵ֖שׁ עֵ֣ת וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט כִּֽי־רָעַ֥ת הָאָדָ֖ם רַבָּ֥ה עָלָֽיו׃

H3588כִּ֣יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî Because Conj

H5921עָלָֽיו׃‘ā-lāw.   (Prep | 3ms)

6 Because to every purpose there is time and judgment, therefore the misery of man is great upon him.Ecclesiastes 8:6
Stats
Counts: 99 characters, 17 words, 80 letters, 33 vowels, 47 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֣י לְכָל־חֵ֔פֶץ יֵ֖שׁ עֵ֣ת וּמִשְׁפָּ֑ט כִּֽי־רָעַ֥ת הָאָדָ֖ם רַבָּ֥ה עָלָֽיו׃

Lit: Because for every matter there is a time and judgment Though the misery of man increases greatly on

KJV: Because to every purpose there is time and judgment, therefore the misery of man is great upon him.
References

"to every"
Ec 3:1: 11: 17: To every thing there is a season: and a time to every purpose under the heaven:
Ec 7:13: 14: Consider the work of God: for who can make that straight: which He has made crooked?

"therefore"
Ec 11:9: 10: Rejoice: O young man: in your youth; and let your heart cheer you in the days of your youth: and walk in the ways of your heart: and in the sight of your eyes: but know you: that for all these things God will bring you into judgment.
Ec 12:1: Remember now your Creator in the days of your youth: while the evil days not come: nor the years draw nigh: when you will say: I have no pleasure in them;
Isa 3:11-14: Woe to the wicked! it will be ill with him: for the reward of his hands will be given him.
Isa 22:12-14: In that day did the Lord GOD of hosts call to weeping: and to mourning: and to baldness: and to girding with sackcloth:
Lu 13:25: When once the master of the house is risen up: and has shut to the door: and you begin to stand without: and to knock at the door: saying: Lord: Lord: open to us; and He will answer and say to you: I know you not where you are:
Lu 17:26-30: As it was in the days of Noe: so will it be also in the days of the Son of man.
Lu 19:42-44: Saying: If you hadst known: even you: at least in this your day: the things which belong to your peace! but now they are hid from your eyes.
Heb 3:7-11: For what reason (as the Holy Ghost says: Today if you will hear His voice:

7 For he knows not that which will be: for who can tell him when it will be?Ecclesiastes 8:7
Stats
Counts: 78 characters, 16 words, 60 letters, 18 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּֽי־אֵינֶ֥נּוּ יֹדֵ֖עַ מַה־שֶּׁיִּֽהְיֶ֑ה כִּ֚י כַּאֲשֶׁ֣ר יִֽהְיֶ֔ה מִ֖י יַגִּ֥יד לֹֽו׃

Lit: For not he does know what will happen so when it will occur who can tell him

KJV: For he knoweth not that which shall be: for who can tell him when it shall be?
References

"he knoweth"
Ec 6:12: For who knows what is good for man in this life: all the days of his vain life which he spends as a shadow? for who can tell a man what will be after him under the sun?
Ec 9:12: For man also knows not his time: as the fishes that are taken in an evil net: and as the birds that are caught in the snare; so are the sons of men snared in an evil time: when it falls suddenly upon them.
Ec 10:14: A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what will be; and what will be after him: who can tell him?
Pr 24:22: For their calamity will rise suddenly; and who knows the ruin of them both?
Pr 29:1: He: that being often reproved hardens his neck: will suddenly be destroyed: and that without remedy.
Mt 24:44: 50: Therefore be you also ready: for in such an hour as you not think the Son of man comes.
Mt 25:6-13: At midnight there was a cry made: Look: the groom comes; go you out to meet him.
1Th 5:1-3: But of the times and the seasons: brothers: you have no need that I write to you.

H3605כָּל־kāl-   (N-msc)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כָּל־kāl- all N-msc
8 There is no man that has power over the spirit to retain the spirit; neither has he power in the day of death: and there is no discharge in that war; neither will wickedness deliver those that are given to it.Ecclesiastes 8:8
Stats
Counts: 218 characters, 32 words, 168 letters, 64 vowels, 104 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֵ֣ין אָדָ֞ם שַׁלִּ֤יט בָּר֙וּחַ֙ לִכְלֹ֣וא אֶת־הָר֔וּחַ וְאֵ֤ין שִׁלְטֹון֙ בְּיֹ֣ום הַמָּ֔וֶת וְאֵ֥ין מִשְׁלַ֖חַת בַּמִּלְחָמָ֑ה וְלֹֽא־יְמַלֵּ֥ט רֶ֖שַׁע אֶת־בְּעָלָֽיו׃

Lit: No one has power over the spirit to retain the spirit and no one has power in the day of death and There is no release from that war and not will deliver wickedness those who are given to it This all

KJV: There is no man that hath power over the spirit to retain the spirit; neither [hath he] power in the day of death: and [there is] no discharge in [that] war; neither shall wickedness deliver those that are given to it.
References

"is no"
Ec 3:21: Who knows the spirit of man that goes'>goes upward: and the spirit of the beast that goes'>goes downward to the earth?
2Sa 14:14: For we must needs die: and are as water spilt on the ground: which cannot be gathered up again; neither does God respect any person: yet does He devise means: that His banished not be expelled from Him.
Job 14:5: Seeing his days are determined: the number of his months are with you: you have appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;
Job 34:14: If he set his heart upon man: if he gather to himself his spirit and his breath;
Ps 49:6-9: They that trust in their wealth: and boast themselves in the multitude of their riches;
Ps 89:48: What man is he who lives: and will not see death? will he deliver his soul from the hand of the grave? Selah.
Heb 9:27: As it is appointed to men once to die: but after this the judgment:

"power"
1Co 15:43: It is sown in dishonour; it is raised in glory: it is sown in weakness; it is raised in power:
2Co 13:4: For though He was crucified through weakness: yet He lives by the power of God. For we also are weak in Him: but we will live with Him by the power of God toward you.

"discharge"
De 20:1-8: When you go out to battle against your enemies: and see horses: and chariots: and a people more than you: not be afraid of them: for the LORD your God is with you: which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.
2Ki 7:15: They went after them to Jordan: and: indeed: all the way was full of garments and vessels: which the Syrians had cast away in their haste. And the messengers returned: and told the king.

"neither"
Ps 9:17: The wicked will be turned into hell: and all the nations that forget God.
Ps 52:5-7: God will likewise destroy you for ever: He will take you away: and pluck you out of your dwelling place: and root you out of the land of the living. Selah.
Ps 73:18-28: Surely you did set them in slippery places: you castedst them down into destruction.
Pr 14:32: The wicked is driven away in his wickedness: but the righteous has hope in his death.
Isa 28:15: 18: Because you have said: We have made a covenant with death: and with hell are we at agreement; when the overflowing scourge will pass through: it will not come to us: for we have made lies our refuge: and under falsehood have we hid ourselves:

 אֶת־כָּל־זֶ֤ה רָאִ֙יתִי֙ וְנָתֹ֣ון אֶת־לִבִּ֔י לְכָֽל־מַעֲשֶׂ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נַעֲשָׂ֖ה תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ עֵ֗ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר שָׁלַ֧ט הָאָדָ֛ם בְּאָדָ֖ם לְרַ֥ע לֹֽו׃

Hלֽוֹ׃lōw.   (Prep | 3ms)
 		לֽוֹ׃lōw. his own Prep | 3ms
9 All this have I seen, and applied my heart to every work that is done under the sun: there is a time wherein one man rules over another to his own hurt.Ecclesiastes 8:9
Stats
Rank: #4199 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 155 characters, 30 words, 121 letters, 49 vowels, 72 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אֶת־כָּל־זֶ֤ה רָאִ֙יתִי֙ וְנָתֹ֣ון אֶת־לִבִּ֔י לְכָֽל־מַעֲשֶׂ֔ה אֲשֶׁ֥ר נַעֲשָׂ֖ה תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ עֵ֗ת אֲשֶׁ֨ר שָׁלַ֧ט הָאָדָ֛ם בְּאָדָ֖ם לְרַ֥ע לֹֽו׃

Lit: and this I have seen and applied to every my heart to every work that is done under the sun There is a time in which rules one man over another To hurt his own

KJV: All this have I seen, and applied my heart unto every work that is done under the sun: there is a time wherein one man ruleth over another to his own hurt.
References

"this"
Ec 1:14: I have seen all the works that are done under the sun; and: look: all is vanity and vexation of spirit.
Ec 3:10: I have seen the travail: which God has given to the sons of men to be exercised in it.
Ec 4:7: 8: Then I returned: and I saw vanity under the sun.
Ec 7:25: I applied my heart to know: and to search: and to seek out wisdom: and the reason of things: and to know the wickedness of folly: even of foolishness and madness:

"there is"
Ec 5:8: 13: If you see the oppression of the poor: and violent perverting of judgment and justice in a province: not marvel at the matter: for he who is higher than the high regards; and there be higher than they.
Ex 14:5-9: 28: It was told the king of Egypt that the people fled: and the heart of Pharaoh and of his servants was turned against the people: and they said: Why have we done this: that we have let Israel go from serving us?
De 2:30: But Sihon king of Heshbon not would let us pass by Him: for the LORD your God hardened His spirit: and made His heart obstinate: that He might deliver Him into your hand: as appeareth this day.
2Ki 14:10-12: You have indeed smitten Edom: and your heart has lifted you up: glory of this: and tarry at home: for why should'>should you meddle to your hurt: that you should'>should fall: even you: and Judah with you?
2Ki 25:7: They killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes: and put out the eyes of Zedekiah: and bound him with fetters of brass: and carried him to Babylon.

Fear God
