Ne 13:8-31: It grieved me sore: therefore I cast forth all the household stuff of Tobiah out of the chamber.
Ps 71:15-18: My mouth will show forth your righteousness and your salvation all the day; for I not know the numbers thereof.
Jer 29:13: you will seek me: and find me: when you will search for me with all your heart.
Mt 6:33: But seek you first the kingdom of God: and His righteousness; and all these things will be added to you.
Joh 4:34: Jesus says to them: My meat is to do the will of Him that sent me: and to finish His work.
Ro 12:11: Not slothful in business; fervent in spirit; serving the Lord;
Ro 15:18-20: For I not will dare to speak of any of those things which Christ has not wrought by me: to make the Gentiles obedient: by word and deed:
1Co 9:24: 26: Know you not that they which run in a race run all: but one receives the prize? So run: that you may obtain.
1Co 15:10: But by the grace of God I am what I am: and His grace which was bestowed upon me not was in vain; but I laboured more abundantly than they all: not yet I: but the grace of God which was with me.
1Co 16:10: Now if Timotheus come: see that He may be with you without fear: for He works the work of the Lord: as I also do.
Eph 5:16: Redeeming the time: because the days are evil.
Col 3:23: whatever you do: do it heartily: as to the Lord: not and to men;
2Pe 1:12-15: For what reason I not will be negligent to put you always in remembrance of these things: though you know them: and be established in the present truth.

"for"
Ec 9:5: 6: For the living know that they will die: but the dead not know any thing: neither have they any more a reward; for the memory of them is forgotten.
Ec 11:3: If the clouds be full of rain: they empty themselves upon the earth: and if the tree fall toward the south: or toward the north: in the place where the tree falls: there it will be.
Job 14:7-12: For there is hope of a tree: if it be cut down: that it will sprout again: and that the tender branch thereof not will cease.
Ps 6:5: For in death there is no remembrance of you: in the grave who will give you thanks?
Ps 88:10-12: Will you show wonders to the dead? will the dead arise and praise you? Selah.
Isa 38:18: 19: For the grave cannot praise you: death can not celebrate you: they that go down into the pit cannot hope for your truth.
Joh 9:4: I must work the works of him that sent me: while it is day: the night comes: when no man can work.
Ac 20:25-31: Now: look: I know that you all: among whom I have gone preaching the kingdom of God: will see my face no more.

 שַׁ֜בְתִּי וְרָאֹ֣ה תַֽחַת־הַשֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ כִּ֣י לֹא֩ לַקַּלִּ֨ים הַמֵּרֹ֜וץ וְלֹ֧א לַגִּבֹּורִ֣ים הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וְ֠גַם לֹ֣א לַחֲכָמִ֥ים לֶ֙חֶם֙ וְגַ֨ם לֹ֤א לַנְּבֹנִים֙ עֹ֔שֶׁר וְגַ֛ם לֹ֥א לַיֹּדְעִ֖ים חֵ֑ן כִּי־עֵ֥ת וָפֶ֖גַע יִקְרֶ֥ה אֶת־כֻּלָּֽם׃

H3605כֻּלָּֽם׃kul-lām.   (N-msc | 3mp)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		כֻּלָּֽם׃kul-lām. to them all N-msc | 3mp
11 I returned, and saw under the sun, that the race is not to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, neither yet bread to the wise, nor yet riches to men of understanding, nor yet favour to men of skill; but time and chance happens to them all.Ecclesiastes 9:11
Stats
Counts: 245 characters, 42 words, 189 letters, 68 vowels, 121 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שַׁ֜בְתִּי וְרָאֹ֣ה תַֽחַת־הַשֶּׁ֗מֶשׁ כִּ֣י לֹא֩ לַקַּלִּ֨ים הַמֵּרֹ֜וץ וְלֹ֧א לַגִּבֹּורִ֣ים הַמִּלְחָמָ֗ה וְ֠גַם לֹ֣א לַחֲכָמִ֥ים לֶ֙חֶם֙ וְגַ֨ם לֹ֤א לַנְּבֹנִים֙ עֹ֔שֶׁר וְגַ֛ם לֹ֥א לַיֹּדְעִ֖ים חֵ֑ן כִּי־עֵ֥ת וָפֶ֖גַע יִקְרֶ֥ה אֶת־כֻּלָּֽם׃

Lit: I returned and saw under the sun that is not to the swift the race nor to the strong the battle and nor to the wise bread and nor to men of understanding riches and nor to men of skill favor but time and chance happen to them all

KJV: I returned, and saw under the sun, that the race is not to the swift, nor the battle to the strong, neither yet bread to the wise, nor yet riches to men of understanding, nor yet favour to men of skill; but time and chance happeneth to them all.
References

"returned"
Ec 2:12: I turned myself to look wisdom: and madness: and folly: for what can the man do that comes after the king? even that which has been already done.
Ec 4:1: 4: So I returned: and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and look the tears of such as were oppressed: and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.
Mal 3:18: Then will you return: and discern between the righteous and the wicked: between Him that serves'>serves God and Him that serves'>serves Him not">not Him.

"that the race"
1Sa 17:50: So David prevailed over the Philistine with a sling and with a stone: and smote the Philistine: and killed him; but there was no sword in the hand of David.
2Sa 2:18-23: There were 3 sons of Zeruiah there: Joab: and Abishai: and Asahel: and Asahel was as light of foot as a wild roe.
2Sa 17:14: 23: Absalom and all the men of Israel said: The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel. For the LORD had appointed to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel: to the intent that the LORD might bring evil upon Absalom.
Ps 33:16: 17: There is no king saved by the multitude of an host: a mighty man not is delivered by much strength.
Ps 73:6: 7: Therefore pride compasss them about as a chain; violence covers them as a garment.
Ps 147:10: 11: He delights not in the strength of the horse: he takes not pleasure in the legs of a man.
Jer 9:23: Thus says the LORD: not Let the wise man glory in His wisdom: neither let the mighty man glory in His might: not let the rich man glory in His riches:
Jer 46:6: not Let the swift flee away: nor the mighty man escape; they will stumble: and fall toward the north by the river Euphrates.
Am 2:14-16: Therefore the flight will perish from the swift: and the strong will not strengthen his force: neither will the mighty deliver himself:

"but"
Ec 2:14: 15: The wise man's eyes are in his head; but the fool walks in darkness: and I myself perceived also that one event happens to them all.
Ec 3:14: 17: I know that: whatever God does'>does: it will be for ever: nothing can be put to it: nor any thing taken from it: and God does'>does it: that men should fear before Him.
Ec 7:13: Consider the work of God: for who can make that straight: which He has made crooked?
1Sa 2:3-10: Talk no more so exceeding proudly; let not arrogancy come out of your mouth: for the LORD is a God of knowledge: and by Him actions are weighed.
Job 5:11-14: To set up on high those that be low; that those which mourn may be exalted to safety.
Job 34:29: When he gives quietness: who then can make trouble? and when he hides his face: who then can look him? whether it be done against a nation: or against a man only:
Pr 21:30: 31: There is no wisdom nor understanding nor counsel against the LORD.
La 3:37: 38: Who is He that says: and it comes to pass: when the Lord commands it not?
Da 4:35: All the inhabitants of the earth are reputed not ashing: and he does according to his will in the army of heaven: and among the inhabitants of the earth: and none can stay his hand: or say to him: What do you?
Eph 1:11: In whom also we have obtained an inheritance: being predestinated according to the purpose of him who works all things after the counsel of his own will:

 כִּ֡י גַּם֩ לֹֽא־יֵדַ֨ע הָאָדָ֜ם אֶת־עִתֹּ֗ו כַּדָּגִים֙ שֶׁנֶּֽאֱחָזִים֙ בִּמְצֹודָ֣ה רָעָ֔ה וְכַ֨צִּפֳּרִ֔ים הָאֲחֻזֹ֖ות בַּפָּ֑ח כָּהֵ֗ם יֽוּקָשִׁים֙ בְּנֵ֣י הָֽאָדָ֔ם לְעֵ֣ת רָעָ֔ה כְּשֶׁתִּפֹּ֥ול עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם פִּתְאֹֽם׃

H3588כִּ֡יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֡יkî For Conj
H1571גַּם֩gam   (Conj)
H1571 גַּם gam gam by contraction from an unused root meaning to gather; properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and; again, alike, also, (so much) as (soon), both (so)...and, but, either...or, even, for all, (in) likewise (manner), moreover, nay...neither, one, then(-refore), though, what, with, yea. 		גַּם֩gam also Conj
H3808לֹֽא־lō-   (Adv-NegPrt)
H3808 לֹא lôʼ lo or לוֹא; or לֹה; (Deuteronomy 3:11), a primitive particle; not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles; idiom before, phrase or else, ere, phrase except, ig(-norant), much, less, nay, neither, never, no((-ne), -r, (-thing)), (idiom as though...,(can-), for) not (out of), of nought, otherwise, out of, phrase surely, phrase as truly as, phrase of a truth, phrase verily, for want, phrase whether, without. 		לֹֽא־lō- not Adv-NegPrt

H6597פִּתְאֹֽם׃piṯ-’ōm.   (Adv)
H6597 פִּתְאוֹם pithʼôwm pith-ome or פִּתְאֹם; from פֶּתַע; instantly; straightway, sudden(-ly)., 		פִּתְאֹֽם׃piṯ-’ōm. suddenly Adv
12 For man also knows not his time: as the fishes that are taken in an evil net, and as the birds that are caught in the snare; so are the sons of men snared in an evil time, when it falls suddenly upon them.Ecclesiastes 9:12
Stats
Rank: #4651 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 209 characters, 40 words, 161 letters, 61 vowels, 100 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֡י גַּם֩ לֹֽא־יֵדַ֨ע הָאָדָ֜ם אֶת־עִתֹּ֗ו כַּדָּגִים֙ שֶׁנֶּֽאֱחָזִים֙ בִּמְצֹודָ֣ה רָעָ֔ה וְכַ֨צִּפֳּרִ֔ים הָאֲחֻזֹ֖ות בַּפָּ֑ח כָּהֵ֗ם יֽוּקָשִׁים֙ בְּנֵ֣י הָֽאָדָ֔ם לְעֵ֣ת רָעָ֔ה כְּשֶׁתִּפֹּ֥ול עֲלֵיהֶ֖ם פִּתְאֹֽם׃

Lit: For also not does know man his time Like fish taken in a net cruel and Like birds caught in a snare so are snared the sons of men in an time evil when it falls upon them suddenly

KJV: For man also knoweth not his time: as the fishes that are taken in an evil net, and as the birds that are caught in the snare; so are the sons of men snared in an evil time, when it falleth suddenly upon them.
References

"man"
Ec 8:5-7: 11: Whoever keeps the commandment will feel no evil thing: and a wise man's heart discerns both time and judgment.
Lu 19:42-44: Saying: If you hadst known: even you: at least in this your day: the things which belong to your peace! but now they are hid from your eyes.
2Co 6:2: (For he says: I have heard you in a time accepted: and in the day of salvation have I succoured you: look: now is the accepted time; look: now is the day of salvation.)
1Pe 2:12: Having your conversation ho among the Gentiles: that: whereas they speak against you as evildoers: they may by your good works: which they will look: glorify God in the day of visitation.

"as the fishes"
Pr 7:22: 23: He goes'>goes after her straightway: as an ox goes'>goes to the slaughter: or as a fool to the correction of the stocks;
Hab 1:14-17: make men as the fishes of the sea: as the creeping things: that have no ruler over them?
2Ti 2:26: that they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil: who are taken captive by him at his will.

"the sons"
Job 18:8-10: For he is cast into a net by his own feet: and he walks upon a snare.
Ps 11:6: Upon the wicked he will rain snares: fire and brimstone: and an horrible tempest: this will be the portion of their cup.
Ps 73:18-20: Surely you did set them in slippery places: you castedst them down into destruction.
Pr 6:15: Therefore will his calamity come suddenly; suddenly will he be broken without remedy.
Pr 29:6: In the transgression of an evil man there is a snare: but the righteous does sing and rejoice.
Isa 30:13: Therefore this iniquity will be to you as a breach ready to fall: swelling out in a high wall: whose breaking comes suddenly at an instant.
Lu 12:20: 39: But God said to Him: You fool: this night your soul will be required of you: then whose will those things be: which you have provided?
Lu 17:26-31: As it was in the days of Noe: so will it be also in the days of the Son of man.
Lu 21:34-36: Take heed to yourselves: lest at any time your hearts be overcharged with surfeiting: and drunkenness: and cares of this life: and so that day come upon you unawares.
1Th 5:3: For when they will say: Peace and safety; then sudden destruction comes upon them: as travail upon a woman with child; and they will not escape.
2Pe 2:12: But these: as natural brute beasts: made to be taken and destroyed: speak evil of the things that they not understand; and will utterly perish in their own corruption;

Wisdom Is Better than Strength

H8121 שֶׁמֶשׁ shemesh sheh-mesh from an unused root meaning to be brilliant; the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement; phrase east side(-ward), sun (rising), phrase west(-ward), window. H1931הִ֖יאhî   (Pro-3fs)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		הִ֖יאhî it seemed Pro-3fs
H413אֵלָֽי׃’ê-lāy.   (Prep | 1cs)
H413 אֵל ʼêl ale (but only used in the shortened constructive form אֶל ); a primitive particle; properly, denoting motion towards, but occasionally used of a quiescent position, i.e.; near, with or among; often in general, to; about, according to, after, against, among, as for, at, because(-fore, -side), both...and, by, concerning, for, from, idiom hath, in(-to), near, (out) of, over, through, to(-ward), under, unto, upon, whether, with(-in). 		אֵלָֽי׃’ê-lāy. to me Prep | 1cs
13 This wisdom have I seen also under the sun, and it seemed great to me:Ecclesiastes 9:13
Stats
Rank: #7246 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 72 characters, 14 words, 56 letters, 24 vowels, 32 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גַּם־זֹ֛ה רָאִ֥יתִי חָכְמָ֖ה תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ וּגְדֹולָ֥ה הִ֖יא אֵלָֽי׃

Lit: Also this I have seen wisdom under the sun and great it seemed to me

KJV: This wisdom have I seen also under the sun, and it seemed great unto me:
References

"This wisdom have I seen also under the sun, and it seemed great unto me:"
Ec 9:11: I returned: and saw under the sun: that the race is not to the swift: nor the battle to the strong: neither yet bread to the wise: nor yet riches to men of understanding: nor yet favour to men of skill; but time and chance happens to them all.
Ec 6:1: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun: and it is common among men:
Ec 7:15: All things have I seen in the days of my vanity: there is a just man that perishes in his righteousness: and there is a wicked man that prolongs his life in his wickedness.
Ec 8:16: When I applied my heart to know wisdom: and to see the business that is done upon the earth: (for also there is that neither day nor night sees sleep with his eyes:)

14 There was a little city, and few men within it; and there came a great king against it, and besieged it, and built great bulwarks against it:Ecclesiastes 9:14

Translation

H376אִ֤ישׁ’îš   (N-ms)
H376 אִישׁ ʼîysh eesh contracted for אֱנוֹשׁ (or perhaps rather from an unused root meaning to be extant); a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation); also, another, any (man), a certain, phrase champion, consent, each, every (one), fellow, (foot-, husband-) man, (good-, great, mighty) man, he, high (degree), him (that is), husband, man(-kind), phrase none, one, people, person, phrase steward, what (man) soever, whoso(-ever), worthy. 15 Now there was found in it a poor wise man, and he by his wisdom delivered the city; yet no man remembered that same poor man.Ecclesiastes 9:15
Stats
Rank: #6594 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 125 characters, 24 words, 97 letters, 38 vowels, 59 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמָ֣צָא בָ֗הּ אִ֤ישׁ מִסְכֵּן֙ חָכָ֔ם וּמִלַּט־ה֥וּא אֶת־הָעִ֖יר בְּחָכְמָתֹ֑ו וְאָדָם֙ לֹ֣א זָכַ֔ר אֶת־הָאִ֥ישׁ הַמִּסְכֵּ֖ן הַהֽוּא׃

Lit: And there was found in it a man poor wise and delivered he the city by his wisdom and yet one no remembered man poor that

KJV: Now there was found in it a poor wise man, and he by his wisdom delivered the city; yet no man remembered that same poor man.
References

"yet"
Ge 40:23: Yet not did the chief butler remember Joseph: but forgot him.
Es 6:2: 3: It was found written: that Mordecai had told of Bigthana and Teresh: two of the king's chamberlains: the keepers of the door: who sought to lay hand on the king Ahasuerus.

16 Then said I, Wisdom is better than strength: nevertheless the poor man's wisdom is despised, and his words not are heard.Ecclesiastes 9:16
Stats

Translation
Hebrew: וְאָמַ֣רְתִּי אָ֔נִי טֹובָ֥ה חָכְמָ֖ה מִגְּבוּרָ֑ה וְחָכְמַ֤ת הַמִּסְכֵּן֙ בְּזוּיָ֔ה וּדְבָרָ֖יו אֵינָ֥ם נִשְׁמָעִֽים׃

Lit: And said I is better Wisdom than strength And nevertheless wisdom of the poor man is despised and his words not are heard

KJV: Then said I, Wisdom is better than strength: nevertheless the poor man's wisdom [is] despised, and his words are not heard.

10
Wisdom and Folly

H4592מְעָֽט׃mə-‘āṭ.   (Adj-ms)
H4592 מְעַט mᵉʻaṭ meh-at or מְעָט; from מָעַט; a little or few (often adverbial or compar.); almost (some, very) few(-er, -est), lightly, little (while), (very) small (matter, thing), some, soon, idiom very., 		מְעָֽט׃mə-‘āṭ. a little Adj-ms
1 Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: so does a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom and honour.Ecclesiastes 10:1
Stats
Rank: #9264 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 154 characters, 25 words, 123 letters, 48 vowels, 75 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: זְב֣וּבֵי מָ֔וֶת יַבְאִ֥ישׁ יַבִּ֖יעַ שֶׁ֣מֶן רֹוקֵ֑חַ יָקָ֛ר מֵחָכְמָ֥ה מִכָּבֹ֖וד סִכְל֥וּת מְעָֽט׃

Lit: Flies Dead putrefy and cause it to give off a foul odor the ointment of perfumer to one respected for wisdom and honor So does folly a little

KJV: Dead flies cause the ointment of the apothecary to send forth a stinking savour: so doth a little folly him that is in reputation for wisdom [and] honour.

Mt 5:13-16: You are the salt of the earth: but if the salt have lost his savour: wherewith will it be salted? it is thenceforth good not forhing: but to be cast out: and to be trodden under foot of men.
Ga 2:12-14: For before that certain came from James: he did eat with the Gentiles: but when they were come: he withdrew and separated himself: fearing them which were of the circumcision.

H8040לִשְׂמֹאלֽוֹ׃liś-mō-lōw.   (Prep-l | N-msc | 3ms)
H8040 שְׂמֹאול sᵉmôʼwl sem-ole or שְׂמֹאל; a primitive word (rather perhaps from the same as שִׂמְלָה (by insertion of the aleph) through the idea of wrapping up); properly, dark (as enveloped), i.e. the north; hence (by orientation), the left hand; left (hand, side). 		לִשְׂמֹאלֽוֹ׃liś-mō-lōw. at his left Prep-l | N-msc | 3ms
2 A wise man's heart is at his right hand; but a fool's heart at his left.Ecclesiastes 10:2
Stats
Counts: 72 characters, 15 words, 53 letters, 20 vowels, 33 consonants
Translation

Lit: Heart is of a wise man at his right hand but a heart of fool at his left

KJV: A wise man's heart is at his right hand; but a fool's heart at his left.

"but"

H1931הֽוּא׃hū.   (Pro-3ms)
H1931 הוּא hûwʼ hoo of which the feminine (beyond the Pentateuch) is הִיא; a primitive word, the third person pronoun singular; he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are; he, as for her, him(-self), it, the same, she (herself), such, that (...it), these, they, this, those, which (is), who., 		הֽוּא׃hū. that he [is] Pro-3ms
3 Yes also, when he who is a fool walks by the way, his wisdom fails him, and he says to every one that he is a fool.Ecclesiastes 10:3
Stats
Counts: 125 characters, 20 words, 91 letters, 37 vowels, 54 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְגַם־בַּדֶּ֛רֶךְ [כְּשֶׁהַסָּכָל כ] (כְּשֶׁסָּכָ֥ל ק) הֹלֵ֖ךְ לִבֹּ֣ו חָסֵ֑ר וְאָמַ֥ר לַכֹּ֖ל סָכָ֥ל הֽוּא׃

Lit: And Even along the way when a fool walks wisdom He is lacking and he shows everyone a fool that he [is]

KJV: Yea also, when he that is a fool walketh by the way, his wisdom faileth him, and he saith to every one [that] he [is] a fool.

H3240 יָנַח yânach yaw-nakh a primitive root; to deposit; by implication, to allow to stay; bestow, cast down, lay (down, up), leave (off), let alone (remain), pacify, place, put, set (down), suffer, withdraw, withhold. H3588כִּ֣יkî   (Conj)
H3588 כִּי kîy kee a primitive particle (the full form of the prepositional prefix) indicating causal relations of all kinds, antecedent or consequent; (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed; and, + (forasmuch, inasmuch, where-) as, assured(-ly), + but, certainly, doubtless, + else, even, + except, for, how, (because, in, so, than) that, + nevertheless, now, rightly, seeing, since, surely, then, therefore, + (al-) though, + till, truly, + until, when, whether, while, whom, yea, yet. 		כִּ֣יkî for Conj

H4832 מַרְפֵּא marpêʼ mar-pay from רָפָא; properly, curative, i.e. literally (concretely) a medicine, or (abstractly) a cure; figuratively (concretely) deliverance, or (abstractly) placidity; (in-)cure(-able), healing(-lth), remedy, sound, wholesome, yielding. 		מַרְפֵּ֔אmar-pê, conciliation N-ms
H3240יַנִּ֖יחַyan-nî-aḥ   (V-Hifil-Imperf-3ms)
H3240 יָנַח yânach yaw-nakh a primitive root; to deposit; by implication, to allow to stay; bestow, cast down, lay (down, up), leave (off), let alone (remain), pacify, place, put, set (down), suffer, withdraw, withhold. (The Hiphil forms with the dagesh are here referred to, in accordance with the older grammarians; but if any distinction of the kind is to be made, these should rather be referred to נוּחַ, and the others here.) 		יַנִּ֖יחַyan-nî-aḥ pacifies V-Hifil-Imperf-3ms

H1419גְּדוֹלִֽים׃gə-ḏō-w-lîm.   (Adj-mp)

4 If the spirit of the ruler rise up against you, not leave your place; for yielding pacifies great offences.Ecclesiastes 10:4
Stats
Counts: 108 characters, 17 words, 87 letters, 35 vowels, 52 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִם־ר֤וּחַ הַמֹּושֵׁל֙ תַּעֲלֶ֣ה עָלֶ֔יךָ מְקֹומְךָ֖ אַל־תַּנַּ֑ח כִּ֣י מַרְפֵּ֔א יַנִּ֖יחַ חֲטָאִ֥ים גְּדֹולִֽים׃

Lit: If the spirit of the ruler rises against you your post not do leave for conciliation pacifies offenses great

KJV: If the spirit of the ruler rise up against thee, leave not thy place; for yielding pacifieth great offences.
References

"leave"
Ec 8:3: not Be hasty to go out of his sight: not stand in an evil thing; for he does whatever pleases him.

"for"
1Sa 25:24-44: Fell at his feet: and said: Upon me: my lord: upon me let this iniquity be: and let your handmaid: I pray you: speak in your audience: and hear the words of your handmaid.
Pr 25:15: By long forbearing is a prince persuaded: and a soft tongue breaks the bone.

5 There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, as an error which proceeds from the ruler:Ecclesiastes 10:5
Stats
Counts: 96 characters, 16 words, 74 letters, 29 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: יֵ֣שׁ רָעָ֔ה רָאִ֖יתִי תַּ֣חַת הַשָּׁ֑מֶשׁ כִּשְׁגָגָ֕ה שֶׁיֹּצָ֖א מִלִּפְנֵ֥י הַשַּׁלִּֽיט׃

Lit: There is an evil I have seen under the sun as an error proceeding from the ruler

KJV: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun, as an error [which] proceedeth from the ruler:
References

"an evil"
Ec 4:7: Then I returned: and I saw vanity under the sun.
Ec 5:13: There is a sore evil which I have seen under the sun: namely: riches kept for the owners thereof to their hurt.
Ec 6:1: There is an evil which I have seen under the sun: and it is common among men:
Ec 9:3: This is an evil among all things that are done under the sun: that there is one event to all: yes: also the heart of the sons of men is full of evil: and madness is in their heart while they live: and after that they go to the dead.

"as an"
Ec 3:16: Moreover I saw under the sun the place of judgment: that wickedness was there; and the place of righteousness: that iniquity was there.
Ec 4:1: So I returned: and considered all the oppressions that are done under the sun: and look the tears of such as were oppressed: and they had no comforter; and on the side of their oppressors there was power; but they had no comforter.

"the rich"

H5307יִפּ֑וֹלyip-pō-wl;   (V-Qal-Imperf-3ms)
H5307 נָפַל nâphal naw-fal a primitive root; to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative); be accepted, cast (down, self, (lots), out), cease, die, divide (by lot), (let) fail, (cause to, let, make, ready to) fall (away, down, -en, -ing), fell(-ing), fugitive, have (inheritance), inferior, be judged (by mistake for פָּלַל), lay (along), (cause to) lie down, light (down), be (idiom hast) lost, lying, overthrow, overwhelm, perish, present(-ed, -ing), (make to) rot, slay, smite out, idiom surely, throw down. 		יִפּ֑וֹלyip-pō-wl; will fall V-Qal-Imperf-3ms
H6555וּפֹרֵ֥ץū-p̄ō-rêṣ   (Conj-w | V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms)
H6555 פָּרַץ pârats paw-rats lemma פּרַץ missing vowel, corrected to פָּרַץ; a primitive root; to break out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative); idiom abroad, (make a) breach, break (away, down, -er, forth, in, up), burst out, come (spread) abroad, compel, disperse, grow, increase, open, press, scatter, urge. 		וּפֹרֵ֥ץū-p̄ō-rêṣ and whoever breaks through Conj-w | V-Qal-Prtcpl-ms

H5391יִשְּׁכֶ֥נּוּyiš-šə-ḵen-nū   (V-Qal-Imperf-3ms | 3mse)
H5391 נָשַׁךְ nâshak naw-shak a primitive root; to strike with a sting (as a serpent); figuratively, to oppress with interest on a loan; bite, lend upon usury. 		יִשְּׁכֶ֥נּוּyiš-šə-ḵen-nū will be bitten by V-Qal-Imperf-3ms | 3mse
H5175נָחָֽשׁ׃nā-ḥāš.   (N-ms)
H5175 נָחָשׁ nâchâsh naw-khawsh from נָחַשׁ; a snake (from its hiss); serpent. 		נָחָֽשׁ׃nā-ḥāš. a serpent N-ms
8 He who digs a pit will fall into it; and whoever breaks an hedge, a serpent will bite him.Ecclesiastes 10:8
Stats
Counts: 96 characters, 17 words, 75 letters, 27 vowels, 48 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: חֹפֵ֥ר גּוּמָּ֖ץ בֹּ֣ו יִפֹּ֑ול וּפֹרֵ֥ץ גָּדֵ֖ר יִשְּׁכֶ֥נּוּ נָחָֽשׁ׃

Lit: He who digs a pit into it will fall and whoever breaks through a wall will be bitten by a serpent

KJV: He that diggeth a pit shall fall into it; and whoso breaketh an hedge, a serpent shall bite him.
References

"that"
Jg 9:5: 53-57: He went to his father's house at Ophrah: and killed his brothers the sons of Jerubbaal: being threescore and 10 persons: upon one stone: notwithstanding yet Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left; for he hid himself.
2Sa 17:23: When Ahithophel saw that his counsel not was followed: he saddled his ass: and arose: and gat him home to his house: to his city: and put his household in order: and hanged himself: and died: and was buried in the sepulchre of his father.
2Sa 18:15: 10 young men that bare Joab's armour compassed about and smote Absalom: and killed him.
Es 7:10: So they hanged Haman on the gallows that he had prepared for Mordecai. Then was the king's wrath pacified.
Ps 7:15: 16: He made a pit: and digged it: and is fallen into the ditch which he made.
Ps 9:15: 16: The heathen are sunk down in the pit that they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.
Pr 26:27: Whoever digs a pit will fall therein: and he who rolls a stone: it will return upon him.

"a serpent"
Am 5:19: As if a man did flee from a lion: and a bear met him; or went into the house: and leaned his hand on the wall: and a serpent bit him.
Am 9:3: Though they hide themselves in the top of Carmel: I will search and take them out there; and though they be hid from my sight in the bottom of the sea: there will I command the serpent: and he will bite them:

9 Whoever removes stones will be hurt therewith; and he who cleaves wood will be endangered thereby.Ecclesiastes 10:9
Stats
Counts: 101 characters, 15 words, 84 letters, 29 vowels, 55 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: מַסִּ֣יעַ אֲבָנִ֔ים יֵעָצֵ֖ב בָּהֶ֑ם בֹּוקֵ֥עַ עֵצִ֖ים יִסָּ֥כֶן בָּֽם׃

Lit: He who quarries stones may be hurt by them And he who splits wood may be endangered by it

KJV: Whoso removeth stones shall be hurt therewith; and he that cleaveth wood shall be endangered thereby.

H518 אִם ʼim eem a primitive particle; used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not; (and, can-, doubtless, if, that) (not), phrase but, either, phrase except, phrase more(-over if, than), neither, nevertheless, nor, oh that, or, phrase save (only, -ing), seeing, since, sith, phrase surely (no more, none, not), though, phrase of a truth, phrase unless, phrase verily, when, whereas, whether, while, phrase yet., 		אִם־’im- If Conj

H2451חָכְמָֽה׃ḥāḵ-māh   (N-fs)
H2451 חׇכְמָה chokmâh khok-maw from חָכַם; wisdom (in a good sense); skilful, wisdom, wisely, wit. 		חָכְמָֽה׃ḥāḵ-māh wisdom N-fs
10 If the iron be blunt, and he not do whet the edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom is profitable to direct.Ecclesiastes 10:10
Stats
Counts: 121 characters, 22 words, 93 letters, 33 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִם־קֵהָ֣ה הַבַּרְזֶ֗ל וְהוּא֙ לֹא־פָנִ֣ים קִלְקַ֔ל וַחֲיָלִ֖ים יְגַבֵּ֑ר וְיִתְרֹ֥ון הַכְשֵׁ֖יר חָכְמָֽה׃

Lit: If is dull the ax and he not the edge does sharpen and more strength He must use but brings success wisdom

KJV: If the iron be blunt, and he do not whet the edge, then must he put to more strength: but wisdom is profitable to direct.
References

"wisdom"
Ec 10:15: The labour of the foolish wearies every one of them: because he knows not how to go to the city.
Ec 9:15-17: Now there was found in it a poor wise man: and he by his wisdom delivered the city; yet no man remembered that same poor man.
Ge 41:33-39: Now therefore let Pharaoh look out a man discreet and wise: and set him over the land of Egypt.
Ex 18:19-23: Listen now to my voice: I will give you counsel: and God will be with you: Be you for the people to God-ward: that you may bring the causes to God:
1Ki 3:9: Give therefore your servant an understanding heart to judge your people: that I may discern between good and bad: for who is able to judge this your so great a people?
1Ch 12:32: Of the children of Issachar: which were men that had understanding of the times: to know what Israel ought to do; the heads of them were 200; and all their brothers were at their commandment.
2Ch 23:4-11: This is the thing that you will do; A third part of you entering on the sabbath: of the priests and of the Levites: will be porters of the doors;
Mt 10:16: Look: I send you forth as sheep in the middle of wolves: be you therefore wise as serpents: and harmless as doves.
Ac 6:1-9: In those days: when the number of the disciples was multiplied: there arose a murmuring of the Grecians against the Hebrews: because their widows were neglected in the daily ministration.
Ac 15:2-21: When therefore Paul and Barnabas had no small dissension and disputation with them: they determined that Paul and Barnabas: and certain other of them: should go up to Jerusalem to the apostles and elders about this question.
Ro 16:19: For your obedience is come abroad to all men. I am glad therefore on your behalf: but yet I would have you wise to that which is good: and simple concerning evil.
1Co 14:20: Brothers: not be children in understanding: howbeit in malice be you children: but in understanding be men.
Eph 5:15-17: See then that you walk circumspectly: not as fools: but as wise:
Col 4:5: Walk in wisdom toward them that are without: redeeming the time.
Jas 1:5: If any of you lack wisdom: let Him ask of God: that gives to all men liberally: and upbraids not; and it will be given Him.

H369וְאֵ֣יןwə-’ên   (Conj-w | Adv)
H369 אַיִן ʼayin ah-yin as if from a primitive root meaning to be nothing or not exist; a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle; else, except, fail, (father-) less, be gone, in(-curable), neither, never, no (where), none, nor, (any, thing), not, nothing, to nought, past, un(-searchable), well-nigh, without. H1167 בַּעַל baʻal bah-al from בָּעַל; a master; hence, a husband, or (figuratively) owner (often used with another noun in modifications of this latter sense); phrase archer, phrase babbler, phrase bird, captain, chief man, phrase confederate, phrase have to do, phrase dreamer, those to whom it is due, phrase furious, those that are given to it, great, phrase hairy, he that hath it, have, phrase horseman, husband, lord, man, phrase married, master, person, phrase sworn, they of. 		לְבַ֖עַלlə-ḇa-‘al owner Prep-l | N-msc
H3956הַלָּשֽׁוֹן׃hal-lā-šō-wn.   (Art | N-cs)
H3956 לָשׁוֹן lâshôwn law-shone or לָשֹׁן; also (in plural) feminine לְשֹׁנָה; from לָשַׁן; the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water); phrase babbler, bay, phrase evil speaker, language, talker, tongue, wedge. 		הַלָּשֽׁוֹן׃hal-lā-šō-wn. the babbler Art | N-cs
11 Surely the serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler is no better.Ecclesiastes 10:11
Stats
Rank: #4584 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 77 characters, 12 words, 63 letters, 22 vowels, 41 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִם־יִשֹּׁ֥ךְ הַנָּחָ֖שׁ בְּלֹוא־לָ֑חַשׁ וְאֵ֣ין יִתְרֹ֔ון לְבַ֖עַל הַלָּשֹֽׁון׃

Lit: Surely may bite a serpent when it is not charmed and no is different owner the babbler

KJV: Surely the serpent will bite without enchantment; and a babbler is no better.
References

"the serpent"
Ps 58:4: 5: Their poison is like the poison of a serpent: they are like the deaf adder that stops her ear;
Jer 8:17: For: look: I will send serpents: cockatrices: among you: which will not be charmed: and they will bite you: says the LORD.

"a babbler"
Ps 52:2: Your tongue devises mischiefs; like a sharp rasor: working deceitfully.
Ps 64:3: Who whet their tongue like a sword: and bend their bows to shoot their arrows: even bitter words:
Pr 18:21: Death and life are in the power of the tongue: and they that love it will eat the fruit thereof.
Jas 3:6: The tongue is a fire: a world of iniquity: so is the tongue among our members: that it defiles the whole body: and sets on fire the course of nature; and it is set on fire of hell.

 דִּבְרֵ֥י פִי־חָכָ֖ם חֵ֑ן וְשִׂפְתֹ֥ות כְּסִ֖יל תְּבַלְּעֶֽנּוּ׃

H1697דִּבְרֵ֥יdiḇ-rê   (N-mpc)
H1697 דָּבָר dâbâr daw-baw from דָבַר; a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause; act, advice, affair, answer, idiom any such (thing), because of, book, business, care, case, cause, certain rate, phrase chronicles, commandment, idiom commune(-ication), phrase concern(-ing), phrase confer, counsel, phrase dearth, decree, deed, idiom disease, due, duty, effect, phrase eloquent, errand, (evil favoured-) ness, phrase glory, phrase harm, hurt, phrase iniquity, phrase judgment, language, phrase lying, manner, matter, message, (no) thing, oracle, idiom ought, idiom parts, phrase pertaining, phrase please, portion, phrase power, promise, provision, purpose, question, rate, reason, report, request, idiom (as hast) said, sake, saying, sentence, phrase sign, phrase so, some (uncleanness), somewhat to say, phrase song, speech, idiom spoken, talk, task, phrase that, idiom there done, thing (concerning), thought, phrase thus, tidings, what(-soever), phrase wherewith, which, word, work. 		דִּבְרֵ֥יdiḇ-rê The words N-mpc
H6310פִי־p̄î-   (N-msc)
H6310 פֶּה peh peh from פָּאָה; the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to; accord(-ing as, -ing to), after, appointment, assent, collar, command(-ment), idiom eat, edge, end, entry, phrase file, hole, idiom in, mind, mouth, part, portion, idiom (should) say(-ing), sentence, skirt, sound, speech, idiom spoken, talk, tenor, idiom to, phrase two-edged, wish, word. 		פִי־p̄î- of mouth N-msc

H2580 חֵן chên khane from חָנַן; graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty); favour, grace(-ious), pleasant, precious, (well-) favoured. 		חֵ֑ןḥên; are gracious N-ms
H8193וְשִׂפְת֥וֹתwə-śip̄-ṯō-wṯ   (Conj-w | N-fpc)
H8193 שָׂפָה sâphâh saw-faw or (in dual and plural) שֶׂפֶת; probably from סָפָה or שָׁפָה through the idea of termination (compare סוֹף); the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.); band, bank, binding, border, brim, brink, edge, language, lip, prating, (sea-)shore, side, speech, talk, (vain) words. 		וְשִׂפְת֥וֹתwə-śip̄-ṯō-wṯ but the lips Conj-w | N-fpc

H3684 כְּסִיל kᵉçîyl kes-eel from כָּסַל; properly, fat, i.e. (figuratively) stupid or silly; fool(-ish). 		כְּסִ֖ילkə-sîl of a fool N-ms
H1104תְּבַלְּעֶֽנּוּ׃tə-ḇal-lə-‘en-nū.   (V-Piel-Imperf-3fs | 3mse)
H1104 בָּלַע bâlaʻ baw-lah a primitive root; to make away with (specifically by swallowing); generally, to destroy; cover, destroy, devour, eat up, be at end, spend up, swallow down (up). 		תְּבַלְּעֶֽנּוּ׃tə-ḇal-lə-‘en-nū. shall swallow him up V-Piel-Imperf-3fs | 3mse
12 The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself.Ecclesiastes 10:12
Stats
Rank: #5063 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 93 characters, 18 words, 72 letters, 28 vowels, 44 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: דִּבְרֵ֥י פִי־חָכָ֖ם חֵ֑ן וְשִׂפְתֹ֥ות כְּסִ֖יל תְּבַלְּעֶֽנּוּ׃

Lit: The words of mouth of a wise man are gracious but the lips of a fool shall swallow him up

KJV: The words of a wise man's mouth are gracious; but the lips of a fool will swallow up himself.
References

"words"
Job 4:3: 4: Look: you have instructed many: and you have strengthened the weak hands.
Job 16:5: But I would strengthen you with my mouth: and the moving of my lips should asswage your grief.
Ps 37:30: The mouth of the righteous speaks wisdom: and his tongue talks of judgment.
Ps 40:9: 10: I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: indeed: I not have refrained my lips: O LORD: you knowest.
Ps 71:15-18: My mouth will show forth your righteousness and your salvation all the day; for I not know the numbers thereof.
Pr 10:13: 20: 21: 31: 32: In the lips of him that has understanding wisdom is found: but a rod is for the back of him that is void of understanding.
Pr 12:13: 14: 18: The wicked is snared by the transgression of his lips: but the just will come out of trouble.
Pr 15:2: 23: The tongue of the wise uss knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools pours out foolishness.
Pr 16:21-24: The wise in heart will be called prudent: and the sweetness of the lips increases learning.
Pr 22:17: 18: Bow down your ear: and hear the words of the wise: and apply your heart to my knowledge.
Pr 25:11: 12: A word fitly spoken is like apples of gold in pictures of silver.
Pr 31:26: She opens her mouth with wisdom; and in her tongue is the law of kindness.
Mt 12:35: A good man out of the good treasure of the heart brings'>brings forth good things: and an evil man out of the evil treasure brings'>brings forth evil things.
Lu 4:22: All bare him witness: and wondered at the gracious words which proceeded out of his mouth. And they said: not Is this Joseph's son?
Eph 4:29: Let no corrupt communication proceed out of your mouth: but that which is good to the use of edifying: that it may minister grace to the hearers.
Col 4:6: Let your speech be alway with grace: seasoned with salt: that you may know how you ought to answer every man.

"but"
2Sa 1:16: David said to Him: Your blood be upon your head; for your mouth has testified against you: saying: I have killed the LORD's anointed.
1Ki 20:40-42: As your servant was busy here and there: he was gone. And the king of Israel said to him: So will your judgment be; yourself have decided it.
Ps 64:8: So they will make their own tongue to fall upon themselves: all that see them will flee away.
Ps 140:9: As for the head of those that compass me about: let the mischief of their own lips cover them.
Pr 10:8: 10: 14: The wise in heart will receive commandments: but a prating fool will fall.
Pr 18:6-8: A fool's lips enter into contention: and his mouth calls for strokes.
Pr 19:5: A false witness will not be unpunished: and he who speaks lies will not escape.
Pr 26:9: As a thorn goes up into the hand of a drunkard: so is a parable in the mouth of fools.
Lu 19:22: He says to him: Out of your own mouth will I judge you: you wicked servant. You knew that I was an austere man: taking up that I not laid down: and reaping that I not did sow:

13 The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness: and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.Ecclesiastes 10:13
Stats
Rank: #8085 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 105 characters, 16 words, 83 letters, 30 vowels, 53 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תְּחִלַּ֥ת דִּבְרֵי־פִ֖יהוּ סִכְל֑וּת וְאַחֲרִ֣ית פִּ֔יהוּ הֹולֵל֖וּת רָעָֽה׃

Lit: Begin with the words of his mouth foolishness and the end of his talk is madness raving

KJV: The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness: and the end of his talk [is] mischievous madness.

H4310מִ֖יmî   (Interrog)
H4310 מִי mîy me an interrogative pronoun of persons, as מָה is of things,; who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix; any (man), idiom he, idiom him, phrase O that! what, which, who(-m, -se, -soever), phrase would to God., 		מִ֖יmî who Interrog
H5046יַגִּ֥ידyag-gîḏ   (V-Hifil-Imperf-3ms)
H5046 נָגַד nâgad naw-gad a primitive root; properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise; bewray, idiom certainly, certify, declare(-ing), denounce, expound, idiom fully, messenger, plainly, profess, rehearse, report, shew (forth), speak, idiom surely, tell, utter. 		יַגִּ֥ידyag-gîḏ can tell V-Hifil-Imperf-3ms
Hלֽוֹ׃lōw.   (Prep | 3ms)
 		לֽוֹ׃lōw. him Prep | 3ms
14 A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what will be; and what will be after him, who can tell him?Ecclesiastes 10:14
Stats
Rank: #6281 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 109 characters, 21 words, 82 letters, 28 vowels, 54 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וְהַסָּכָ֖ל יַרְבֶּ֣ה דְבָרִ֑ים לֹא־יֵדַ֤ע הָאָדָם֙ מַה־שֶׁיִּֽהְיֶ֔ה וַאֲשֶׁ֤ר יִֽהְיֶה֙ מֵֽאַחֲרָ֔יו מִ֖י יַגִּ֥יד לֹֽו׃

Lit: And a fool multiplies words No knows man what is to be and what will be after him who can tell him

KJV: A fool also is full of words: a man cannot tell what shall be; and what shall be after him, who can tell him?
References

"fool"
Ec 5:3: For a dream comes through the multitude of business; and a fool's voice is known by multitude of words.
Pr 10:19: In the multitude of words there wants not sin: but he who refrains his lips is wise.
Pr 15:2: The tongue of the wise uss knowledge aright: but the mouth of fools pours out foolishness.

"is full of words"
Job 34:37: For He adds rebellion to His sin: He claps His hands among us: and multiplies His words against God.
Job 35:16: Therefore does Job open his mouth in vain; he multiplies words without knowledge.

"a man"
Ec 3:22: For what reason I perceive that there is nothing better: than that a man should rejoice in his own works; for that is his portion: for who will bring him to see what will be after him?
Ec 6:12: For who knows what is good for man in this life: all the days of his vain life which he spends as a shadow? for who can tell a man what will be after him under the sun?
Ec 8:7: For he knows not that which will be: for who can tell him when it will be?
Jas 4:13: 14: Go to now: you that say: Today or to morrow we will go into such a city: and continue there a year: and buy and sell: and get gain:

15 The labour of the foolish wearies every one of them, because he knows not how to go to the city.Ecclesiastes 10:15
Stats
Rank: #9218 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 99 characters, 19 words, 78 letters, 33 vowels, 45 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: עֲמַ֥ל הַכְּסִילִ֖ים תְּיַגְּעֶ֑נּוּ אֲשֶׁ֥ר לֹֽא־יָדַ֖ע לָלֶ֥כֶת אֶל־עִֽיר׃

Lit: The labor of fools wearies them for not they do even know how to go to the city

KJV: The labour of the foolish wearieth every one of them, because he knoweth not how to go to the city.
References

"labour"
Ec 10:3: 10: Yes also: when he who is a fool walks by the way: his wisdom fails him: and he says to every one that he is a fool.
Isa 44:12-17: The smith with the tongs both works'>works in the coals: and fashions it with hammers: and works'>works it with the strength of his arms: yes: he is hungry: and his strength fails: he drinks no water: and is faint.
Isa 47:12: 13: Stand now with your enchantments: and with the multitude of your sorceries: wherein you have laboured from your youth; if so be you will be able to profit: if so be you may prevail.
Isa 55:2: For what reason do you spend money for that which is not bread? and your labour for that which satisfies not? listen diligently to me: and eat you that which is good: and let your soul delight itself in fatness.
Isa 57:1: The righteous perishes: and no man lays it to heart: and merciful men are taken away: none considering that the righteous is taken away from the evil to come.
Hab 2:6: Will not all these take up a parable against him: and a taunting proverb against him: and say: Woe to him that increases that which is not his! how long? and to him that lads himself with thick clay!
Mt 11:28-30: Come to me: all you that labour and are heavy laden: and I will give you rest.

"because"
Ps 107:4: 7: They wandered in the wilderness in a solitary way; they found no city to dwell in.
Isa 35:8-10: An highway will be there: and a way: and it will be called The way of holiness; the unclean will not pass over it; but it will be for those: the wayfaring men: though fools: will not err therein.
Jer 50:4: 5: In those days: and in that time: says the LORD: the children of Israel will come: they and the children of Judah together: going and weeping: they will go: and seek the LORD their God.

Translation
Hebrew: אִֽי־לָ֣ךְ אֶ֔רֶץ שֶׁמַּלְכֵּ֖ךְ נָ֑עַר וְשָׂרַ֖יִךְ בַּבֹּ֥קֶר יֹאכֵֽלוּ׃

Lit: Woe to you land when your king is a child and your princes in the morning feast

KJV: Woe to thee, O land, when thy king is a child, and thy princes eat in the morning!
References

"when"

2Ch 33:1-20: Manasseh was 12 years old when he began to reign: and he reigned 55 years in Jerusalem:
2Ch 36:2: 5: 9: 11: Jehoahaz was 23 years old when he began to reign: and he reigned 3 months in Jerusalem.

"and"
Pr 20:1: 2: Wine is a mocker: strong drink is raging: and whoever is deceived thereby not is wise.
Isa 5:11: 12: Woe to them that rise up early in the morning: that they may follow strong drink; that continue until night: till wine inflame them!
Isa 28:7: 8: But they also have erred through wine: and through strong drink are out of the way; the priest and the prophet have erred through strong drink: they are swallowed up of wine: they are out of the way through strong drink; they err in vision: they stumble in judgment.
Ho 7:5-7: In the day of our king the princes have made him sick with bottles of wine; he stretched out his hand with scorners.

"in the"
Jer 21:12: O house of David: thus says the LORD; Execute judgment in the morning: and deliver Him that is spoiled out of the hand of the oppressor: lest my fury go out like fire: and burn that none can quench it: because of the evil of your doings.

17 Blessed are you, O land, when your king is the son of nobles, and your princes eat in due season, for strength, not and for drunkenness!Ecclesiastes 10:17
Stats
Rank: #6856 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 137 characters, 19 words, 104 letters, 34 vowels, 70 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אַשְׁרֵ֣יךְ אֶ֔רֶץ שֶׁמַּלְכֵּ֖ךְ בֶּן־חֹורִ֑ים וְשָׂרַ֙יִךְ֙ בָּעֵ֣ת יֹאכֵ֔לוּ בִּגְבוּרָ֖ה וְלֹ֥א בַשְּׁתִֽי׃

Lit: Blessed are you land when your king is the son of nobles and your princes at the proper time feast for strength and not for drunkenness

KJV: Blessed art thou, O land, when thy king [is] the son of nobles, and thy princes eat in due season, for strength, and not for drunkenness!
References

"when"
Ec 10:6: 7: Folly is set in great dignity: and the rich sit in low place.
Pr 28:2: 3: For the transgression of a land many are the princes thereof: but by a man of understanding and knowledge the state thereof will be prolonged.
Jer 30:21: Their nobles will be of themselves: and their governor will proceed from the middle of them; and I will cause Him to draw near: and He will approach to me: for who is this that engaged His heart to approach to me? says the LORD.

"and thy"
Pr 31:4: 5: It is not for kings: O Lemuel: it is not for kings to drink wine; nor for princes strong drink:

18 By much slothfulness the building decays; and through idleness of the hands the house drops through.Ecclesiastes 10:18
Stats
Rank: #7222 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 105 characters, 15 words, 88 letters, 28 vowels, 60 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּעֲצַלְתַּ֖יִם יִמַּ֣ךְ הַמְּקָרֶ֑ה וּבְשִׁפְל֥וּת יָדַ֖יִם יִדְלֹ֥ף הַבָּֽיִת׃

Lit: because of laziness decays the building and through idleness of hands leaks the house

KJV: By much slothfulness the building decayeth; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth through.
References

"By much slothfulness the building decayeth; and through idleness of the hands the house droppeth through."
Pr 12:24: The hand of the diligent will bear rule: but the slothful will be under tribute.
Pr 14:1: Every wise woman builds her house: but the foolish plucks it down with her hands.
Pr 20:4: The sluggard not will plow by reason of the cold; therefore will he beg in harvest: and have nothing.
Pr 21:25: The desire of the slothful kills him; for his hands refuse to labour.
Pr 23:21: For the drunkard and the glutton will come to poverty: and drowsiness will clothe a man with rags.
Pr 24:30: 31: I went by the field of the slothful: and by the vineyard of the man void of understanding;
Heb 6:11: We desire that every one of you do show the same diligence to the full assurance of hope to the end:
2Pe 1:5-10: Beside this: giving all diligence: add to your faith virtue; and to virtue knowledge;

H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		הַכֹּֽל׃hak-kōl. everything Art | N-ms
19 A feast is made for laughter, and wine makes merry: but money answers all things.Ecclesiastes 10:19
Stats
Rank: #9217 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 84 characters, 13 words, 67 letters, 24 vowels, 43 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: לִשְׂחֹוק֙ עֹשִׂ֣ים לֶ֔חֶם וְיַ֖יִן יְשַׂמַּ֣ח חַיִּ֑ים וְהַכֶּ֖סֶף יַעֲנֶ֥ה אֶת־הַכֹּֽל׃

Lit: For laughter is made a feast and wine makes merry but money answers everything

KJV: A feast is made for laughter, and wine maketh merry: but money answereth all things.
References

"feast"
Ec 2:1: 2: I said in my heart: Go to now: I will prove you with mirth: therefore enjoy pleasure: and: look: this also is vanity.
Ec 7:2-6: It is better to go to the house of mourning: than to go to the house of feasting: for that is the end of all men; and the living will lay it to his heart.
Ge 43:34: He took and sent messes to them from before him: but Benjamin's mess was 5 times so much as any of theirs. And they drank: and were merry with him.
Da 5:1-12: Belshazzar the king made a great feast to a000 of his lords: and drank wine before the000.
1Pe 4:3: For the time past of our life may suffice us to have wrought the will of the Gentiles: when we walked in lasciviousness: lusts: excess of wine: revellings: banquetings: and abominable idolatries:

"and wine"
Ec 9:7: Go your way: eat your bread with joy: and drink your wine with a merry heart; for God now accepts your works.
Ps 104:15: Wine that makes glad the heart of man: and oil to make his face to shine: and bread which strengthens man's heart.
Isa 24:11: There is a crying for wine in the streets; all joy is darkened: the mirth of the land is gone.
1Sa 25:36: Abigail came to Nabal; and: look: he held a feast in his house: like the feast of a king; and Nabal's heart was merry within him: for he was very drunken: for what reason she told not himhing: less or more: until the morning light.
2Sa 13:28: Now Absalom had commanded his servants: saying: Mark you now when Amnon's heart is merry with wine: and when I say to you: Smite Amnon; then kill him: not fear: not have I commanded you? be courageous: and be valiant.
Lu 12:19: I will say to my soul: Soul: you have much goods laid up for many years; take your ease: eat: drink: and be merry.
Eph 5:18: 19: not be drunk with wine: wherein is excess; but be filled with the Spirit;

"maketh merry"
Ec 7:11: 12: Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.
1Ch 21:24: King David said to Ornan: No; but I will truly buy it for the full price: for I not will take that which is your for the LORD: nor offer burnt offerings without cost.

Thus they did day by day: and gathered money in abundance.

Ezr 7:15-18: To carry the silver and gold: which the king and His counsellers have freely offered to the God of Israel: whose habitation is in Jerusalem:

Mt 17:27: Notwithstanding: lest we should offend them: go you to the sea: and cast an hook: and take up the fish that first comes up; and when you have opened his mouth: you will find a piece of money: that take: and give to them for me and you.
Mt 19:21: Jesus said to Him: If you will be perfect: go and sell that you have: and give to the poor: and you will have treasure in heaven: and come and follow me.

Lu 16:9: I say to you: Make to yourselves friends of the mammon of unrighteousness; that: when you fail: they may receive you into everlasting habitations.

1Ti 6:17-19: Charge them that are rich in this world: that they not be highminded: nor trust in uncertain riches: but in the living God: who gives us richly all things to enjoy;

גַּ֣ם בְּמַדָּֽעֲךָ֗ מֶ֚לֶךְ אַל־תְּקַלֵּ֔ל וּבְחַדְרֵי֙ מִשְׁכָּ֣בְךָ֔ אַל־תְּקַלֵּ֖ל עָשִׁ֑יר כִּ֣י עֹ֤וף הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ יֹולִ֣יךְ אֶת־הַקֹּ֔ול וּבַ֥עַל [הַכְּנָפַיִם כ] (כְּנָפַ֖יִם ק) יַגֵּ֥יד דָּבָֽר׃

20 not Curse the king, not no in your thought; and not curse the rich in your bedchamber: for a bird of the air will carry the voice, and that which has wings will tell the matter.Ecclesiastes 10:20
Stats
Rank: #6823 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 178 characters, 32 words, 138 letters, 43 vowels, 95 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: גַּ֣ם בְּמַדָּֽעֲךָ֗ מֶ֚לֶךְ אַל־תְּקַלֵּ֔ל וּבְחַדְרֵי֙ מִשְׁכָּ֣בְךָ֔ אַל־תְּקַלֵּ֖ל עָשִׁ֑יר כִּ֣י עֹ֤וף הַשָּׁמַ֙יִם֙ יֹולִ֣יךְ אֶת־הַקֹּ֔ול וּבַ֥עַל [הַכְּנָפַיִם כ] (כְּנָפַ֖יִם ק) יַגֵּ֥יד דָּבָֽר׃

Lit: Even in your thought the king not do curse and even in your bedroom not do curse the rich for a bird of the air may carry your voice and a bird in flight may tell the matter

KJV: Curse not the king, no not in thy thought; and curse not the rich in thy bedchamber: for a bird of the air shall carry the voice, and that which hath wings shall tell the matter.
References

"Curse"
Ex 22:28: You will not revile the gods: nor curse the ruler of your people.
Isa 8:21: They will pass through it: hardly bestead and hungry: and it will come to pass: that when they will be hungry: they will fret themselves: and curse their king and their God: and look upward.
Ac 23:5: Then said Paul: I not wist: brothers: that he was the high priest: for it is written: You will not speak evil of the ruler of your people.

"thought"
Ec 7:21: 22: Also take no heed to all words that are spoken; lest you hear your servant curse you:
Lu 19:40: He answered and said to them: I tell you that: if these should hold their peace: the stones would immediately cry out.

"in thy bedchamber"
Lu 10:40: But Martha was cumbered about much serving: and came to Him: and said: Lord: do you not care that my sister has left me to serve alone? bid her therefore that she help me.
Lu 12:2: 3: For there not ishing covered: that will not be revealed; neither hid: that will not be known.

11
Cast Your Bread upon the Waters

1 Cast your bread upon the waters: for you will find it after many days.Ecclesiastes 11:1
Stats
Rank: #8983 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 71 characters, 13 words, 56 letters, 18 vowels, 38 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שַׁלַּ֥ח לַחְמְךָ֖ עַל־פְּנֵ֣י הַמָּ֑יִם כִּֽי־בְרֹ֥ב הַיָּמִ֖ים תִּמְצָאֶֽנּוּ׃

Lit: Cast your bread on upon the waters for after many days you will find it

KJV: Cast thy bread upon the waters: for thou shalt find it after many days.

2 Give a portion to 7, and also to 8; for you know not what evil will be upon the earth.Ecclesiastes 11:2
Stats
Counts: 99 characters, 18 words, 77 letters, 31 vowels, 46 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: תֶּן־חֵ֥לֶק לְשִׁבְעָ֖ה וְגַ֣ם לִשְׁמֹונָ֑ה כִּ֚י לֹ֣א תֵדַ֔ע מַה־יִּהְיֶ֥ה רָעָ֖ה עַל־הָאָֽרֶץ׃

Lit: Give a serving to seven and also to eight for not you do know what will be evil on the earth

KJV: Give a portion to seven, and also to eight; for thou knowest not what evil shall be upon the earth.
References

"a portion"
Ne 8:10: Then He said to them: Go your way: eat the fat: and drink the sweet: and send portions to them for not whomhing is prepared: for this day is holy to our Lord: neither be you sorry; for the joy of the LORD is your strength.
Es 9:19: 22: Therefore the Jews of the villages: that dwelt in the unwalled towns: made the fourteenth day of the month Adar a day of gladness and feasting: and a good day: and of sending portions one to another.
Ps 112:9: He has dispersed: he has given to the poor; his righteousness endures for ever; his horn will be exalted with honour.
Lu 6:30-35: Give to every man that asks of you; and of him that takes away your goods ask them not again.
1Ti 6:18: 19: That they do good: that they be rich in good works: ready to distribute: willing to communicate;

"seven"
Job 5:19: He will deliver you in 6 troubles: yes: in 7 there will no evil touch you.
Pr 6:16: These 6 things does the LORD hate: yes: 7 are an abomination to Him:
Mic 5:5: This man will be the peace: when the Assyrian will come into our land: and when he will tread in our palaces: then will we raise against him 7 shepherds: and 8 principal men.
Mt 18:22: Jesus says to Him: I not say to you: Until 7 times: but: Until 70 times 7.
Lu 17:4: If he trespass against you 7 times in a day: and 7 times in a day turn again to you: saying: I repent; you will forgive him.

"for"
Da 4:27: For what reason: O king: let my counsel be acceptable to you: and break off your sins by righteousness: and your iniquities by shewing mercy to the poor; if it may be a lengthening of your tranquillity.
Ac 11:28-30: There stood up one of them named Agabus: and signified by the spirit that there should be great dearth throughout all the world: which came to pass in the days of Claudius Caesar.
Ga 6:1: Brothers: if a man be overtaken in a fault: you which are spiritual: restore such an one in the spirit of meekness; considering yourself: lest you also be tempted.
Eph 5:16: Redeeming the time: because the days are evil.
Heb 13:3: Remember them that are in bonds: as bound with them; and them which suffer adversity: as being yourselves also in the body.

 אִם־יִמָּלְא֨וּ הֶעָבִ֥ים גֶּ֙שֶׁם֙ עַל־הָאָ֣רֶץ יָרִ֔יקוּ וְאִם־יִפֹּ֥ול עֵ֛ץ בַּדָּרֹ֖ום וְאִ֣ם בַּצָּפֹ֑ון מְקֹ֛ום שֶׁיִּפֹּ֥ול הָעֵ֖ץ שָׁ֥ם יְהֽוּא׃
StrongsHebrewEnglishMorphology
H518אִם־’im-   (Conj)
H518 אִם ʼim eem a primitive particle; used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not; (and, can-, doubtless, if, that) (not), phrase but, either, phrase except, phrase more(-over if, than), neither, nevertheless, nor, oh that, or, phrase save (only, -ing), seeing, since, sith, phrase surely (no more, none, not), though, phrase of a truth, phrase unless, phrase verily, when, whereas, whether, while, phrase yet., 		אִם־’im- If Conj
H4390יִמָּלְא֨וּyim-mā-lə-’ū   (V-Nifal-Imperf-3mp)
H4390 מָלֵא mâlêʼ maw-lay or מָלָא; (Esther 7:5), a primitive root; to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively); accomplish, confirm, phrase consecrate, be at an end, be expired, be fenced, fill, fulfil, (be, become, idiom draw, give in, go) full(-ly, -ly set, tale), (over-) flow, fulness, furnish, gather (selves, together), presume, replenish, satisfy, set, space, take a (hand-) full, phrase have wholly. 		יִמָּלְא֨וּyim-mā-lə-’ū are full V-Nifal-Imperf-3mp
H5645הֶעָבִ֥יםhe-‘ā-ḇîm   (Art | N-cp)
H5645 עָב ʻâb awb (masculine and feminine); from עוּב; properly, an envelope, i.e. darkness (or density, 2 Chronicles 4:17); specifically, a (scud) cloud; also a copse; clay, (thick) cloud, idiom thick, thicket. Compare עֲבִי. 		הֶעָבִ֥יםhe-‘ā-ḇîm of the clouds Art | N-cp

H5921עַל־‘al-   (Prep)
H5921 עַל ʻal al properly, the same as עַל used as a preposition (in the singular or plural often with prefix, or as conjunction with a particle following); above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications; above, according to(-ly), after, (as) against, among, and, idiom as, at, because of, beside (the rest of), between, beyond the time, idiom both and, by (reason of), idiom had the charge of, concerning for, in (that), (forth, out) of, (from) (off), (up-) on, over, than, through(-out), to, touching, idiom with., 		עַל־‘al- upon Prep
H776הָאָ֣רֶץhā-’ā-reṣ   (Art | N-fs)
H776 אֶרֶץ ʼerets eh-rets from an unused root probably meaning to be firm; the earth (at large, or partitively a land); idiom common, country, earth, field, ground, land, idiom natins, way, phrase wilderness, world. 		הָאָ֣רֶץhā-’ā-reṣ the earth Art | N-fs

H1933יְהֽוּא׃yə-hū.   (V-Qal-Imperf-3ms)
H1933 הָוָא hâvâʼ haw-vaw or הָוָה; a primitive root (compare אָוָה, הָיָה) supposed to mean properly, to breathe; to be (in the sense of existence); be, idiom have. 		יְהֽוּא׃yə-hū. it shall lie V-Qal-Imperf-3ms
3 If the clouds be full of rain, they empty themselves upon the earth: and if the tree fall toward the south, or toward the north, in the place where the tree falls, there it will be.Ecclesiastes 11:3
Stats
Counts: 184 characters, 31 words, 143 letters, 51 vowels, 92 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: אִם־יִמָּלְא֨וּ הֶעָבִ֥ים גֶּ֙שֶׁם֙ עַל־הָאָ֣רֶץ יָרִ֔יקוּ וְאִם־יִפֹּ֥ול עֵ֛ץ בַּדָּרֹ֖ום וְאִ֣ם בַּצָּפֹ֑ון מְקֹ֛ום שֶׁיִּפֹּ֥ול הָעֵ֖ץ שָׁ֥ם יְהֽוּא׃

Lit: If are full of the clouds rain upon the earth they empty themselves and if falls a tree to the south or the north in the place where falls the tree there it shall lie

KJV: If the clouds be full of rain, they empty themselves upon the earth: and if the tree fall toward the south, or toward the north, in the place where the tree falleth, there it shall be.
References

"the clouds"
1Ki 18:45: It came to pass in the mean while: that the heaven was black with clouds and wind: and there was a great rain. And Ahab rode: and went to Jezreel.
Ps 65:9-13: You visit the earth: and water it: you greatly enrich it with the river of God: which is full of water: you prepare them grain: when you have so provided for it.
Isa 55:10: 11: For as the rain comes down: and the snow from heaven: and returns not there: but waters the earth: and makes it bring forth and bud: that it may give seed to the sower: and bread to the eater:
1Jo 3:17: But whoever has this world's good: and sees His brother have need: and shuts up His bowels of compassion from Him: how dwells the love of God in Him?

"if the tree"
Mt 3:10: Now also the axe is laid to the root of the trees: therefore every tree which brings not forth good fruit is cut down: and cast into the fire.
Lu 13:7: Then said he to the dresser of his vineyard: Look: these 3 years I come seeking fruit on this fig tree: and find none: cut it down; why cumbereth it the ground?
Lu 16:22-26: It came to pass: that the beggar died: and was carried by the angels into Abraham's bosom: the rich man also died: and was buried;

H8104שֹׁמֵ֥רšō-mêr   (V-Qal-Prtcpl-msc)
H8104 שָׁמַר shâmar shaw-mar a primitive root; properly, to hedge about (as with thorns), i.e. guard; generally, to protect, attend to, etc.; beward, be circumspect, take heed (to self), keep(-er, self), mark, look narrowly, observe, preserve, regard, reserve, save (self), sure, (that lay) wait (for), watch(-man). 		שֹׁמֵ֥רšō-mêr He who observes V-Qal-Prtcpl-msc
H7307ר֖וּחַrū-aḥ   (N-cs)
H7307 רוּחַ rûwach roo-akh from רוּחַ; wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions); air, anger, blast, breath, idiom cool, courage, mind, idiom quarter, idiom side, spirit(-ual), tempest, idiom vain, (whirl-) wind(-y). 		ר֖וּחַrū-aḥ the wind N-cs

4 He who observes the wind will not sow; and he who regards the clouds will not reap.Ecclesiastes 11:4
Stats
Counts: 90 characters, 16 words, 72 letters, 23 vowels, 49 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: שֹׁמֵ֥ר ר֖וּחַ לֹ֣א יִזְרָ֑ע וְרֹאֶ֥ה בֶעָבִ֖ים לֹ֥א יִקְצֹֽור׃

Lit: He who observes the wind not will sow and he who regards the clouds not will reap

KJV: He that observeth the wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth the clouds shall not reap.
References

"He that observeth the wind shall not sow; and he that regardeth the clouds shall not reap."
Pr 3:27: not Withhold good from them to whom it is due: when it is in the power of your hand to do it.
Pr 20:4: The sluggard not will plow by reason of the cold; therefore will he beg in harvest: and have nothing.
Pr 22:13: The slothful man says: There is a lion without: I will be killed in the streets.

H834אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer   (Pro-r)
H834 אֲשֶׁר ʼăsher ash-er a primitive relative pronoun (of every gender and number); who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.; idiom after, idiom alike, as (soon as), because, idiom every, for, phrase forasmuch, phrase from whence, phrase how(-soever), idiom if, (so) that ((thing) which, wherein), idiom though, phrase until, phrase whatsoever, when, where (phrase -as, -in, -of, -on, -soever, -with), which, whilst, phrase whither(-soever), who(-m, -soever, -se). As it is indeclinable, it is often accompanied by the personal pronoun expletively, used to show the connection., 		אֲשֶׁ֥ר’ă-šer who Pro-r

H3605הַכֹּֽל׃hak-kōl.   (Art | N-ms)
H3605 כֹּל kôl kole or (Jeremiah 33:8) כּוֹל; from כָּלַל; properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense); (in) all (manner, (ye)), altogether, any (manner), enough, every (one, place, thing), howsoever, as many as, (no-) thing, ought, whatsoever, (the) whole, whoso(-ever). 		הַכֹּֽל׃hak-kōl. everything Art | N-ms
5 As you know'>know not what is the way of the spirit, nor how the bones do grow in the womb of her that is with child: even so you know'>know not the works of God who makes all.Ecclesiastes 11:5
Stats
Rank: #9428 / 31,102 Verses (by popularity)
Counts: 177 characters, 33 words, 133 letters, 46 vowels, 87 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כַּאֲשֶׁ֨ר אֵֽינְךָ֤ יֹודֵ֙עַ֙ מַה־דֶּ֣רֶךְ הָר֔וּחַ כַּעֲצָמִ֖ים בְּבֶ֣טֶן הַמְּלֵאָ֑ה כָּ֗כָה לֹ֤א תֵדַע֙ אֶת־מַעֲשֵׂ֣ה הָֽאֱלֹהִ֔ים אֲשֶׁ֥ר יַעֲשֶׂ֖ה אֶת־הַכֹּֽל׃

Lit: As not you do know what is the way of the wind Or how the bones [grow] in the womb of her who is pregnant so not you do know the works of God who makes everything

KJV: As thou knowest not what is the way of the spirit, [nor] how the bones [do grow] in the womb of her that is with child: even so thou knowest not the works of God who maketh all.
References

"thou knowest not what"
Joh 3:8: The wind blows where it listeth: and you hear the sound thereof: but not canst tell where it comes: and whither it goes: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.

"nor"
Ps 139:14: 15: I will praise you; for I am fearfully and wonderfully made: marvellous are your works; and that my soul knows right well.

"even"
Ec 7:24: That which is far off: and exceeding deep: who can find it out?
Ec 8:17: Then I beheld all the work of God: that a man cannot find out the work that is done under the sun: because though a man labour to seek it out: yet He will not find it; yes further; though a wise man think to know it: yet will He not">not He be able to find it.
Job 5:9: Which does great things and unsearchable; marvellous things without number:
Job 26:5-14: Dead things are formed from under the waters: and the inhabitants thereof.
Job 36:24-33: Remember that you magnify his work: which men look.
Job 37:23: Touching the Almighty: we cannot find him out: he is excellent in power: and in judgment: and in plenty of justice: he not will afflict.
Job 38:4-41: Where were you when I laid the foundations of the earth? declare: if you have understanding.
Job 39:1-41: Know you the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth? or canst you mark when the hinds do calve?
Ps 40:5: Many: O LORD my God: are your wonderful works which you have done: and your thoughts which are to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order to you: if I would declare and speak of them: they are more than can be numbered.
Ps 92:5: O LORD: how great are your works! and your thoughts are very deep.
Ps 104:24: O LORD: how manifold are your works! in wisdom have you made them all: the earth is full of your riches.
Isa 40:28: Have you not known? have you not heard: that the everlasting God: the LORD: the Creator of the ends of the earth: faints not: neither is weary? there is no searching of His understanding.
Ro 11:33: O the depth of the riches both of the wisdom and knowledge of God! how unsearchable are His judgments: and His ways past finding out!

 בַּבֹּ֙קֶר֙ זְרַ֣ע אֶת־זַרְעֶ֔ךָ וְלָעֶ֖רֶב אַל־תַּנַּ֣ח יָדֶ֑ךָ כִּי֩ אֵֽינְךָ֨ יֹודֵ֜ע אֵ֣י זֶ֤ה יִכְשָׁר֙ הֲזֶ֣ה אֹו־זֶ֔ה וְאִם־שְׁנֵיהֶ֥ם כְּאֶחָ֖ד טֹובִֽים׃

6 In the morning sow your seed, and in the evening not withhold your hand: for you know not whether will prosper, either this or that, or whether they both will be alike good.Ecclesiastes 11:6
Stats
Counts: 179 characters, 29 words, 142 letters, 48 vowels, 94 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: בַּבֹּ֙קֶר֙ זְרַ֣ע אֶת־זַרְעֶ֔ךָ וְלָעֶ֖רֶב אַל־תַּנַּ֣ח יָדֶ֑ךָ כִּי֩ אֵֽינְךָ֨ יֹודֵ֜ע אֵ֣י זֶ֤ה יִכְשָׁר֙ הֲזֶ֣ה אֹו־זֶ֔ה וְאִם־שְׁנֵיהֶ֥ם כְּאֶחָ֖ד טֹובִֽים׃

Lit: In the morning sow your seed and in the evening not do withhold your hand for not you do know where morning will prosper this one or this one Or the two of them as one will be good

KJV: In the morning sow thy seed, and in the evening withhold not thine hand: for thou knowest not whether shall prosper, either this or that, or whether they both shall be alike good.
References

"sow"
Ec 9:10: Whatever your hand finds to do: do it with your might; for there is no work: nor device: nor knowledge: nor wisdom: in the grave: whither you go.
Isa 55:10: For as the rain comes down: and the snow from heaven: and returns not there: but waters the earth: and makes it bring forth and bud: that it may give seed to the sower: and bread to the eater:
Ho 10:12: Sow to yourselves in righteousness: reap in mercy; break up your fallow ground: for it is time to seek the LORD: till He come and rain righteousness upon you.
Mr 4:26-29: He said: So is the kingdom of God: as if a man should cast seed into the ground;
Joh 4:36-38: he who reaps'>reaps receives wages: and gathers fruit to life eternal: that both he who sows and he who reaps'>reaps may rejoice together.
2Co 9:6: But this I say: He which sows'>sows sparingly will reap also sparingly; and he which sows'>sows bountifully will reap also bountifully.
2Ti 4:2: Preach the word; be instant in season: out of season; reprove: rebuke: exhort with all longsuffering and doctrine.

"thou knowest"

1Co 3:5-7: Who then is Paul: and who is Apollos: but ministers by whom you believed: even as the Lord gave to every man?

H8121הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃haš-šā-meš.   (Art | N-cs)
H8121 שֶׁמֶשׁ shemesh sheh-mesh from an unused root meaning to be brilliant; the sun; by implication, the east; figuratively, a ray, i.e. (architectural) a notched battlement; phrase east side(-ward), sun (rising), phrase west(-ward), window. 7 Truly the light is sweet, and a pleasant thing it is for the eyes to look the sun:Ecclesiastes 11:7
Stats
Counts: 86 characters, 15 words, 65 letters, 23 vowels, 42 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: וּמָתֹ֖וק הָאֹ֑ור וְטֹ֥וב לַֽעֵינַ֖יִם לִרְאֹ֥ות אֶת־הַשָּֽׁמֶשׁ׃

Lit: And is sweet the Truly light and it is pleasant for the eyes to behold the sun

KJV: Truly the light is sweet, and a pleasant [thing it is] for the eyes to behold the sun:
References

"the light"
Job 33:28: 30: He will deliver his soul from going into the pit: and his life will see the light.
Ps 56:13: For you have delivered my soul from death: will not you deliver my feet from falling: that I may walk before God in the light of the living?
Pr 15:30: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart: and a good report makes the bones fat.
Pr 29:13: The poor and the deceitful man meet together: the LORD lightens both their eyes.

"a pleasant"
Ec 7:11: Wisdom is good with an inheritance: and by it there is profit to them that see the sun.
Ps 84:11: For the LORD God is a sun and shield: the LORD will give grace and glory: no good thing will He withhold from them that walk uprightly.
Mt 5:45: That you may be the children of your Father which is in heaven: for He makes His sun to rise on the evil and on the good: and sends rain on the just and on the unjust.

8 But if a man live many years, and rejoice in them all; yet let him remember the days of darkness; for they will be many. All that comes is vanity.Ecclesiastes 11:8
Stats
Counts: 150 characters, 24 words, 114 letters, 40 vowels, 74 consonants
Translation
Hebrew: כִּ֣י אִם־שָׁנִ֥ים הַרְבֵּ֛ה יִחְיֶ֥ה הָאָדָ֖ם בְּכֻלָּ֣ם יִשְׂמָ֑ח וְיִזְכֹּר֙ אֶת־יְמֵ֣י הַחֹ֔שֶׁךְ כִּֽי־הַרְבֵּ֥ה יִהְי֖וּ כָּל־שֶׁבָּ֥א הָֽבֶל׃

Lit: But if years many lives a man in them all And rejoices and yet let him remember the days of darkness for many They will be all that is coming is vanity

KJV: But if a man live many years, and rejoice in them all; yet let him remember the days of darkness; for they shall be many. All that cometh [is] vanity.
References

"if a man"
Ec 6:6: Yes: though he live a000 years twice told: yet has he seen no good: not do all go to one place?
Ec 8:12: Though a sinner do evil 100 times: and His days be prolonged: yet surely I know that it will be well with them that fear God: which fear before Him:

"rejoice"
Ec 3:12: 13: I know that there is no good in them: but for a man to rejoice: and to do good in his life.
Ec 5:18-20: Look that which I have seen: it is good and comely for one to eat and to drink: and to enjoy the good of all His labour that He takes under the sun all the days of His life: which God gives Him: for it is His portion.
Ec 8:15: Then I commended mirth: because a man has no better thing under the sun: than to eat: and to drink: and to be merry: for that will abide with Him of His labour the days of His life: which God gives Him under the sun.

"yet"
Ec 7:14: In the day of prosperity be joyful: but in the day of adversity consider: God also has set the one over against the other: to the end that man should not findhing after Him.
Ec 12:1-5: Remember now your Creator in the days of your youth: while the evil days not come: nor the years draw nigh: when you will say: I have no pleasure in them;
De 32:29: O that they were wise: that they understood this: that they would consider their latter end!
Job 10:22: A land of darkness: as darkness itself; and of the shadow of death: without any order: and where the light is as darkness.
Job 14:10: But man dies: and wasts away: yes: man gives up the ghost: and where is he?
Job 15:23: He wanders abroad for bread: saying: Where is it? he knows that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
Job 18:18: He will be driven from light into darkness: and chased out of the world.
Jer 13:16: Give glory to the LORD your God: before He cause darkness: and before your feet stumble upon the dark mountains: and: while you look for light: He turn it into the shadow of death: and make it gross darkness.
Joe 2:2: A day of darkness and of gloominess: a day of clouds and of thick darkness: as the morning spread upon the mountains: a great people and a strong; there has not been ever the like: neither will be any more after it: even to the years of many generations.
Mt 22:13: Then said the king to the servants: Bind him hand and foot: and take him away: and cast him into outer darkness; there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.
Joh 12:35: Then Jesus said to them: Yet a little while is the light with you. Walk while you have the light: lest darkness come upon you: for He that'>He who walks in darkness knows not whither He goeth.
Jude 1:18: How that they told you there should be mockers in the last time: who should walk after their own ungodly lusts.

"All that"
Ec 2:1-11: 15: 17: 19: 21-23: 26: I said in my heart: Go to now: I will prove you with mirth: therefore enjoy pleasure: and: look: this also is vanity.
Ec 4:8: 16: There is one alone: and there is not a second; yes: he has neither child nor brother: yet is there no end of all his labour; neither is his eye satisfied with riches; neither says he: For whom do I labour: and bereave my soul of good? This is also vanity: yes: it is a sore travail.
Ec 5:15: 16: As he came forth of his mother's womb: naked will he return to go as he came: and will not takehing of his labour: which he may carry away in his hand.
Ec 6:11: Seeing there be many things that increase vanity: what is man the better?

H3117 יוֹם yôwm yome from an unused root meaning to be hot; a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb); age, phrase always, phrase chronicals, continually(-ance), daily, ((birth-), each, to) day, (now a, two) days (agone), phrase elder, idiom end, phrase evening, phrase (for) ever(-lasting, -more), idiom full, life, as (so) long as (... live), (even) now, phrase old, phrase outlived, phrase perpetually, presently, phrase remaineth, idiom required, season, idiom since, space, then, (process of) time, phrase as at other times, phrase in trouble, weather, (as) when, (a, the, within a) while (that), idiom whole (phrase age), (full) year(-ly), phrase younger. 		בִּימֵ֣יbî-mê in the days Prep-b | N-mpc
